tinyexr.h

2 #define TINYEXR_H_

68 
69 //
70 //
71 // Do this:
72 // #define TINYEXR_IMPLEMENTATION
73 // before you include this file in *one* C or C++ file to create the
74 // implementation.
75 //
76 // // i.e. it should look like this:
77 // #include ...
78 // #include ...
79 // #include ...
80 // #define TINYEXR_IMPLEMENTATION
81 // #include "tinyexr.h"
82 //
83 //
84 
85 #include <stddef.h> // for size_t
86 #include <stdint.h> // guess stdint.h is available(C99)
87 
88 #ifdef __cplusplus
89 extern "C" {
90 #endif
91 
92  // Use embedded miniz or not to decode ZIP format pixel. Linking with zlib
93  // required if this flas is 0.
94 #ifndef TINYEXR_USE_MINIZ
95 #define TINYEXR_USE_MINIZ (1)
96 #endif
97 
98 // Disable PIZ comporession when applying cpplint.
99 #ifndef TINYEXR_USE_PIZ
100 #define TINYEXR_USE_PIZ (1)
101 #endif
102 
103 #ifndef TINYEXR_USE_ZFP
104 #define TINYEXR_USE_ZFP (0) // TinyEXR extension.
105 // http://computation.llnl.gov/projects/floating-point-compression
106 #endif
107 
108 #ifndef TINYEXR_USE_THREAD
109 #define TINYEXR_USE_THREAD (0) // No threaded loading.
110 // http://computation.llnl.gov/projects/floating-point-compression
111 #endif
112 
113 #ifndef TINYEXR_USE_OPENMP
114 #ifdef _OPENMP
115 #define TINYEXR_USE_OPENMP (1)
116 #else
117 #define TINYEXR_USE_OPENMP (0)
118 #endif
119 #endif
120 
121 #define TINYEXR_SUCCESS (0)
122 #define TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_MAGIC_NUMBER (-1)
123 #define TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_EXR_VERSION (-2)
124 #define TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-3)
125 #define TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA (-4)
126 #define TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_FILE (-5)
127 #define TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER (-6)
128 #define TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_OPEN_FILE (-7)
129 #define TINYEXR_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT (-8)
130 #define TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_HEADER (-9)
131 #define TINYEXR_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE (-10)
132 #define TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_WRITE_FILE (-11)
133 #define TINYEXR_ERROR_SERIALZATION_FAILED (-12)
134 #define TINYEXR_ERROR_LAYER_NOT_FOUND (-13)
135 
136 // @note { OpenEXR file format: http://www.openexr.com/openexrfilelayout.pdf }
137 
138 // pixel type: possible values are: UINT = 0 HALF = 1 FLOAT = 2
139 #define TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_UINT (0)
140 #define TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF (1)
141 #define TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT (2)
142 
143 #define TINYEXR_MAX_HEADER_ATTRIBUTES (1024)
144 #define TINYEXR_MAX_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTES (128)
145 
146 #define TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_NONE (0)
147 #define TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_RLE (1)
148 #define TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIPS (2)
149 #define TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIP (3)
150 #define TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PIZ (4)
151 #define TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZFP (128) // TinyEXR extension
152 
153 #define TINYEXR_ZFP_COMPRESSIONTYPE_RATE (0)
154 #define TINYEXR_ZFP_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PRECISION (1)
155 #define TINYEXR_ZFP_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ACCURACY (2)
156 
157 #define TINYEXR_TILE_ONE_LEVEL (0)
158 #define TINYEXR_TILE_MIPMAP_LEVELS (1)
159 #define TINYEXR_TILE_RIPMAP_LEVELS (2)
160 
161 #define TINYEXR_TILE_ROUND_DOWN (0)
162 #define TINYEXR_TILE_ROUND_UP (1)
163 
164  typedef struct _EXRVersion {
165  int version; // this must be 2
166  // tile format image;
167  // not zero for only a single-part "normal" tiled file (according to spec.)
168  int tiled;
169  int long_name; // long name attribute
170  // deep image(EXR 2.0);
171  // for a multi-part file, indicates that at least one part is of type deep* (according to spec.)
172  int non_image;
173  int multipart; // multi-part(EXR 2.0)
174  } EXRVersion;
175 
176  typedef struct _EXRAttribute {
177  char name[256]; // name and type are up to 255 chars long.
178  char type[256];
179  unsigned char *value; // uint8_t*
180  int size;
181  int pad0;
182  } EXRAttribute;
183 
184  typedef struct _EXRChannelInfo {
185  char name[256]; // less than 255 bytes long
186  int pixel_type;
187  int x_sampling;
188  int y_sampling;
189  unsigned char p_linear;
190  unsigned char pad[3];
191  } EXRChannelInfo;
192 
193  typedef struct _EXRTile {
194  int offset_x;
195  int offset_y;
196  int level_x;
197  int level_y;
198 
199  int width; // actual width in a tile.
200  int height; // actual height int a tile.
201 
202  unsigned char **images; // image[channels][pixels]
203  } EXRTile;
204 
205  typedef struct _EXRBox2i {
206  int min_x;
207  int min_y;
208  int max_x;
209  int max_y;
210  } EXRBox2i;
211 
212  typedef struct _EXRHeader {
213  float pixel_aspect_ratio;
214  int line_order;
215  EXRBox2i data_window;
216  EXRBox2i display_window;
217  float screen_window_center[2];
218  float screen_window_width;
219 
220  int chunk_count;
221 
222  // Properties for tiled format(`tiledesc`).
223  int tiled;
224  int tile_size_x;
225  int tile_size_y;
226  int tile_level_mode;
227  int tile_rounding_mode;
228 
229  int long_name;
230  // for a single-part file, agree with the version field bit 11
231  // for a multi-part file, it is consistent with the type of part
232  int non_image;
233  int multipart;
234  unsigned int header_len;
235 
236  // Custom attributes(exludes required attributes(e.g. `channels`,
237  // `compression`, etc)
238  int num_custom_attributes;
239  EXRAttribute *custom_attributes; // array of EXRAttribute. size =
240  // `num_custom_attributes`.
241 
242  EXRChannelInfo *channels; // [num_channels]
243 
244  int *pixel_types; // Loaded pixel type(TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_*) of `images` for
245  // each channel. This is overwritten with `requested_pixel_types` when
246  // loading.
247  int num_channels;
248 
249  int compression_type; // compression type(TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_*)
250  int *requested_pixel_types; // Filled initially by
251  // ParseEXRHeaderFrom(Meomory|File), then users
252  // can edit it(only valid for HALF pixel type
253  // channel)
254  // name attribute required for multipart files;
255  // must be unique and non empty (according to spec.);
256  // use EXRSetNameAttr for setting value;
257  // max 255 character allowed - excluding terminating zero
258  char name[256];
259  } EXRHeader;
260 
261  typedef struct _EXRMultiPartHeader {
262  int num_headers;
263  EXRHeader *headers;
264 
265  } EXRMultiPartHeader;
266 
267  typedef struct _EXRImage {
268  EXRTile *tiles; // Tiled pixel data. The application must reconstruct image
269  // from tiles manually. NULL if scanline format.
270  struct _EXRImage* next_level; // NULL if scanline format or image is the last level.
271  int level_x; // x level index
272  int level_y; // y level index
273 
274  unsigned char **images; // image[channels][pixels]. NULL if tiled format.
275 
276  int width;
277  int height;
278  int num_channels;
279 
280  // Properties for tile format.
281  int num_tiles;
282 
283  } EXRImage;
284 
285  typedef struct _EXRMultiPartImage {
286  int num_images;
287  EXRImage *images;
288 
289  } EXRMultiPartImage;
290 
291  typedef struct _DeepImage {
292  const char **channel_names;
293  float ***image; // image[channels][scanlines][samples]
294  int **offset_table; // offset_table[scanline][offsets]
295  int num_channels;
296  int width;
297  int height;
298  int pad0;
299  } DeepImage;
300 
301  // @deprecated { For backward compatibility. Not recommended to use. }
302  // Loads single-frame OpenEXR image. Assume EXR image contains A(single channel
303  // alpha) or RGB(A) channels.
304  // Application must free image data as returned by `out_rgba`
305  // Result image format is: float x RGBA x width x hight
306  // Returns negative value and may set error string in `err` when there's an
307  // error
308  extern int LoadEXR(float **out_rgba, int *width, int *height,
309  const char *filename, const char **err);
310 
311  // Loads single-frame OpenEXR image by specifying layer name. Assume EXR image
312  // contains A(single channel alpha) or RGB(A) channels. Application must free
313  // image data as returned by `out_rgba` Result image format is: float x RGBA x
314  // width x hight Returns negative value and may set error string in `err` when
315  // there's an error When the specified layer name is not found in the EXR file,
316  // the function will return `TINYEXR_ERROR_LAYER_NOT_FOUND`.
317  extern int LoadEXRWithLayer(float **out_rgba, int *width, int *height,
318  const char *filename, const char *layer_name,
319  const char **err);
320 
321  //
322  // Get layer infos from EXR file.
323  //
324  // @param[out] layer_names List of layer names. Application must free memory
325  // after using this.
326  // @param[out] num_layers The number of layers
327  // @param[out] err Error string(will be filled when the function returns error
328  // code). Free it using FreeEXRErrorMessage after using this value.
329  //
330  // @return TINYEXR_SUCCEES upon success.
331  //
332  extern int EXRLayers(const char *filename, const char **layer_names[],
333  int *num_layers, const char **err);
334 
335  // @deprecated { to be removed. }
336  // Simple wrapper API for ParseEXRHeaderFromFile.
337  // checking given file is a EXR file(by just look up header)
338  // @return TINYEXR_SUCCEES for EXR image, TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_HEADER for
339  // others
340  extern int IsEXR(const char *filename);
341 
342  // @deprecated { to be removed. }
343  // Saves single-frame OpenEXR image. Assume EXR image contains RGB(A) channels.
344  // components must be 1(Grayscale), 3(RGB) or 4(RGBA).
345  // Input image format is: `float x width x height`, or `float x RGB(A) x width x
346  // hight`
347  // Save image as fp16(HALF) format when `save_as_fp16` is positive non-zero
348  // value.
349  // Save image as fp32(FLOAT) format when `save_as_fp16` is 0.
350  // Use ZIP compression by default.
351  // Returns negative value and may set error string in `err` when there's an
352  // error
353  extern int SaveEXR(const float *data, const int width, const int height,
354  const int components, const int save_as_fp16,
355  const char *filename, const char **err);
356 
357  // Returns the number of resolution levels of the image (including the base)
358  extern int EXRNumLevels(const EXRImage* exr_image);
359 
360  // Initialize EXRHeader struct
361  extern void InitEXRHeader(EXRHeader *exr_header);
362 
363  // Set name attribute of EXRHeader struct (it makes a copy)
364  extern void EXRSetNameAttr(EXRHeader *exr_header, const char* name);
365 
366  // Initialize EXRImage struct
367  extern void InitEXRImage(EXRImage *exr_image);
368 
369  // Frees internal data of EXRHeader struct
370  extern int FreeEXRHeader(EXRHeader *exr_header);
371 
372  // Frees internal data of EXRImage struct
373  extern int FreeEXRImage(EXRImage *exr_image);
374 
375  // Frees error message
376  extern void FreeEXRErrorMessage(const char *msg);
377 
378  // Parse EXR version header of a file.
379  extern int ParseEXRVersionFromFile(EXRVersion *version, const char *filename);
380 
381  // Parse EXR version header from memory-mapped EXR data.
382  extern int ParseEXRVersionFromMemory(EXRVersion *version,
383  const unsigned char *memory, size_t size);
384 
385  // Parse single-part OpenEXR header from a file and initialize `EXRHeader`.
386  // When there was an error message, Application must free `err` with
387  // FreeEXRErrorMessage()
388  extern int ParseEXRHeaderFromFile(EXRHeader *header, const EXRVersion *version,
389  const char *filename, const char **err);
390 
391  // Parse single-part OpenEXR header from a memory and initialize `EXRHeader`.
392  // When there was an error message, Application must free `err` with
393  // FreeEXRErrorMessage()
394  extern int ParseEXRHeaderFromMemory(EXRHeader *header,
395  const EXRVersion *version,
396  const unsigned char *memory, size_t size,
397  const char **err);
398 
399  // Parse multi-part OpenEXR headers from a file and initialize `EXRHeader*`
400  // array.
401  // When there was an error message, Application must free `err` with
402  // FreeEXRErrorMessage()
403  extern int ParseEXRMultipartHeaderFromFile(EXRHeader ***headers,
404  int *num_headers,
405  const EXRVersion *version,
406  const char *filename,
407  const char **err);
408 
409  // Parse multi-part OpenEXR headers from a memory and initialize `EXRHeader*`
410  // array
411  // When there was an error message, Application must free `err` with
412  // FreeEXRErrorMessage()
413  extern int ParseEXRMultipartHeaderFromMemory(EXRHeader ***headers,
414  int *num_headers,
415  const EXRVersion *version,
416  const unsigned char *memory,
417  size_t size, const char **err);
418 
419  // Loads single-part OpenEXR image from a file.
420  // Application must setup `ParseEXRHeaderFromFile` before calling this function.
421  // Application can free EXRImage using `FreeEXRImage`
422  // Returns negative value and may set error string in `err` when there's an
423  // error
424  // When there was an error message, Application must free `err` with
425  // FreeEXRErrorMessage()
426  extern int LoadEXRImageFromFile(EXRImage *image, const EXRHeader *header,
427  const char *filename, const char **err);
428 
429  // Loads single-part OpenEXR image from a memory.
430  // Application must setup `EXRHeader` with
431  // `ParseEXRHeaderFromMemory` before calling this function.
432  // Application can free EXRImage using `FreeEXRImage`
433  // Returns negative value and may set error string in `err` when there's an
434  // error
435  // When there was an error message, Application must free `err` with
436  // FreeEXRErrorMessage()
437  extern int LoadEXRImageFromMemory(EXRImage *image, const EXRHeader *header,
438  const unsigned char *memory,
439  const size_t size, const char **err);
440 
441  // Loads multi-part OpenEXR image from a file.
442  // Application must setup `ParseEXRMultipartHeaderFromFile` before calling this
443  // function.
444  // Application can free EXRImage using `FreeEXRImage`
445  // Returns negative value and may set error string in `err` when there's an
446  // error
447  // When there was an error message, Application must free `err` with
448  // FreeEXRErrorMessage()
449  extern int LoadEXRMultipartImageFromFile(EXRImage *images,
450  const EXRHeader **headers,
451  unsigned int num_parts,
452  const char *filename,
453  const char **err);
454 
455  // Loads multi-part OpenEXR image from a memory.
456  // Application must setup `EXRHeader*` array with
457  // `ParseEXRMultipartHeaderFromMemory` before calling this function.
458  // Application can free EXRImage using `FreeEXRImage`
459  // Returns negative value and may set error string in `err` when there's an
460  // error
461  // When there was an error message, Application must free `err` with
462  // FreeEXRErrorMessage()
463  extern int LoadEXRMultipartImageFromMemory(EXRImage *images,
464  const EXRHeader **headers,
465  unsigned int num_parts,
466  const unsigned char *memory,
467  const size_t size, const char **err);
468 
469  // Saves multi-channel, single-frame OpenEXR image to a file.
470  // Returns negative value and may set error string in `err` when there's an
471  // error
472  // When there was an error message, Application must free `err` with
473  // FreeEXRErrorMessage()
474  extern int SaveEXRImageToFile(const EXRImage *image,
475  const EXRHeader *exr_header, const char *filename,
476  const char **err);
477 
478  // Saves multi-channel, single-frame OpenEXR image to a memory.
479  // Image is compressed using EXRImage.compression value.
480  // Return the number of bytes if success.
481  // Return zero and will set error string in `err` when there's an
482  // error.
483  // When there was an error message, Application must free `err` with
484  // FreeEXRErrorMessage()
485  extern size_t SaveEXRImageToMemory(const EXRImage *image,
486  const EXRHeader *exr_header,
487  unsigned char **memory, const char **err);
488 
489  // Saves multi-channel, multi-frame OpenEXR image to a memory.
490  // Image is compressed using EXRImage.compression value.
491  // File global attributes (eg. display_window) must be set in the first header.
492  // Returns negative value and may set error string in `err` when there's an
493  // error
494  // When there was an error message, Application must free `err` with
495  // FreeEXRErrorMessage()
496  extern int SaveEXRMultipartImageToFile(const EXRImage *images,
497  const EXRHeader **exr_headers,
498  unsigned int num_parts,
499  const char *filename, const char **err);
500 
501  // Saves multi-channel, multi-frame OpenEXR image to a memory.
502  // Image is compressed using EXRImage.compression value.
503  // File global attributes (eg. display_window) must be set in the first header.
504  // Return the number of bytes if success.
505  // Return zero and will set error string in `err` when there's an
506  // error.
507  // When there was an error message, Application must free `err` with
508  // FreeEXRErrorMessage()
509  extern size_t SaveEXRMultipartImageToMemory(const EXRImage *images,
510  const EXRHeader **exr_headers,
511  unsigned int num_parts,
512  unsigned char **memory, const char **err);
513  // Loads single-frame OpenEXR deep image.
514  // Application must free memory of variables in DeepImage(image, offset_table)
515  // Returns negative value and may set error string in `err` when there's an
516  // error
517  // When there was an error message, Application must free `err` with
518  // FreeEXRErrorMessage()
519  extern int LoadDeepEXR(DeepImage *out_image, const char *filename,
520  const char **err);
521 
522  // NOT YET IMPLEMENTED:
523  // Saves single-frame OpenEXR deep image.
524  // Returns negative value and may set error string in `err` when there's an
525  // error
526  // extern int SaveDeepEXR(const DeepImage *in_image, const char *filename,
527  // const char **err);
528 
529  // NOT YET IMPLEMENTED:
530  // Loads multi-part OpenEXR deep image.
531  // Application must free memory of variables in DeepImage(image, offset_table)
532  // extern int LoadMultiPartDeepEXR(DeepImage **out_image, int num_parts, const
533  // char *filename,
534  // const char **err);
535 
536  // For emscripten.
537  // Loads single-frame OpenEXR image from memory. Assume EXR image contains
538  // RGB(A) channels.
539  // Returns negative value and may set error string in `err` when there's an
540  // error
541  // When there was an error message, Application must free `err` with
542  // FreeEXRErrorMessage()
543  extern int LoadEXRFromMemory(float **out_rgba, int *width, int *height,
544  const unsigned char *memory, size_t size,
545  const char **err);
546 
547 #ifdef __cplusplus
548 }
549 #endif
550 
551 #endif // TINYEXR_H_
552 
553 #ifdef TINYEXR_IMPLEMENTATION
554 #ifndef TINYEXR_IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED
555 #define TINYEXR_IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED
556 
557 #ifdef _WIN32
558 
559 #ifndef WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
560 #define WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
561 #endif
562 #include <windows.h> // for UTF-8
563 
564 #endif
565 
566 #include <algorithm>
567 #include <cassert>
568 #include <cstdio>
569 #include <cstdlib>
570 #include <cstring>
571 #include <sstream>
572 
573 // #include <iostream> // debug
574 
575 #include <limits>
576 #include <string>
577 #include <vector>
578 #include <set>
579 
580 // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5047971/how-do-i-check-for-c11-support
581 #if __cplusplus > 199711L || (defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1900)
582 #define TINYEXR_HAS_CXX11 (1)
583 // C++11
584 #include <cstdint>
585 
586 #if TINYEXR_USE_THREAD
587 #include <atomic>
588 #include <thread>
589 #endif
590 
591 #endif // __cplusplus > 199711L
592 
593 #if TINYEXR_USE_OPENMP
594 #include <omp.h>
595 #endif
596 
597 #if TINYEXR_USE_MINIZ
598 #else
599 // Issue #46. Please include your own zlib-compatible API header before
600 // including `tinyexr.h`
601 //#include "zlib.h"
602 #endif
603 
604 #if TINYEXR_USE_ZFP
605 
606 #ifdef __clang__
607 #pragma clang diagnostic push
608 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Weverything"
609 #endif
610 
611 #include "zfp.h"
612 
613 #ifdef __clang__
614 #pragma clang diagnostic pop
615 #endif
616 
617 #endif
618 
619 namespace tinyexr {
620 
621 #if __cplusplus > 199711L
622  // C++11
623  typedef uint64_t tinyexr_uint64;
624  typedef int64_t tinyexr_int64;
625 #else
626  // Although `long long` is not a standard type pre C++11, assume it is defined
627  // as a compiler's extension.
628 #ifdef __clang__
629 #pragma clang diagnostic push
630 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wc++11-long-long"
631 #endif
632  typedef unsigned long long tinyexr_uint64;
633  typedef long long tinyexr_int64;
634 #ifdef __clang__
635 #pragma clang diagnostic pop
636 #endif
637 #endif
638 
639 #if TINYEXR_USE_MINIZ
640 
641  namespace miniz {
642 
643 #ifdef __clang__
644 #pragma clang diagnostic push
645 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wc++11-long-long"
646 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wold-style-cast"
647 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wpadded"
648 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wsign-conversion"
649 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wc++11-extensions"
650 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wconversion"
651 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunused-function"
652 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wc++98-compat-pedantic"
653 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wundef"
654 
655 #if __has_warning("-Wcomma")
656 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wcomma"
657 #endif
658 
659 #if __has_warning("-Wmacro-redefined")
660 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wmacro-redefined"
661 #endif
662 
663 #if __has_warning("-Wcast-qual")
664 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wcast-qual"
665 #endif
666 
667 #if __has_warning("-Wzero-as-null-pointer-constant")
668 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wzero-as-null-pointer-constant"
669 #endif
670 
671 #if __has_warning("-Wtautological-constant-compare")
672 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wtautological-constant-compare"
673 #endif
674 
675 #if __has_warning("-Wextra-semi-stmt")
676 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wextra-semi-stmt"
677 #endif
678 
679 #endif
680 
681  /* miniz.c v1.15 - public domain deflate/inflate, zlib-subset, ZIP
682  reading/writing/appending, PNG writing
683  See "unlicense" statement at the end of this file.
684  Rich Geldreich <richgel99@gmail.com>, last updated Oct. 13, 2013
685  Implements RFC 1950: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1950.txt and RFC 1951:
686  http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1951.txt
687 
688  Most API's defined in miniz.c are optional. For example, to disable the
689  archive related functions just define
690  MINIZ_NO_ARCHIVE_APIS, or to get rid of all stdio usage define MINIZ_NO_STDIO
691  (see the list below for more macros).
692 
693  * Change History
694  10/13/13 v1.15 r4 - Interim bugfix release while I work on the next major
695  release with Zip64 support (almost there!):
696  - Critical fix for the MZ_ZIP_FLAG_DO_NOT_SORT_CENTRAL_DIRECTORY bug
697  (thanks kahmyong.moon@hp.com) which could cause locate files to not find
698  files. This bug
699  would only have occurred in earlier versions if you explicitly used this
700  flag, OR if you used mz_zip_extract_archive_file_to_heap() or
701  mz_zip_add_mem_to_archive_file_in_place()
702  (which used this flag). If you can't switch to v1.15 but want to fix
703  this bug, just remove the uses of this flag from both helper funcs (and of
704  course don't use the flag).
705  - Bugfix in mz_zip_reader_extract_to_mem_no_alloc() from kymoon when
706  pUser_read_buf is not NULL and compressed size is > uncompressed size
707  - Fixing mz_zip_reader_extract_*() funcs so they don't try to extract
708  compressed data from directory entries, to account for weird zipfiles which
709  contain zero-size compressed data on dir entries.
710  Hopefully this fix won't cause any issues on weird zip archives,
711  because it assumes the low 16-bits of zip external attributes are DOS
712  attributes (which I believe they always are in practice).
713  - Fixing mz_zip_reader_is_file_a_directory() so it doesn't check the
714  internal attributes, just the filename and external attributes
715  - mz_zip_reader_init_file() - missing MZ_FCLOSE() call if the seek failed
716  - Added cmake support for Linux builds which builds all the examples,
717  tested with clang v3.3 and gcc v4.6.
718  - Clang fix for tdefl_write_image_to_png_file_in_memory() from toffaletti
719  - Merged MZ_FORCEINLINE fix from hdeanclark
720  - Fix <time.h> include before config #ifdef, thanks emil.brink
721  - Added tdefl_write_image_to_png_file_in_memory_ex(): supports Y flipping
722  (super useful for OpenGL apps), and explicit control over the compression
723  level (so you can
724  set it to 1 for real-time compression).
725  - Merged in some compiler fixes from paulharris's github repro.
726  - Retested this build under Windows (VS 2010, including static analysis),
727  tcc 0.9.26, gcc v4.6 and clang v3.3.
728  - Added example6.c, which dumps an image of the mandelbrot set to a PNG
729  file.
730  - Modified example2 to help test the
731  MZ_ZIP_FLAG_DO_NOT_SORT_CENTRAL_DIRECTORY flag more.
732  - In r3: Bugfix to mz_zip_writer_add_file() found during merge: Fix
733  possible src file fclose() leak if alignment bytes+local header file write
734  faiiled
735  - In r4: Minor bugfix to mz_zip_writer_add_from_zip_reader():
736  Was pushing the wrong central dir header offset, appears harmless in this
737  release, but it became a problem in the zip64 branch
738  5/20/12 v1.14 - MinGW32/64 GCC 4.6.1 compiler fixes: added MZ_FORCEINLINE,
739  #include <time.h> (thanks fermtect).
740  5/19/12 v1.13 - From jason@cornsyrup.org and kelwert@mtu.edu - Fix
741  mz_crc32() so it doesn't compute the wrong CRC-32's when mz_ulong is 64-bit.
742  - Temporarily/locally slammed in "typedef unsigned long mz_ulong" and
743  re-ran a randomized regression test on ~500k files.
744  - Eliminated a bunch of warnings when compiling with GCC 32-bit/64.
745  - Ran all examples, miniz.c, and tinfl.c through MSVC 2008's /analyze
746  (static analysis) option and fixed all warnings (except for the silly
747  "Use of the comma-operator in a tested expression.." analysis warning,
748  which I purposely use to work around a MSVC compiler warning).
749  - Created 32-bit and 64-bit Codeblocks projects/workspace. Built and
750  tested Linux executables. The codeblocks workspace is compatible with
751  Linux+Win32/x64.
752  - Added miniz_tester solution/project, which is a useful little app
753  derived from LZHAM's tester app that I use as part of the regression test.
754  - Ran miniz.c and tinfl.c through another series of regression testing on
755  ~500,000 files and archives.
756  - Modified example5.c so it purposely disables a bunch of high-level
757  functionality (MINIZ_NO_STDIO, etc.). (Thanks to corysama for the
758  MINIZ_NO_STDIO bug report.)
759  - Fix ftell() usage in examples so they exit with an error on files which
760  are too large (a limitation of the examples, not miniz itself).
761  4/12/12 v1.12 - More comments, added low-level example5.c, fixed a couple
762  minor level_and_flags issues in the archive API's.
763  level_and_flags can now be set to MZ_DEFAULT_COMPRESSION. Thanks to Bruce
764  Dawson <bruced@valvesoftware.com> for the feedback/bug report.
765  5/28/11 v1.11 - Added statement from unlicense.org
766  5/27/11 v1.10 - Substantial compressor optimizations:
767  - Level 1 is now ~4x faster than before. The L1 compressor's throughput
768  now varies between 70-110MB/sec. on a
769  - Core i7 (actual throughput varies depending on the type of data, and x64
770  vs. x86).
771  - Improved baseline L2-L9 compression perf. Also, greatly improved
772  compression perf. issues on some file types.
773  - Refactored the compression code for better readability and
774  maintainability.
775  - Added level 10 compression level (L10 has slightly better ratio than
776  level 9, but could have a potentially large
777  drop in throughput on some files).
778  5/15/11 v1.09 - Initial stable release.
779 
780  * Low-level Deflate/Inflate implementation notes:
781 
782  Compression: Use the "tdefl" API's. The compressor supports raw, static,
783  and dynamic blocks, lazy or
784  greedy parsing, match length filtering, RLE-only, and Huffman-only streams.
785  It performs and compresses
786  approximately as well as zlib.
787 
788  Decompression: Use the "tinfl" API's. The entire decompressor is
789  implemented as a single function
790  coroutine: see tinfl_decompress(). It supports decompression into a 32KB
791  (or larger power of 2) wrapping buffer, or into a memory
792  block large enough to hold the entire file.
793 
794  The low-level tdefl/tinfl API's do not make any use of dynamic memory
795  allocation.
796 
797  * zlib-style API notes:
798 
799  miniz.c implements a fairly large subset of zlib. There's enough
800  functionality present for it to be a drop-in
801  zlib replacement in many apps:
802  The z_stream struct, optional memory allocation callbacks
803  deflateInit/deflateInit2/deflate/deflateReset/deflateEnd/deflateBound
804  inflateInit/inflateInit2/inflate/inflateEnd
805  compress, compress2, compressBound, uncompress
806  CRC-32, Adler-32 - Using modern, minimal code size, CPU cache friendly
807  routines.
808  Supports raw deflate streams or standard zlib streams with adler-32
809  checking.
810 
811  Limitations:
812  The callback API's are not implemented yet. No support for gzip headers or
813  zlib static dictionaries.
814  I've tried to closely emulate zlib's various flavors of stream flushing
815  and return status codes, but
816  there are no guarantees that miniz.c pulls this off perfectly.
817 
818  * PNG writing: See the tdefl_write_image_to_png_file_in_memory() function,
819  originally written by
820  Alex Evans. Supports 1-4 bytes/pixel images.
821 
822  * ZIP archive API notes:
823 
824  The ZIP archive API's where designed with simplicity and efficiency in
825  mind, with just enough abstraction to
826  get the job done with minimal fuss. There are simple API's to retrieve file
827  information, read files from
828  existing archives, create new archives, append new files to existing
829  archives, or clone archive data from
830  one archive to another. It supports archives located in memory or the heap,
831  on disk (using stdio.h),
832  or you can specify custom file read/write callbacks.
833 
834  - Archive reading: Just call this function to read a single file from a
835  disk archive:
836 
837  void *mz_zip_extract_archive_file_to_heap(const char *pZip_filename, const
838  char *pArchive_name,
839  size_t *pSize, mz_uint zip_flags);
840 
841  For more complex cases, use the "mz_zip_reader" functions. Upon opening an
842  archive, the entire central
843  directory is located and read as-is into memory, and subsequent file access
844  only occurs when reading individual files.
845 
846  - Archives file scanning: The simple way is to use this function to scan a
847  loaded archive for a specific file:
848 
849  int mz_zip_reader_locate_file(mz_zip_archive *pZip, const char *pName,
850  const char *pComment, mz_uint flags);
851 
852  The locate operation can optionally check file comments too, which (as one
853  example) can be used to identify
854  multiple versions of the same file in an archive. This function uses a
855  simple linear search through the central
856  directory, so it's not very fast.
857 
858  Alternately, you can iterate through all the files in an archive (using
859  mz_zip_reader_get_num_files()) and
860  retrieve detailed info on each file by calling mz_zip_reader_file_stat().
861 
862  - Archive creation: Use the "mz_zip_writer" functions. The ZIP writer
863  immediately writes compressed file data
864  to disk and builds an exact image of the central directory in memory. The
865  central directory image is written
866  all at once at the end of the archive file when the archive is finalized.
867 
868  The archive writer can optionally align each file's local header and file
869  data to any power of 2 alignment,
870  which can be useful when the archive will be read from optical media. Also,
871  the writer supports placing
872  arbitrary data blobs at the very beginning of ZIP archives. Archives
873  written using either feature are still
874  readable by any ZIP tool.
875 
876  - Archive appending: The simple way to add a single file to an archive is
877  to call this function:
878 
879  mz_bool mz_zip_add_mem_to_archive_file_in_place(const char *pZip_filename,
880  const char *pArchive_name,
881  const void *pBuf, size_t buf_size, const void *pComment, mz_uint16
882  comment_size, mz_uint level_and_flags);
883 
884  The archive will be created if it doesn't already exist, otherwise it'll be
885  appended to.
886  Note the appending is done in-place and is not an atomic operation, so if
887  something goes wrong
888  during the operation it's possible the archive could be left without a
889  central directory (although the local
890  file headers and file data will be fine, so the archive will be
891  recoverable).
892 
893  For more complex archive modification scenarios:
894  1. The safest way is to use a mz_zip_reader to read the existing archive,
895  cloning only those bits you want to
896  preserve into a new archive using using the
897  mz_zip_writer_add_from_zip_reader() function (which compiles the
898  compressed file data as-is). When you're done, delete the old archive and
899  rename the newly written archive, and
900  you're done. This is safe but requires a bunch of temporary disk space or
901  heap memory.
902 
903  2. Or, you can convert an mz_zip_reader in-place to an mz_zip_writer using
904  mz_zip_writer_init_from_reader(),
905  append new files as needed, then finalize the archive which will write an
906  updated central directory to the
907  original archive. (This is basically what
908  mz_zip_add_mem_to_archive_file_in_place() does.) There's a
909  possibility that the archive's central directory could be lost with this
910  method if anything goes wrong, though.
911 
912  - ZIP archive support limitations:
913  No zip64 or spanning support. Extraction functions can only handle
914  unencrypted, stored or deflated files.
915  Requires streams capable of seeking.
916 
917  * This is a header file library, like stb_image.c. To get only a header file,
918  either cut and paste the
919  below header, or create miniz.h, #define MINIZ_HEADER_FILE_ONLY, and then
920  include miniz.c from it.
921 
922  * Important: For best perf. be sure to customize the below macros for your
923  target platform:
924  #define MINIZ_USE_UNALIGNED_LOADS_AND_STORES 1
925  #define MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN 1
926  #define MINIZ_HAS_64BIT_REGISTERS 1
927 
928  * On platforms using glibc, Be sure to "#define _LARGEFILE64_SOURCE 1" before
929  including miniz.c to ensure miniz
930  uses the 64-bit variants: fopen64(), stat64(), etc. Otherwise you won't be
931  able to process large files
932  (i.e. 32-bit stat() fails for me on files > 0x7FFFFFFF bytes).
933  */
934 
935 #ifndef MINIZ_HEADER_INCLUDED
936 #define MINIZ_HEADER_INCLUDED
937 
938  //#include <stdlib.h>
939 
940  // Defines to completely disable specific portions of miniz.c:
941  // If all macros here are defined the only functionality remaining will be
942  // CRC-32, adler-32, tinfl, and tdefl.
943 
944  // Define MINIZ_NO_STDIO to disable all usage and any functions which rely on
945  // stdio for file I/O.
946  //#define MINIZ_NO_STDIO
947 
948  // If MINIZ_NO_TIME is specified then the ZIP archive functions will not be able
949  // to get the current time, or
950  // get/set file times, and the C run-time funcs that get/set times won't be
951  // called.
952  // The current downside is the times written to your archives will be from 1979.
953 #define MINIZ_NO_TIME
954 
955 // Define MINIZ_NO_ARCHIVE_APIS to disable all ZIP archive API's.
956 #define MINIZ_NO_ARCHIVE_APIS
957 
958 // Define MINIZ_NO_ARCHIVE_APIS to disable all writing related ZIP archive
959 // API's.
960 //#define MINIZ_NO_ARCHIVE_WRITING_APIS
961 
962 // Define MINIZ_NO_ZLIB_APIS to remove all ZLIB-style compression/decompression
963 // API's.
964 //#define MINIZ_NO_ZLIB_APIS
965 
966 // Define MINIZ_NO_ZLIB_COMPATIBLE_NAME to disable zlib names, to prevent
967 // conflicts against stock zlib.
968 //#define MINIZ_NO_ZLIB_COMPATIBLE_NAMES
969 
970 // Define MINIZ_NO_MALLOC to disable all calls to malloc, free, and realloc.
971 // Note if MINIZ_NO_MALLOC is defined then the user must always provide custom
972 // user alloc/free/realloc
973 // callbacks to the zlib and archive API's, and a few stand-alone helper API's
974 // which don't provide custom user
975 // functions (such as tdefl_compress_mem_to_heap() and
976 // tinfl_decompress_mem_to_heap()) won't work.
977 //#define MINIZ_NO_MALLOC
978 
979 #if defined(__TINYC__) && (defined(__linux) || defined(__linux__))
980 // TODO: Work around "error: include file 'sys\utime.h' when compiling with tcc
981 // on Linux
982 #define MINIZ_NO_TIME
983 #endif
984 
985 #if !defined(MINIZ_NO_TIME) && !defined(MINIZ_NO_ARCHIVE_APIS)
986 //#include <time.h>
987 #endif
988 
989 #if defined(_M_IX86) || defined(_M_X64) || defined(__i386__) || \
990  defined(__i386) || defined(__i486__) || defined(__i486) || \
991  defined(i386) || defined(__ia64__) || defined(__x86_64__)
992 // MINIZ_X86_OR_X64_CPU is only used to help set the below macros.
993 #define MINIZ_X86_OR_X64_CPU 1
994 #endif
995 
996 #if defined(__sparcv9)
997 // Big endian
998 #else
999 #if (__BYTE_ORDER__ == __ORDER_LITTLE_ENDIAN__) || MINIZ_X86_OR_X64_CPU
1000 // Set MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN to 1 if the processor is little endian.
1001 #define MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN 1
1002 #endif
1003 #endif
1004 
1005 #if MINIZ_X86_OR_X64_CPU
1006 // Set MINIZ_USE_UNALIGNED_LOADS_AND_STORES to 1 on CPU's that permit efficient
1007 // integer loads and stores from unaligned addresses.
1008 //#define MINIZ_USE_UNALIGNED_LOADS_AND_STORES 1
1009 #define MINIZ_USE_UNALIGNED_LOADS_AND_STORES \
1010  0 // disable to suppress compiler warnings
1011 #endif
1012 
1013 #if defined(_M_X64) || defined(_WIN64) || defined(__MINGW64__) || \
1014  defined(_LP64) || defined(__LP64__) || defined(__ia64__) || \
1015  defined(__x86_64__)
1016 // Set MINIZ_HAS_64BIT_REGISTERS to 1 if operations on 64-bit integers are
1017 // reasonably fast (and don't involve compiler generated calls to helper
1018 // functions).
1019 #define MINIZ_HAS_64BIT_REGISTERS 1
1020 #endif
1021 
1022 #ifdef __cplusplus
1023  extern "C" {
1024 #endif
1025 
1026  // ------------------- zlib-style API Definitions.
1027 
1028  // For more compatibility with zlib, miniz.c uses unsigned long for some
1029  // parameters/struct members. Beware: mz_ulong can be either 32 or 64-bits!
1030  typedef unsigned long mz_ulong;
1031 
1032  // mz_free() internally uses the MZ_FREE() macro (which by default calls free()
1033  // unless you've modified the MZ_MALLOC macro) to release a block allocated from
1034  // the heap.
1035  void mz_free(void *p);
1036 
1037 #define MZ_ADLER32_INIT (1)
1038  // mz_adler32() returns the initial adler-32 value to use when called with
1039  // ptr==NULL.
1040  mz_ulong mz_adler32(mz_ulong adler, const unsigned char *ptr, size_t buf_len);
1041 
1042 #define MZ_CRC32_INIT (0)
1043  // mz_crc32() returns the initial CRC-32 value to use when called with
1044  // ptr==NULL.
1045  mz_ulong mz_crc32(mz_ulong crc, const unsigned char *ptr, size_t buf_len);
1046 
1047  // Compression strategies.
1048  enum {
1049  MZ_DEFAULT_STRATEGY = 0,
1050  MZ_FILTERED = 1,
1051  MZ_HUFFMAN_ONLY = 2,
1052  MZ_RLE = 3,
1053  MZ_FIXED = 4
1054  };
1055 
1056  // Method
1057 #define MZ_DEFLATED 8
1058 
1059 #ifndef MINIZ_NO_ZLIB_APIS
1060 
1061 // Heap allocation callbacks.
1062 // Note that mz_alloc_func parameter types purpsosely differ from zlib's:
1063 // items/size is size_t, not unsigned long.
1064  typedef void *(*mz_alloc_func)(void *opaque, size_t items, size_t size);
1065  typedef void(*mz_free_func)(void *opaque, void *address);
1066  typedef void *(*mz_realloc_func)(void *opaque, void *address, size_t items,
1067  size_t size);
1068 
1069 #define MZ_VERSION "9.1.15"
1070 #define MZ_VERNUM 0x91F0
1071 #define MZ_VER_MAJOR 9
1072 #define MZ_VER_MINOR 1
1073 #define MZ_VER_REVISION 15
1074 #define MZ_VER_SUBREVISION 0
1075 
1076  // Flush values. For typical usage you only need MZ_NO_FLUSH and MZ_FINISH. The
1077  // other values are for advanced use (refer to the zlib docs).
1078  enum {
1079  MZ_NO_FLUSH = 0,
1080  MZ_PARTIAL_FLUSH = 1,
1081  MZ_SYNC_FLUSH = 2,
1082  MZ_FULL_FLUSH = 3,
1083  MZ_FINISH = 4,
1084  MZ_BLOCK = 5
1085  };
1086 
1087  // Return status codes. MZ_PARAM_ERROR is non-standard.
1088  enum {
1089  MZ_OK = 0,
1090  MZ_STREAM_END = 1,
1091  MZ_NEED_DICT = 2,
1092  MZ_ERRNO = -1,
1093  MZ_STREAM_ERROR = -2,
1094  MZ_DATA_ERROR = -3,
1095  MZ_MEM_ERROR = -4,
1096  MZ_BUF_ERROR = -5,
1097  MZ_VERSION_ERROR = -6,
1098  MZ_PARAM_ERROR = -10000
1099  };
1100 
1101  // Compression levels: 0-9 are the standard zlib-style levels, 10 is best
1102  // possible compression (not zlib compatible, and may be very slow),
1103  // MZ_DEFAULT_COMPRESSION=MZ_DEFAULT_LEVEL.
1104  enum {
1105  MZ_NO_COMPRESSION = 0,
1106  MZ_BEST_SPEED = 1,
1107  MZ_BEST_COMPRESSION = 9,
1108  MZ_UBER_COMPRESSION = 10,
1109  MZ_DEFAULT_LEVEL = 6,
1110  MZ_DEFAULT_COMPRESSION = -1
1111  };
1112 
1113  // Window bits
1114 #define MZ_DEFAULT_WINDOW_BITS 15
1115 
1116  struct mz_internal_state;
1117 
1118  // Compression/decompression stream struct.
1119  typedef struct mz_stream_s {
1120  const unsigned char *next_in; // pointer to next byte to read
1121  unsigned int avail_in; // number of bytes available at next_in
1122  mz_ulong total_in; // total number of bytes consumed so far
1123 
1124  unsigned char *next_out; // pointer to next byte to write
1125  unsigned int avail_out; // number of bytes that can be written to next_out
1126  mz_ulong total_out; // total number of bytes produced so far
1127 
1128  char *msg; // error msg (unused)
1129  struct mz_internal_state *state; // internal state, allocated by zalloc/zfree
1130 
1131  mz_alloc_func
1132  zalloc; // optional heap allocation function (defaults to malloc)
1133  mz_free_func zfree; // optional heap free function (defaults to free)
1134  void *opaque; // heap alloc function user pointer
1135 
1136  int data_type; // data_type (unused)
1137  mz_ulong adler; // adler32 of the source or uncompressed data
1138  mz_ulong reserved; // not used
1139  } mz_stream;
1140 
1141  typedef mz_stream *mz_streamp;
1142 
1143  // Returns the version string of miniz.c.
1144  const char *mz_version(void);
1145 
1146  // mz_deflateInit() initializes a compressor with default options:
1147  // Parameters:
1148  // pStream must point to an initialized mz_stream struct.
1149  // level must be between [MZ_NO_COMPRESSION, MZ_BEST_COMPRESSION].
1150  // level 1 enables a specially optimized compression function that's been
1151  // optimized purely for performance, not ratio.
1152  // (This special func. is currently only enabled when
1153  // MINIZ_USE_UNALIGNED_LOADS_AND_STORES and MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN are defined.)
1154  // Return values:
1155  // MZ_OK on success.
1156  // MZ_STREAM_ERROR if the stream is bogus.
1157  // MZ_PARAM_ERROR if the input parameters are bogus.
1158  // MZ_MEM_ERROR on out of memory.
1159  int mz_deflateInit(mz_streamp pStream, int level);
1160 
1161  // mz_deflateInit2() is like mz_deflate(), except with more control:
1162  // Additional parameters:
1163  // method must be MZ_DEFLATED
1164  // window_bits must be MZ_DEFAULT_WINDOW_BITS (to wrap the deflate stream with
1165  // zlib header/adler-32 footer) or -MZ_DEFAULT_WINDOW_BITS (raw deflate/no
1166  // header or footer)
1167  // mem_level must be between [1, 9] (it's checked but ignored by miniz.c)
1168  int mz_deflateInit2(mz_streamp pStream, int level, int method, int window_bits,
1169  int mem_level, int strategy);
1170 
1171  // Quickly resets a compressor without having to reallocate anything. Same as
1172  // calling mz_deflateEnd() followed by mz_deflateInit()/mz_deflateInit2().
1173  int mz_deflateReset(mz_streamp pStream);
1174 
1175  // mz_deflate() compresses the input to output, consuming as much of the input
1176  // and producing as much output as possible.
1177  // Parameters:
1178  // pStream is the stream to read from and write to. You must initialize/update
1179  // the next_in, avail_in, next_out, and avail_out members.
1180  // flush may be MZ_NO_FLUSH, MZ_PARTIAL_FLUSH/MZ_SYNC_FLUSH, MZ_FULL_FLUSH, or
1181  // MZ_FINISH.
1182  // Return values:
1183  // MZ_OK on success (when flushing, or if more input is needed but not
1184  // available, and/or there's more output to be written but the output buffer
1185  // is full).
1186  // MZ_STREAM_END if all input has been consumed and all output bytes have been
1187  // written. Don't call mz_deflate() on the stream anymore.
1188  // MZ_STREAM_ERROR if the stream is bogus.
1189  // MZ_PARAM_ERROR if one of the parameters is invalid.
1190  // MZ_BUF_ERROR if no forward progress is possible because the input and/or
1191  // output buffers are empty. (Fill up the input buffer or free up some output
1192  // space and try again.)
1193  int mz_deflate(mz_streamp pStream, int flush);
1194 
1195  // mz_deflateEnd() deinitializes a compressor:
1196  // Return values:
1197  // MZ_OK on success.
1198  // MZ_STREAM_ERROR if the stream is bogus.
1199  int mz_deflateEnd(mz_streamp pStream);
1200 
1201  // mz_deflateBound() returns a (very) conservative upper bound on the amount of
1202  // data that could be generated by deflate(), assuming flush is set to only
1203  // MZ_NO_FLUSH or MZ_FINISH.
1204  mz_ulong mz_deflateBound(mz_streamp pStream, mz_ulong source_len);
1205 
1206  // Single-call compression functions mz_compress() and mz_compress2():
1207  // Returns MZ_OK on success, or one of the error codes from mz_deflate() on
1208  // failure.
1209  int mz_compress(unsigned char *pDest, mz_ulong *pDest_len,
1210  const unsigned char *pSource, mz_ulong source_len);
1211  int mz_compress2(unsigned char *pDest, mz_ulong *pDest_len,
1212  const unsigned char *pSource, mz_ulong source_len, int level);
1213 
1214  // mz_compressBound() returns a (very) conservative upper bound on the amount of
1215  // data that could be generated by calling mz_compress().
1216  mz_ulong mz_compressBound(mz_ulong source_len);
1217 
1218  // Initializes a decompressor.
1219  int mz_inflateInit(mz_streamp pStream);
1220 
1221  // mz_inflateInit2() is like mz_inflateInit() with an additional option that
1222  // controls the window size and whether or not the stream has been wrapped with
1223  // a zlib header/footer:
1224  // window_bits must be MZ_DEFAULT_WINDOW_BITS (to parse zlib header/footer) or
1225  // -MZ_DEFAULT_WINDOW_BITS (raw deflate).
1226  int mz_inflateInit2(mz_streamp pStream, int window_bits);
1227 
1228  // Decompresses the input stream to the output, consuming only as much of the
1229  // input as needed, and writing as much to the output as possible.
1230  // Parameters:
1231  // pStream is the stream to read from and write to. You must initialize/update
1232  // the next_in, avail_in, next_out, and avail_out members.
1233  // flush may be MZ_NO_FLUSH, MZ_SYNC_FLUSH, or MZ_FINISH.
1234  // On the first call, if flush is MZ_FINISH it's assumed the input and output
1235  // buffers are both sized large enough to decompress the entire stream in a
1236  // single call (this is slightly faster).
1237  // MZ_FINISH implies that there are no more source bytes available beside
1238  // what's already in the input buffer, and that the output buffer is large
1239  // enough to hold the rest of the decompressed data.
1240  // Return values:
1241  // MZ_OK on success. Either more input is needed but not available, and/or
1242  // there's more output to be written but the output buffer is full.
1243  // MZ_STREAM_END if all needed input has been consumed and all output bytes
1244  // have been written. For zlib streams, the adler-32 of the decompressed data
1245  // has also been verified.
1246  // MZ_STREAM_ERROR if the stream is bogus.
1247  // MZ_DATA_ERROR if the deflate stream is invalid.
1248  // MZ_PARAM_ERROR if one of the parameters is invalid.
1249  // MZ_BUF_ERROR if no forward progress is possible because the input buffer is
1250  // empty but the inflater needs more input to continue, or if the output
1251  // buffer is not large enough. Call mz_inflate() again
1252  // with more input data, or with more room in the output buffer (except when
1253  // using single call decompression, described above).
1254  int mz_inflate(mz_streamp pStream, int flush);
1255 
1256  // Deinitializes a decompressor.
1257  int mz_inflateEnd(mz_streamp pStream);
1258 
1259  // Single-call decompression.
1260  // Returns MZ_OK on success, or one of the error codes from mz_inflate() on
1261  // failure.
1262  int mz_uncompress(unsigned char *pDest, mz_ulong *pDest_len,
1263  const unsigned char *pSource, mz_ulong source_len);
1264 
1265  // Returns a string description of the specified error code, or NULL if the
1266  // error code is invalid.
1267  const char *mz_error(int err);
1268 
1269  // Redefine zlib-compatible names to miniz equivalents, so miniz.c can be used
1270  // as a drop-in replacement for the subset of zlib that miniz.c supports.
1271  // Define MINIZ_NO_ZLIB_COMPATIBLE_NAMES to disable zlib-compatibility if you
1272  // use zlib in the same project.
1273 #ifndef MINIZ_NO_ZLIB_COMPATIBLE_NAMES
1274  typedef unsigned char Byte;
1275  typedef unsigned int uInt;
1276  typedef mz_ulong uLong;
1277  typedef Byte Bytef;
1278  typedef uInt uIntf;
1279  typedef char charf;
1280  typedef int intf;
1281  typedef void *voidpf;
1282  typedef uLong uLongf;
1283  typedef void *voidp;
1284  typedef void *const voidpc;
1285 #define Z_NULL 0
1286 #define Z_NO_FLUSH MZ_NO_FLUSH
1287 #define Z_PARTIAL_FLUSH MZ_PARTIAL_FLUSH
1288 #define Z_SYNC_FLUSH MZ_SYNC_FLUSH
1289 #define Z_FULL_FLUSH MZ_FULL_FLUSH
1290 #define Z_FINISH MZ_FINISH
1291 #define Z_BLOCK MZ_BLOCK
1292 #define Z_OK MZ_OK
1293 #define Z_STREAM_END MZ_STREAM_END
1294 #define Z_NEED_DICT MZ_NEED_DICT
1295 #define Z_ERRNO MZ_ERRNO
1296 #define Z_STREAM_ERROR MZ_STREAM_ERROR
1297 #define Z_DATA_ERROR MZ_DATA_ERROR
1298 #define Z_MEM_ERROR MZ_MEM_ERROR
1299 #define Z_BUF_ERROR MZ_BUF_ERROR
1300 #define Z_VERSION_ERROR MZ_VERSION_ERROR
1301 #define Z_PARAM_ERROR MZ_PARAM_ERROR
1302 #define Z_NO_COMPRESSION MZ_NO_COMPRESSION
1303 #define Z_BEST_SPEED MZ_BEST_SPEED
1304 #define Z_BEST_COMPRESSION MZ_BEST_COMPRESSION
1305 #define Z_DEFAULT_COMPRESSION MZ_DEFAULT_COMPRESSION
1306 #define Z_DEFAULT_STRATEGY MZ_DEFAULT_STRATEGY
1307 #define Z_FILTERED MZ_FILTERED
1308 #define Z_HUFFMAN_ONLY MZ_HUFFMAN_ONLY
1309 #define Z_RLE MZ_RLE
1310 #define Z_FIXED MZ_FIXED
1311 #define Z_DEFLATED MZ_DEFLATED
1312 #define Z_DEFAULT_WINDOW_BITS MZ_DEFAULT_WINDOW_BITS
1313 #define alloc_func mz_alloc_func
1314 #define free_func mz_free_func
1315 #define internal_state mz_internal_state
1316 #define z_stream mz_stream
1317 #define deflateInit mz_deflateInit
1318 #define deflateInit2 mz_deflateInit2
1319 #define deflateReset mz_deflateReset
1320 #define deflate mz_deflate
1321 #define deflateEnd mz_deflateEnd
1322 #define deflateBound mz_deflateBound
1323 #define compress mz_compress
1324 #define compress2 mz_compress2
1325 #define compressBound mz_compressBound
1326 #define inflateInit mz_inflateInit
1327 #define inflateInit2 mz_inflateInit2
1328 #define inflate mz_inflate
1329 #define inflateEnd mz_inflateEnd
1330 #define uncompress mz_uncompress
1331 #define crc32 mz_crc32
1332 #define adler32 mz_adler32
1333 #define MAX_WBITS 15
1334 #define MAX_MEM_LEVEL 9
1335 #define zError mz_error
1336 #define ZLIB_VERSION MZ_VERSION
1337 #define ZLIB_VERNUM MZ_VERNUM
1338 #define ZLIB_VER_MAJOR MZ_VER_MAJOR
1339 #define ZLIB_VER_MINOR MZ_VER_MINOR
1340 #define ZLIB_VER_REVISION MZ_VER_REVISION
1341 #define ZLIB_VER_SUBREVISION MZ_VER_SUBREVISION
1342 #define zlibVersion mz_version
1343 #define zlib_version mz_version()
1344 #endif // #ifndef MINIZ_NO_ZLIB_COMPATIBLE_NAMES
1345 
1346 #endif // MINIZ_NO_ZLIB_APIS
1347 
1348  // ------------------- Types and macros
1349 
1350  typedef unsigned char mz_uint8;
1351  typedef signed short mz_int16;
1352  typedef unsigned short mz_uint16;
1353  typedef unsigned int mz_uint32;
1354  typedef unsigned int mz_uint;
1355  typedef long long mz_int64;
1356  typedef unsigned long long mz_uint64;
1357  typedef int mz_bool;
1358 
1359 #define MZ_FALSE (0)
1360 #define MZ_TRUE (1)
1361 
1362  // An attempt to work around MSVC's spammy "warning C4127: conditional
1363  // expression is constant" message.
1364 #ifdef _MSC_VER
1365 #define MZ_MACRO_END while (0, 0)
1366 #else
1367 #define MZ_MACRO_END while (0)
1368 #endif
1369 
1370 // ------------------- ZIP archive reading/writing
1371 
1372 #ifndef MINIZ_NO_ARCHIVE_APIS
1373 
1374  enum {
1375  MZ_ZIP_MAX_IO_BUF_SIZE = 64 * 1024,
1376  MZ_ZIP_MAX_ARCHIVE_FILENAME_SIZE = 260,
1377  MZ_ZIP_MAX_ARCHIVE_FILE_COMMENT_SIZE = 256
1378  };
1379 
1380  typedef struct {
1381  mz_uint32 m_file_index;
1382  mz_uint32 m_central_dir_ofs;
1383  mz_uint16 m_version_made_by;
1384  mz_uint16 m_version_needed;
1385  mz_uint16 m_bit_flag;
1386  mz_uint16 m_method;
1387 #ifndef MINIZ_NO_TIME
1388  time_t m_time;
1389 #endif
1390  mz_uint32 m_crc32;
1391  mz_uint64 m_comp_size;
1392  mz_uint64 m_uncomp_size;
1393  mz_uint16 m_internal_attr;
1394  mz_uint32 m_external_attr;
1395  mz_uint64 m_local_header_ofs;
1396  mz_uint32 m_comment_size;
1397  char m_filename[MZ_ZIP_MAX_ARCHIVE_FILENAME_SIZE];
1398  char m_comment[MZ_ZIP_MAX_ARCHIVE_FILE_COMMENT_SIZE];
1399  } mz_zip_archive_file_stat;
1400 
1401  typedef size_t(*mz_file_read_func)(void *pOpaque, mz_uint64 file_ofs,
1402  void *pBuf, size_t n);
1403  typedef size_t(*mz_file_write_func)(void *pOpaque, mz_uint64 file_ofs,
1404  const void *pBuf, size_t n);
1405 
1406  struct mz_zip_internal_state_tag;
1407  typedef struct mz_zip_internal_state_tag mz_zip_internal_state;
1408 
1409  typedef enum {
1410  MZ_ZIP_MODE_INVALID = 0,
1411  MZ_ZIP_MODE_READING = 1,
1412  MZ_ZIP_MODE_WRITING = 2,
1413  MZ_ZIP_MODE_WRITING_HAS_BEEN_FINALIZED = 3
1414  } mz_zip_mode;
1415 
1416  typedef struct mz_zip_archive_tag {
1417  mz_uint64 m_archive_size;
1418  mz_uint64 m_central_directory_file_ofs;
1419  mz_uint m_total_files;
1420  mz_zip_mode m_zip_mode;
1421 
1422  mz_uint m_file_offset_alignment;
1423 
1424  mz_alloc_func m_pAlloc;
1425  mz_free_func m_pFree;
1426  mz_realloc_func m_pRealloc;
1427  void *m_pAlloc_opaque;
1428 
1429  mz_file_read_func m_pRead;
1430  mz_file_write_func m_pWrite;
1431  void *m_pIO_opaque;
1432 
1433  mz_zip_internal_state *m_pState;
1434 
1435  } mz_zip_archive;
1436 
1437  typedef enum {
1438  MZ_ZIP_FLAG_CASE_SENSITIVE = 0x0100,
1439  MZ_ZIP_FLAG_IGNORE_PATH = 0x0200,
1440  MZ_ZIP_FLAG_COMPRESSED_DATA = 0x0400,
1441  MZ_ZIP_FLAG_DO_NOT_SORT_CENTRAL_DIRECTORY = 0x0800
1442  } mz_zip_flags;
1443 
1444  // ZIP archive reading
1445 
1446  // Inits a ZIP archive reader.
1447  // These functions read and validate the archive's central directory.
1448  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_init(mz_zip_archive *pZip, mz_uint64 size,
1449  mz_uint32 flags);
1450  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_init_mem(mz_zip_archive *pZip, const void *pMem,
1451  size_t size, mz_uint32 flags);
1452 
1453 #ifndef MINIZ_NO_STDIO
1454  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_init_file(mz_zip_archive *pZip, const char *pFilename,
1455  mz_uint32 flags);
1456 #endif
1457 
1458  // Returns the total number of files in the archive.
1459  mz_uint mz_zip_reader_get_num_files(mz_zip_archive *pZip);
1460 
1461  // Returns detailed information about an archive file entry.
1462  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_file_stat(mz_zip_archive *pZip, mz_uint file_index,
1463  mz_zip_archive_file_stat *pStat);
1464 
1465  // Determines if an archive file entry is a directory entry.
1466  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_is_file_a_directory(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
1467  mz_uint file_index);
1468  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_is_file_encrypted(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
1469  mz_uint file_index);
1470 
1471  // Retrieves the filename of an archive file entry.
1472  // Returns the number of bytes written to pFilename, or if filename_buf_size is
1473  // 0 this function returns the number of bytes needed to fully store the
1474  // filename.
1475  mz_uint mz_zip_reader_get_filename(mz_zip_archive *pZip, mz_uint file_index,
1476  char *pFilename, mz_uint filename_buf_size);
1477 
1478  // Attempts to locates a file in the archive's central directory.
1479  // Valid flags: MZ_ZIP_FLAG_CASE_SENSITIVE, MZ_ZIP_FLAG_IGNORE_PATH
1480  // Returns -1 if the file cannot be found.
1481  int mz_zip_reader_locate_file(mz_zip_archive *pZip, const char *pName,
1482  const char *pComment, mz_uint flags);
1483 
1484  // Extracts a archive file to a memory buffer using no memory allocation.
1485  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_extract_to_mem_no_alloc(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
1486  mz_uint file_index, void *pBuf,
1487  size_t buf_size, mz_uint flags,
1488  void *pUser_read_buf,
1489  size_t user_read_buf_size);
1490  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_extract_file_to_mem_no_alloc(
1491  mz_zip_archive *pZip, const char *pFilename, void *pBuf, size_t buf_size,
1492  mz_uint flags, void *pUser_read_buf, size_t user_read_buf_size);
1493 
1494  // Extracts a archive file to a memory buffer.
1495  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_extract_to_mem(mz_zip_archive *pZip, mz_uint file_index,
1496  void *pBuf, size_t buf_size,
1497  mz_uint flags);
1498  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_extract_file_to_mem(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
1499  const char *pFilename, void *pBuf,
1500  size_t buf_size, mz_uint flags);
1501 
1502  // Extracts a archive file to a dynamically allocated heap buffer.
1503  void *mz_zip_reader_extract_to_heap(mz_zip_archive *pZip, mz_uint file_index,
1504  size_t *pSize, mz_uint flags);
1505  void *mz_zip_reader_extract_file_to_heap(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
1506  const char *pFilename, size_t *pSize,
1507  mz_uint flags);
1508 
1509  // Extracts a archive file using a callback function to output the file's data.
1510  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_extract_to_callback(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
1511  mz_uint file_index,
1512  mz_file_write_func pCallback,
1513  void *pOpaque, mz_uint flags);
1514  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_extract_file_to_callback(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
1515  const char *pFilename,
1516  mz_file_write_func pCallback,
1517  void *pOpaque, mz_uint flags);
1518 
1519 #ifndef MINIZ_NO_STDIO
1520  // Extracts a archive file to a disk file and sets its last accessed and
1521  // modified times.
1522  // This function only extracts files, not archive directory records.
1523  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_extract_to_file(mz_zip_archive *pZip, mz_uint file_index,
1524  const char *pDst_filename, mz_uint flags);
1525  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_extract_file_to_file(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
1526  const char *pArchive_filename,
1527  const char *pDst_filename,
1528  mz_uint flags);
1529 #endif
1530 
1531  // Ends archive reading, freeing all allocations, and closing the input archive
1532  // file if mz_zip_reader_init_file() was used.
1533  mz_bool mz_zip_reader_end(mz_zip_archive *pZip);
1534 
1535  // ZIP archive writing
1536 
1537 #ifndef MINIZ_NO_ARCHIVE_WRITING_APIS
1538 
1539 // Inits a ZIP archive writer.
1540  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_init(mz_zip_archive *pZip, mz_uint64 existing_size);
1541  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_init_heap(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
1542  size_t size_to_reserve_at_beginning,
1543  size_t initial_allocation_size);
1544 
1545 #ifndef MINIZ_NO_STDIO
1546  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_init_file(mz_zip_archive *pZip, const char *pFilename,
1547  mz_uint64 size_to_reserve_at_beginning);
1548 #endif
1549 
1550  // Converts a ZIP archive reader object into a writer object, to allow efficient
1551  // in-place file appends to occur on an existing archive.
1552  // For archives opened using mz_zip_reader_init_file, pFilename must be the
1553  // archive's filename so it can be reopened for writing. If the file can't be
1554  // reopened, mz_zip_reader_end() will be called.
1555  // For archives opened using mz_zip_reader_init_mem, the memory block must be
1556  // growable using the realloc callback (which defaults to realloc unless you've
1557  // overridden it).
1558  // Finally, for archives opened using mz_zip_reader_init, the mz_zip_archive's
1559  // user provided m_pWrite function cannot be NULL.
1560  // Note: In-place archive modification is not recommended unless you know what
1561  // you're doing, because if execution stops or something goes wrong before
1562  // the archive is finalized the file's central directory will be hosed.
1563  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_init_from_reader(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
1564  const char *pFilename);
1565 
1566  // Adds the contents of a memory buffer to an archive. These functions record
1567  // the current local time into the archive.
1568  // To add a directory entry, call this method with an archive name ending in a
1569  // forwardslash with empty buffer.
1570  // level_and_flags - compression level (0-10, see MZ_BEST_SPEED,
1571  // MZ_BEST_COMPRESSION, etc.) logically OR'd with zero or more mz_zip_flags, or
1572  // just set to MZ_DEFAULT_COMPRESSION.
1573  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_add_mem(mz_zip_archive *pZip, const char *pArchive_name,
1574  const void *pBuf, size_t buf_size,
1575  mz_uint level_and_flags);
1576  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_add_mem_ex(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
1577  const char *pArchive_name, const void *pBuf,
1578  size_t buf_size, const void *pComment,
1579  mz_uint16 comment_size,
1580  mz_uint level_and_flags, mz_uint64 uncomp_size,
1581  mz_uint32 uncomp_crc32);
1582 
1583 #ifndef MINIZ_NO_STDIO
1584  // Adds the contents of a disk file to an archive. This function also records
1585  // the disk file's modified time into the archive.
1586  // level_and_flags - compression level (0-10, see MZ_BEST_SPEED,
1587  // MZ_BEST_COMPRESSION, etc.) logically OR'd with zero or more mz_zip_flags, or
1588  // just set to MZ_DEFAULT_COMPRESSION.
1589  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_add_file(mz_zip_archive *pZip, const char *pArchive_name,
1590  const char *pSrc_filename, const void *pComment,
1591  mz_uint16 comment_size, mz_uint level_and_flags);
1592 #endif
1593 
1594  // Adds a file to an archive by fully cloning the data from another archive.
1595  // This function fully clones the source file's compressed data (no
1596  // recompression), along with its full filename, extra data, and comment fields.
1597  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_add_from_zip_reader(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
1598  mz_zip_archive *pSource_zip,
1599  mz_uint file_index);
1600 
1601  // Finalizes the archive by writing the central directory records followed by
1602  // the end of central directory record.
1603  // After an archive is finalized, the only valid call on the mz_zip_archive
1604  // struct is mz_zip_writer_end().
1605  // An archive must be manually finalized by calling this function for it to be
1606  // valid.
1607  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_finalize_archive(mz_zip_archive *pZip);
1608  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_finalize_heap_archive(mz_zip_archive *pZip, void **pBuf,
1609  size_t *pSize);
1610 
1611  // Ends archive writing, freeing all allocations, and closing the output file if
1612  // mz_zip_writer_init_file() was used.
1613  // Note for the archive to be valid, it must have been finalized before ending.
1614  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_end(mz_zip_archive *pZip);
1615 
1616  // Misc. high-level helper functions:
1617 
1618  // mz_zip_add_mem_to_archive_file_in_place() efficiently (but not atomically)
1619  // appends a memory blob to a ZIP archive.
1620  // level_and_flags - compression level (0-10, see MZ_BEST_SPEED,
1621  // MZ_BEST_COMPRESSION, etc.) logically OR'd with zero or more mz_zip_flags, or
1622  // just set to MZ_DEFAULT_COMPRESSION.
1623  mz_bool mz_zip_add_mem_to_archive_file_in_place(
1624  const char *pZip_filename, const char *pArchive_name, const void *pBuf,
1625  size_t buf_size, const void *pComment, mz_uint16 comment_size,
1626  mz_uint level_and_flags);
1627 
1628  // Reads a single file from an archive into a heap block.
1629  // Returns NULL on failure.
1630  void *mz_zip_extract_archive_file_to_heap(const char *pZip_filename,
1631  const char *pArchive_name,
1632  size_t *pSize, mz_uint zip_flags);
1633 
1634 #endif // #ifndef MINIZ_NO_ARCHIVE_WRITING_APIS
1635 
1636 #endif // #ifndef MINIZ_NO_ARCHIVE_APIS
1637 
1638  // ------------------- Low-level Decompression API Definitions
1639 
1640  // Decompression flags used by tinfl_decompress().
1641  // TINFL_FLAG_PARSE_ZLIB_HEADER: If set, the input has a valid zlib header and
1642  // ends with an adler32 checksum (it's a valid zlib stream). Otherwise, the
1643  // input is a raw deflate stream.
1644  // TINFL_FLAG_HAS_MORE_INPUT: If set, there are more input bytes available
1645  // beyond the end of the supplied input buffer. If clear, the input buffer
1646  // contains all remaining input.
1647  // TINFL_FLAG_USING_NON_WRAPPING_OUTPUT_BUF: If set, the output buffer is large
1648  // enough to hold the entire decompressed stream. If clear, the output buffer is
1649  // at least the size of the dictionary (typically 32KB).
1650  // TINFL_FLAG_COMPUTE_ADLER32: Force adler-32 checksum computation of the
1651  // decompressed bytes.
1652  enum {
1653  TINFL_FLAG_PARSE_ZLIB_HEADER = 1,
1654  TINFL_FLAG_HAS_MORE_INPUT = 2,
1655  TINFL_FLAG_USING_NON_WRAPPING_OUTPUT_BUF = 4,
1656  TINFL_FLAG_COMPUTE_ADLER32 = 8
1657  };
1658 
1659  // High level decompression functions:
1660  // tinfl_decompress_mem_to_heap() decompresses a block in memory to a heap block
1661  // allocated via malloc().
1662  // On entry:
1663  // pSrc_buf, src_buf_len: Pointer and size of the Deflate or zlib source data
1664  // to decompress.
1665  // On return:
1666  // Function returns a pointer to the decompressed data, or NULL on failure.
1667  // *pOut_len will be set to the decompressed data's size, which could be larger
1668  // than src_buf_len on uncompressible data.
1669  // The caller must call mz_free() on the returned block when it's no longer
1670  // needed.
1671  void *tinfl_decompress_mem_to_heap(const void *pSrc_buf, size_t src_buf_len,
1672  size_t *pOut_len, int flags);
1673 
1674  // tinfl_decompress_mem_to_mem() decompresses a block in memory to another block
1675  // in memory.
1676  // Returns TINFL_DECOMPRESS_MEM_TO_MEM_FAILED on failure, or the number of bytes
1677  // written on success.
1678 #define TINFL_DECOMPRESS_MEM_TO_MEM_FAILED ((size_t)(-1))
1679  size_t tinfl_decompress_mem_to_mem(void *pOut_buf, size_t out_buf_len,
1680  const void *pSrc_buf, size_t src_buf_len,
1681  int flags);
1682 
1683  // tinfl_decompress_mem_to_callback() decompresses a block in memory to an
1684  // internal 32KB buffer, and a user provided callback function will be called to
1685  // flush the buffer.
1686  // Returns 1 on success or 0 on failure.
1687  typedef int(*tinfl_put_buf_func_ptr)(const void *pBuf, int len, void *pUser);
1688  int tinfl_decompress_mem_to_callback(const void *pIn_buf, size_t *pIn_buf_size,
1689  tinfl_put_buf_func_ptr pPut_buf_func,
1690  void *pPut_buf_user, int flags);
1691 
1692  struct tinfl_decompressor_tag;
1693  typedef struct tinfl_decompressor_tag tinfl_decompressor;
1694 
1695  // Max size of LZ dictionary.
1696 #define TINFL_LZ_DICT_SIZE 32768
1697 
1698 // Return status.
1699  typedef enum {
1700  TINFL_STATUS_BAD_PARAM = -3,
1701  TINFL_STATUS_ADLER32_MISMATCH = -2,
1702  TINFL_STATUS_FAILED = -1,
1703  TINFL_STATUS_DONE = 0,
1704  TINFL_STATUS_NEEDS_MORE_INPUT = 1,
1705  TINFL_STATUS_HAS_MORE_OUTPUT = 2
1706  } tinfl_status;
1707 
1708  // Initializes the decompressor to its initial state.
1709 #define tinfl_init(r) \
1710  do { \
1711  (r)->m_state = 0; \
1712  } \
1713  MZ_MACRO_END
1714 #define tinfl_get_adler32(r) (r)->m_check_adler32
1715 
1716 // Main low-level decompressor coroutine function. This is the only function
1717 // actually needed for decompression. All the other functions are just
1718 // high-level helpers for improved usability.
1719 // This is a universal API, i.e. it can be used as a building block to build any
1720 // desired higher level decompression API. In the limit case, it can be called
1721 // once per every byte input or output.
1722  tinfl_status tinfl_decompress(tinfl_decompressor *r,
1723  const mz_uint8 *pIn_buf_next,
1724  size_t *pIn_buf_size, mz_uint8 *pOut_buf_start,
1725  mz_uint8 *pOut_buf_next, size_t *pOut_buf_size,
1726  const mz_uint32 decomp_flags);
1727 
1728  // Internal/private bits follow.
1729  enum {
1730  TINFL_MAX_HUFF_TABLES = 3,
1731  TINFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS_0 = 288,
1732  TINFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS_1 = 32,
1733  TINFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS_2 = 19,
1734  TINFL_FAST_LOOKUP_BITS = 10,
1735  TINFL_FAST_LOOKUP_SIZE = 1 << TINFL_FAST_LOOKUP_BITS
1736  };
1737 
1738  typedef struct {
1739  mz_uint8 m_code_size[TINFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS_0];
1740  mz_int16 m_look_up[TINFL_FAST_LOOKUP_SIZE],
1741  m_tree[TINFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS_0 * 2];
1742  } tinfl_huff_table;
1743 
1744 #if MINIZ_HAS_64BIT_REGISTERS
1745 #define TINFL_USE_64BIT_BITBUF 1
1746 #endif
1747 
1748 #if TINFL_USE_64BIT_BITBUF
1749  typedef mz_uint64 tinfl_bit_buf_t;
1750 #define TINFL_BITBUF_SIZE (64)
1751 #else
1752  typedef mz_uint32 tinfl_bit_buf_t;
1753 #define TINFL_BITBUF_SIZE (32)
1754 #endif
1755 
1756  struct tinfl_decompressor_tag {
1757  mz_uint32 m_state, m_num_bits, m_zhdr0, m_zhdr1, m_z_adler32, m_final, m_type,
1758  m_check_adler32, m_dist, m_counter, m_num_extra,
1759  m_table_sizes[TINFL_MAX_HUFF_TABLES];
1760  tinfl_bit_buf_t m_bit_buf;
1761  size_t m_dist_from_out_buf_start;
1762  tinfl_huff_table m_tables[TINFL_MAX_HUFF_TABLES];
1763  mz_uint8 m_raw_header[4],
1764  m_len_codes[TINFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS_0 + TINFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS_1 + 137];
1765  };
1766 
1767  // ------------------- Low-level Compression API Definitions
1768 
1769  // Set TDEFL_LESS_MEMORY to 1 to use less memory (compression will be slightly
1770  // slower, and raw/dynamic blocks will be output more frequently).
1771 #define TDEFL_LESS_MEMORY 0
1772 
1773 // tdefl_init() compression flags logically OR'd together (low 12 bits contain
1774 // the max. number of probes per dictionary search):
1775 // TDEFL_DEFAULT_MAX_PROBES: The compressor defaults to 128 dictionary probes
1776 // per dictionary search. 0=Huffman only, 1=Huffman+LZ (fastest/crap
1777 // compression), 4095=Huffman+LZ (slowest/best compression).
1778  enum {
1779  TDEFL_HUFFMAN_ONLY = 0,
1780  TDEFL_DEFAULT_MAX_PROBES = 128,
1781  TDEFL_MAX_PROBES_MASK = 0xFFF
1782  };
1783 
1784  // TDEFL_WRITE_ZLIB_HEADER: If set, the compressor outputs a zlib header before
1785  // the deflate data, and the Adler-32 of the source data at the end. Otherwise,
1786  // you'll get raw deflate data.
1787  // TDEFL_COMPUTE_ADLER32: Always compute the adler-32 of the input data (even
1788  // when not writing zlib headers).
1789  // TDEFL_GREEDY_PARSING_FLAG: Set to use faster greedy parsing, instead of more
1790  // efficient lazy parsing.
1791  // TDEFL_NONDETERMINISTIC_PARSING_FLAG: Enable to decrease the compressor's
1792  // initialization time to the minimum, but the output may vary from run to run
1793  // given the same input (depending on the contents of memory).
1794  // TDEFL_RLE_MATCHES: Only look for RLE matches (matches with a distance of 1)
1795  // TDEFL_FILTER_MATCHES: Discards matches <= 5 chars if enabled.
1796  // TDEFL_FORCE_ALL_STATIC_BLOCKS: Disable usage of optimized Huffman tables.
1797  // TDEFL_FORCE_ALL_RAW_BLOCKS: Only use raw (uncompressed) deflate blocks.
1798  // The low 12 bits are reserved to control the max # of hash probes per
1799  // dictionary lookup (see TDEFL_MAX_PROBES_MASK).
1800  enum {
1801  TDEFL_WRITE_ZLIB_HEADER = 0x01000,
1802  TDEFL_COMPUTE_ADLER32 = 0x02000,
1803  TDEFL_GREEDY_PARSING_FLAG = 0x04000,
1804  TDEFL_NONDETERMINISTIC_PARSING_FLAG = 0x08000,
1805  TDEFL_RLE_MATCHES = 0x10000,
1806  TDEFL_FILTER_MATCHES = 0x20000,
1807  TDEFL_FORCE_ALL_STATIC_BLOCKS = 0x40000,
1808  TDEFL_FORCE_ALL_RAW_BLOCKS = 0x80000
1809  };
1810 
1811  // High level compression functions:
1812  // tdefl_compress_mem_to_heap() compresses a block in memory to a heap block
1813  // allocated via malloc().
1814  // On entry:
1815  // pSrc_buf, src_buf_len: Pointer and size of source block to compress.
1816  // flags: The max match finder probes (default is 128) logically OR'd against
1817  // the above flags. Higher probes are slower but improve compression.
1818  // On return:
1819  // Function returns a pointer to the compressed data, or NULL on failure.
1820  // *pOut_len will be set to the compressed data's size, which could be larger
1821  // than src_buf_len on uncompressible data.
1822  // The caller must free() the returned block when it's no longer needed.
1823  void *tdefl_compress_mem_to_heap(const void *pSrc_buf, size_t src_buf_len,
1824  size_t *pOut_len, int flags);
1825 
1826  // tdefl_compress_mem_to_mem() compresses a block in memory to another block in
1827  // memory.
1828  // Returns 0 on failure.
1829  size_t tdefl_compress_mem_to_mem(void *pOut_buf, size_t out_buf_len,
1830  const void *pSrc_buf, size_t src_buf_len,
1831  int flags);
1832 
1833  // Compresses an image to a compressed PNG file in memory.
1834  // On entry:
1835  // pImage, w, h, and num_chans describe the image to compress. num_chans may be
1836  // 1, 2, 3, or 4.
1837  // The image pitch in bytes per scanline will be w*num_chans. The leftmost
1838  // pixel on the top scanline is stored first in memory.
1839  // level may range from [0,10], use MZ_NO_COMPRESSION, MZ_BEST_SPEED,
1840  // MZ_BEST_COMPRESSION, etc. or a decent default is MZ_DEFAULT_LEVEL
1841  // If flip is true, the image will be flipped on the Y axis (useful for OpenGL
1842  // apps).
1843  // On return:
1844  // Function returns a pointer to the compressed data, or NULL on failure.
1845  // *pLen_out will be set to the size of the PNG image file.
1846  // The caller must mz_free() the returned heap block (which will typically be
1847  // larger than *pLen_out) when it's no longer needed.
1848  void *tdefl_write_image_to_png_file_in_memory_ex(const void *pImage, int w,
1849  int h, int num_chans,
1850  size_t *pLen_out,
1851  mz_uint level, mz_bool flip);
1852  void *tdefl_write_image_to_png_file_in_memory(const void *pImage, int w, int h,
1853  int num_chans, size_t *pLen_out);
1854 
1855  // Output stream interface. The compressor uses this interface to write
1856  // compressed data. It'll typically be called TDEFL_OUT_BUF_SIZE at a time.
1857  typedef mz_bool(*tdefl_put_buf_func_ptr)(const void *pBuf, int len,
1858  void *pUser);
1859 
1860  // tdefl_compress_mem_to_output() compresses a block to an output stream. The
1861  // above helpers use this function internally.
1862  mz_bool tdefl_compress_mem_to_output(const void *pBuf, size_t buf_len,
1863  tdefl_put_buf_func_ptr pPut_buf_func,
1864  void *pPut_buf_user, int flags);
1865 
1866  enum {
1867  TDEFL_MAX_HUFF_TABLES = 3,
1868  TDEFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS_0 = 288,
1869  TDEFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS_1 = 32,
1870  TDEFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS_2 = 19,
1871  TDEFL_LZ_DICT_SIZE = 32768,
1872  TDEFL_LZ_DICT_SIZE_MASK = TDEFL_LZ_DICT_SIZE - 1,
1873  TDEFL_MIN_MATCH_LEN = 3,
1874  TDEFL_MAX_MATCH_LEN = 258
1875  };
1876 
1877  // TDEFL_OUT_BUF_SIZE MUST be large enough to hold a single entire compressed
1878  // output block (using static/fixed Huffman codes).
1879 #if TDEFL_LESS_MEMORY
1880  enum {
1881  TDEFL_LZ_CODE_BUF_SIZE = 24 * 1024,
1882  TDEFL_OUT_BUF_SIZE = (TDEFL_LZ_CODE_BUF_SIZE * 13) / 10,
1883  TDEFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS = 288,
1884  TDEFL_LZ_HASH_BITS = 12,
1885  TDEFL_LEVEL1_HASH_SIZE_MASK = 4095,
1886  TDEFL_LZ_HASH_SHIFT = (TDEFL_LZ_HASH_BITS + 2) / 3,
1887  TDEFL_LZ_HASH_SIZE = 1 << TDEFL_LZ_HASH_BITS
1888  };
1889 #else
1890  enum {
1891  TDEFL_LZ_CODE_BUF_SIZE = 64 * 1024,
1892  TDEFL_OUT_BUF_SIZE = (TDEFL_LZ_CODE_BUF_SIZE * 13) / 10,
1893  TDEFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS = 288,
1894  TDEFL_LZ_HASH_BITS = 15,
1895  TDEFL_LEVEL1_HASH_SIZE_MASK = 4095,
1896  TDEFL_LZ_HASH_SHIFT = (TDEFL_LZ_HASH_BITS + 2) / 3,
1897  TDEFL_LZ_HASH_SIZE = 1 << TDEFL_LZ_HASH_BITS
1898  };
1899 #endif
1900 
1901  // The low-level tdefl functions below may be used directly if the above helper
1902  // functions aren't flexible enough. The low-level functions don't make any heap
1903  // allocations, unlike the above helper functions.
1904  typedef enum {
1905  TDEFL_STATUS_BAD_PARAM = -2,
1906  TDEFL_STATUS_PUT_BUF_FAILED = -1,
1907  TDEFL_STATUS_OKAY = 0,
1908  TDEFL_STATUS_DONE = 1
1909  } tdefl_status;
1910 
1911  // Must map to MZ_NO_FLUSH, MZ_SYNC_FLUSH, etc. enums
1912  typedef enum {
1913  TDEFL_NO_FLUSH = 0,
1914  TDEFL_SYNC_FLUSH = 2,
1915  TDEFL_FULL_FLUSH = 3,
1916  TDEFL_FINISH = 4
1917  } tdefl_flush;
1918 
1919  // tdefl's compression state structure.
1920  typedef struct {
1921  tdefl_put_buf_func_ptr m_pPut_buf_func;
1922  void *m_pPut_buf_user;
1923  mz_uint m_flags, m_max_probes[2];
1924  int m_greedy_parsing;
1925  mz_uint m_adler32, m_lookahead_pos, m_lookahead_size, m_dict_size;
1926  mz_uint8 *m_pLZ_code_buf, *m_pLZ_flags, *m_pOutput_buf, *m_pOutput_buf_end;
1927  mz_uint m_num_flags_left, m_total_lz_bytes, m_lz_code_buf_dict_pos, m_bits_in,
1928  m_bit_buffer;
1929  mz_uint m_saved_match_dist, m_saved_match_len, m_saved_lit,
1930  m_output_flush_ofs, m_output_flush_remaining, m_finished, m_block_index,
1931  m_wants_to_finish;
1932  tdefl_status m_prev_return_status;
1933  const void *m_pIn_buf;
1934  void *m_pOut_buf;
1935  size_t *m_pIn_buf_size, *m_pOut_buf_size;
1936  tdefl_flush m_flush;
1937  const mz_uint8 *m_pSrc;
1938  size_t m_src_buf_left, m_out_buf_ofs;
1939  mz_uint8 m_dict[TDEFL_LZ_DICT_SIZE + TDEFL_MAX_MATCH_LEN - 1];
1940  mz_uint16 m_huff_count[TDEFL_MAX_HUFF_TABLES][TDEFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS];
1941  mz_uint16 m_huff_codes[TDEFL_MAX_HUFF_TABLES][TDEFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS];
1942  mz_uint8 m_huff_code_sizes[TDEFL_MAX_HUFF_TABLES][TDEFL_MAX_HUFF_SYMBOLS];
1943  mz_uint8 m_lz_code_buf[TDEFL_LZ_CODE_BUF_SIZE];
1944  mz_uint16 m_next[TDEFL_LZ_DICT_SIZE];
1945  mz_uint16 m_hash[TDEFL_LZ_HASH_SIZE];
1946  mz_uint8 m_output_buf[TDEFL_OUT_BUF_SIZE];
1947  } tdefl_compressor;
1948 
1949  // Initializes the compressor.
1950  // There is no corresponding deinit() function because the tdefl API's do not
1951  // dynamically allocate memory.
1952  // pBut_buf_func: If NULL, output data will be supplied to the specified
1953  // callback. In this case, the user should call the tdefl_compress_buffer() API
1954  // for compression.
1955  // If pBut_buf_func is NULL the user should always call the tdefl_compress()
1956  // API.
1957  // flags: See the above enums (TDEFL_HUFFMAN_ONLY, TDEFL_WRITE_ZLIB_HEADER,
1958  // etc.)
1959  tdefl_status tdefl_init(tdefl_compressor *d,
1960  tdefl_put_buf_func_ptr pPut_buf_func,
1961  void *pPut_buf_user, int flags);
1962 
1963  // Compresses a block of data, consuming as much of the specified input buffer
1964  // as possible, and writing as much compressed data to the specified output
1965  // buffer as possible.
1966  tdefl_status tdefl_compress(tdefl_compressor *d, const void *pIn_buf,
1967  size_t *pIn_buf_size, void *pOut_buf,
1968  size_t *pOut_buf_size, tdefl_flush flush);
1969 
1970  // tdefl_compress_buffer() is only usable when the tdefl_init() is called with a
1971  // non-NULL tdefl_put_buf_func_ptr.
1972  // tdefl_compress_buffer() always consumes the entire input buffer.
1973  tdefl_status tdefl_compress_buffer(tdefl_compressor *d, const void *pIn_buf,
1974  size_t in_buf_size, tdefl_flush flush);
1975 
1976  tdefl_status tdefl_get_prev_return_status(tdefl_compressor *d);
1977  mz_uint32 tdefl_get_adler32(tdefl_compressor *d);
1978 
1979  // Can't use tdefl_create_comp_flags_from_zip_params if MINIZ_NO_ZLIB_APIS isn't
