6366  (pZip->m_file_offset_alignment - 1);
6367  }
6368 
6369  static mz_bool mz_zip_writer_write_zeros(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
6370  mz_uint64 cur_file_ofs, mz_uint32 n) {
6371  char buf[4096];
6372  memset(buf, 0, MZ_MIN(sizeof(buf), n));
6373  while (n) {
6374  mz_uint32 s = MZ_MIN(sizeof(buf), n);
6375  if (pZip->m_pWrite(pZip->m_pIO_opaque, cur_file_ofs, buf, s) != s)
6376  return MZ_FALSE;
6377  cur_file_ofs += s;
6378  n -= s;
6379  }
6380  return MZ_TRUE;
6381  }
6382 
6383  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_add_mem_ex(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
6384  const char *pArchive_name, const void *pBuf,
6385  size_t buf_size, const void *pComment,
6386  mz_uint16 comment_size,
6387  mz_uint level_and_flags, mz_uint64 uncomp_size,
6388  mz_uint32 uncomp_crc32) {
6389  mz_uint16 method = 0, dos_time = 0, dos_date = 0;
6390  mz_uint level, ext_attributes = 0, num_alignment_padding_bytes;
6391  mz_uint64 local_dir_header_ofs = pZip->m_archive_size,
6392  cur_archive_file_ofs = pZip->m_archive_size, comp_size = 0;
6393  size_t archive_name_size;
6394  mz_uint8 local_dir_header[MZ_ZIP_LOCAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE];
6395  tdefl_compressor *pComp = NULL;
6396  mz_bool store_data_uncompressed;
6397  mz_zip_internal_state *pState;
6398 
6399  if ((int)level_and_flags < 0) level_and_flags = MZ_DEFAULT_LEVEL;
6400  level = level_and_flags & 0xF;
6401  store_data_uncompressed =
6402  ((!level) || (level_and_flags & MZ_ZIP_FLAG_COMPRESSED_DATA));
6403 
6404  if ((!pZip) || (!pZip->m_pState) ||
6405  (pZip->m_zip_mode != MZ_ZIP_MODE_WRITING) || ((buf_size) && (!pBuf)) ||
6406  (!pArchive_name) || ((comment_size) && (!pComment)) ||
6407  (pZip->m_total_files == 0xFFFF) || (level > MZ_UBER_COMPRESSION))
6408  return MZ_FALSE;
6409 
6410  pState = pZip->m_pState;
6411 
6412  if ((!(level_and_flags & MZ_ZIP_FLAG_COMPRESSED_DATA)) && (uncomp_size))
6413  return MZ_FALSE;
6414  // No zip64 support yet
6415  if ((buf_size > 0xFFFFFFFF) || (uncomp_size > 0xFFFFFFFF)) return MZ_FALSE;
6416  if (!mz_zip_writer_validate_archive_name(pArchive_name)) return MZ_FALSE;
6417 
6418 #ifndef MINIZ_NO_TIME
6419  {
6420  time_t cur_time;
6421  time(&cur_time);
6422  mz_zip_time_to_dos_time(cur_time, &dos_time, &dos_date);
6423  }
6424 #endif // #ifndef MINIZ_NO_TIME
6425 
6426  archive_name_size = strlen(pArchive_name);
6427  if (archive_name_size > 0xFFFF) return MZ_FALSE;
6428 
6429  num_alignment_padding_bytes =
6430  mz_zip_writer_compute_padding_needed_for_file_alignment(pZip);
6431 
6432  // no zip64 support yet
6433  if ((pZip->m_total_files == 0xFFFF) ||
6434  ((pZip->m_archive_size + num_alignment_padding_bytes +
6435  MZ_ZIP_LOCAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE + MZ_ZIP_CENTRAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE +
6436  comment_size + archive_name_size) > 0xFFFFFFFF))
6437  return MZ_FALSE;
6438 
6439  if ((archive_name_size) && (pArchive_name[archive_name_size - 1] == '/')) {
6440  // Set DOS Subdirectory attribute bit.
6441  ext_attributes |= 0x10;
6442  // Subdirectories cannot contain data.
6443  if ((buf_size) || (uncomp_size)) return MZ_FALSE;
6444  }
6445 
6446  // Try to do any allocations before writing to the archive, so if an
6447  // allocation fails the file remains unmodified. (A good idea if we're doing
6448  // an in-place modification.)
6449  if ((!mz_zip_array_ensure_room(
6450  pZip, &pState->m_central_dir,
6451  MZ_ZIP_CENTRAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE + archive_name_size + comment_size)) ||
6452  (!mz_zip_array_ensure_room(pZip, &pState->m_central_dir_offsets, 1)))
6453  return MZ_FALSE;
6454 
6455  if ((!store_data_uncompressed) && (buf_size)) {
6456  if (NULL == (pComp = (tdefl_compressor *)pZip->m_pAlloc(
6457  pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, 1, sizeof(tdefl_compressor))))
6458  return MZ_FALSE;
6459  }
6460 
6461  if (!mz_zip_writer_write_zeros(
6462  pZip, cur_archive_file_ofs,
6463  num_alignment_padding_bytes + sizeof(local_dir_header))) {
6464  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pComp);
6465  return MZ_FALSE;
6466  }
6467  local_dir_header_ofs += num_alignment_padding_bytes;
6468  if (pZip->m_file_offset_alignment) {
6469  MZ_ASSERT((local_dir_header_ofs & (pZip->m_file_offset_alignment - 1)) ==
6470  0);
6471  }
6472  cur_archive_file_ofs +=
6473  num_alignment_padding_bytes + sizeof(local_dir_header);
6474 
6475  MZ_CLEAR_OBJ(local_dir_header);
6476  if (pZip->m_pWrite(pZip->m_pIO_opaque, cur_archive_file_ofs, pArchive_name,
6477  archive_name_size) != archive_name_size) {
6478  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pComp);
6479  return MZ_FALSE;
6480  }
6481  cur_archive_file_ofs += archive_name_size;
6482 
6483  if (!(level_and_flags & MZ_ZIP_FLAG_COMPRESSED_DATA)) {
6484  uncomp_crc32 =
6485  (mz_uint32)mz_crc32(MZ_CRC32_INIT, (const mz_uint8 *)pBuf, buf_size);
6486  uncomp_size = buf_size;
6487  if (uncomp_size <= 3) {
6488  level = 0;
6489  store_data_uncompressed = MZ_TRUE;
6490  }
6491  }
6492 
6493  if (store_data_uncompressed) {
6494  if (pZip->m_pWrite(pZip->m_pIO_opaque, cur_archive_file_ofs, pBuf,
6495  buf_size) != buf_size) {
6496  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pComp);
6497  return MZ_FALSE;
6498  }
6499 
6500  cur_archive_file_ofs += buf_size;
6501  comp_size = buf_size;
6502 
6503  if (level_and_flags & MZ_ZIP_FLAG_COMPRESSED_DATA) method = MZ_DEFLATED;
6504  }
6505  else if (buf_size) {
6506  mz_zip_writer_add_state state;
6507 
6508  state.m_pZip = pZip;
6509  state.m_cur_archive_file_ofs = cur_archive_file_ofs;
6510  state.m_comp_size = 0;
6511 
6512  if ((tdefl_init(pComp, mz_zip_writer_add_put_buf_callback, &state,
6513  tdefl_create_comp_flags_from_zip_params(
6514  level, -15, MZ_DEFAULT_STRATEGY)) !=
6515  TDEFL_STATUS_OKAY) ||
6516  (tdefl_compress_buffer(pComp, pBuf, buf_size, TDEFL_FINISH) !=
6517  TDEFL_STATUS_DONE)) {
6518  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pComp);
6519  return MZ_FALSE;
6520  }
6521 
6522  comp_size = state.m_comp_size;
6523  cur_archive_file_ofs = state.m_cur_archive_file_ofs;
6524 
6525  method = MZ_DEFLATED;
6526  }
6527 
6528  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pComp);
6529  pComp = NULL;
6530 
6531  // no zip64 support yet
6532  if ((comp_size > 0xFFFFFFFF) || (cur_archive_file_ofs > 0xFFFFFFFF))
6533  return MZ_FALSE;
6534 
6535  if (!mz_zip_writer_create_local_dir_header(
6536  pZip, local_dir_header, (mz_uint16)archive_name_size, 0, uncomp_size,
6537  comp_size, uncomp_crc32, method, 0, dos_time, dos_date))
6538  return MZ_FALSE;
6539 
6540  if (pZip->m_pWrite(pZip->m_pIO_opaque, local_dir_header_ofs, local_dir_header,
6541  sizeof(local_dir_header)) != sizeof(local_dir_header))
6542  return MZ_FALSE;
6543 
6544  if (!mz_zip_writer_add_to_central_dir(
6545  pZip, pArchive_name, (mz_uint16)archive_name_size, NULL, 0, pComment,
6546  comment_size, uncomp_size, comp_size, uncomp_crc32, method, 0,
6547  dos_time, dos_date, local_dir_header_ofs, ext_attributes))
6548  return MZ_FALSE;
6549 
6550  pZip->m_total_files++;
6551  pZip->m_archive_size = cur_archive_file_ofs;
6552 
6553  return MZ_TRUE;
6554  }
6555 
6556 #ifndef MINIZ_NO_STDIO
6557  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_add_file(mz_zip_archive *pZip, const char *pArchive_name,
6558  const char *pSrc_filename, const void *pComment,
6559  mz_uint16 comment_size,
6560  mz_uint level_and_flags) {
6561  mz_uint uncomp_crc32 = MZ_CRC32_INIT, level, num_alignment_padding_bytes;
6562  mz_uint16 method = 0, dos_time = 0, dos_date = 0, ext_attributes = 0;
6563  mz_uint64 local_dir_header_ofs = pZip->m_archive_size,
6564  cur_archive_file_ofs = pZip->m_archive_size, uncomp_size = 0,
6565  comp_size = 0;
6566  size_t archive_name_size;
6567  mz_uint8 local_dir_header[MZ_ZIP_LOCAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE];
6568  MZ_FILE *pSrc_file = NULL;
6569 
6570  if ((int)level_and_flags < 0) level_and_flags = MZ_DEFAULT_LEVEL;
6571  level = level_and_flags & 0xF;
6572 
6573  if ((!pZip) || (!pZip->m_pState) ||
6574  (pZip->m_zip_mode != MZ_ZIP_MODE_WRITING) || (!pArchive_name) ||
6575  ((comment_size) && (!pComment)) || (level > MZ_UBER_COMPRESSION))
6576  return MZ_FALSE;
6577  if (level_and_flags & MZ_ZIP_FLAG_COMPRESSED_DATA) return MZ_FALSE;
6578  if (!mz_zip_writer_validate_archive_name(pArchive_name)) return MZ_FALSE;
6579 
6580  archive_name_size = strlen(pArchive_name);
6581  if (archive_name_size > 0xFFFF) return MZ_FALSE;
6582 
6583  num_alignment_padding_bytes =
6584  mz_zip_writer_compute_padding_needed_for_file_alignment(pZip);
6585 
6586  // no zip64 support yet
6587  if ((pZip->m_total_files == 0xFFFF) ||
6588  ((pZip->m_archive_size + num_alignment_padding_bytes +
6589  MZ_ZIP_LOCAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE + MZ_ZIP_CENTRAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE +
6590  comment_size + archive_name_size) > 0xFFFFFFFF))
6591  return MZ_FALSE;
6592 
6593  if (!mz_zip_get_file_modified_time(pSrc_filename, &dos_time, &dos_date))
6594  return MZ_FALSE;
6595 
6596  pSrc_file = MZ_FOPEN(pSrc_filename, "rb");
6597  if (!pSrc_file) return MZ_FALSE;
6598  MZ_FSEEK64(pSrc_file, 0, SEEK_END);
6599  uncomp_size = MZ_FTELL64(pSrc_file);
6600  MZ_FSEEK64(pSrc_file, 0, SEEK_SET);
6601 
6602  if (uncomp_size > 0xFFFFFFFF) {
6603  // No zip64 support yet
6604  MZ_FCLOSE(pSrc_file);
6605  return MZ_FALSE;
6606  }
6607  if (uncomp_size <= 3) level = 0;
6608 
6609  if (!mz_zip_writer_write_zeros(
6610  pZip, cur_archive_file_ofs,
6611  num_alignment_padding_bytes + sizeof(local_dir_header))) {
6612  MZ_FCLOSE(pSrc_file);
6613  return MZ_FALSE;
6614  }
6615  local_dir_header_ofs += num_alignment_padding_bytes;
6616  if (pZip->m_file_offset_alignment) {
6617  MZ_ASSERT((local_dir_header_ofs & (pZip->m_file_offset_alignment - 1)) ==
6618  0);
6619  }
6620  cur_archive_file_ofs +=
6621  num_alignment_padding_bytes + sizeof(local_dir_header);
6622 
6623  MZ_CLEAR_OBJ(local_dir_header);
6624  if (pZip->m_pWrite(pZip->m_pIO_opaque, cur_archive_file_ofs, pArchive_name,
6625  archive_name_size) != archive_name_size) {
6626  MZ_FCLOSE(pSrc_file);
6627  return MZ_FALSE;
6628  }
6629  cur_archive_file_ofs += archive_name_size;
6630 
6631  if (uncomp_size) {
6632  mz_uint64 uncomp_remaining = uncomp_size;
6633  void *pRead_buf =
6634  pZip->m_pAlloc(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, 1, MZ_ZIP_MAX_IO_BUF_SIZE);
6635  if (!pRead_buf) {
6636  MZ_FCLOSE(pSrc_file);
6637  return MZ_FALSE;
6638  }
6639 
6640  if (!level) {
6641  while (uncomp_remaining) {
6642  mz_uint n =
6643  (mz_uint)MZ_MIN((mz_uint)MZ_ZIP_MAX_IO_BUF_SIZE, uncomp_remaining);
6644  if ((MZ_FREAD(pRead_buf, 1, n, pSrc_file) != n) ||
6645  (pZip->m_pWrite(pZip->m_pIO_opaque, cur_archive_file_ofs, pRead_buf,
6646  n) != n)) {
6647  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pRead_buf);
6648  MZ_FCLOSE(pSrc_file);
6649  return MZ_FALSE;
6650  }
6651  uncomp_crc32 =
6652  (mz_uint32)mz_crc32(uncomp_crc32, (const mz_uint8 *)pRead_buf, n);
6653  uncomp_remaining -= n;
6654  cur_archive_file_ofs += n;
6655  }
6656  comp_size = uncomp_size;
6657  }
6658  else {
6659  mz_bool result = MZ_FALSE;
6660  mz_zip_writer_add_state state;
6661  tdefl_compressor *pComp = (tdefl_compressor *)pZip->m_pAlloc(
6662  pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, 1, sizeof(tdefl_compressor));
6663  if (!pComp) {
6664  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pRead_buf);
6665  MZ_FCLOSE(pSrc_file);
6666  return MZ_FALSE;
6667  }
6668 
6669  state.m_pZip = pZip;
6670  state.m_cur_archive_file_ofs = cur_archive_file_ofs;
6671  state.m_comp_size = 0;
6672 
6673  if (tdefl_init(pComp, mz_zip_writer_add_put_buf_callback, &state,
6674  tdefl_create_comp_flags_from_zip_params(
6675  level, -15, MZ_DEFAULT_STRATEGY)) !=
6676  TDEFL_STATUS_OKAY) {
6677  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pComp);
6678  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pRead_buf);
6679  MZ_FCLOSE(pSrc_file);
6680  return MZ_FALSE;
6681  }
6682 
6683  for (;;) {
6684  size_t in_buf_size = (mz_uint32)MZ_MIN(uncomp_remaining,
6685  (mz_uint)MZ_ZIP_MAX_IO_BUF_SIZE);
6686  tdefl_status status;
6687 
6688  if (MZ_FREAD(pRead_buf, 1, in_buf_size, pSrc_file) != in_buf_size)
6689  break;
6690 
6691  uncomp_crc32 = (mz_uint32)mz_crc32(
6692  uncomp_crc32, (const mz_uint8 *)pRead_buf, in_buf_size);
6693  uncomp_remaining -= in_buf_size;
6694 
6695  status = tdefl_compress_buffer(
6696  pComp, pRead_buf, in_buf_size,
6697  uncomp_remaining ? TDEFL_NO_FLUSH : TDEFL_FINISH);
6698  if (status == TDEFL_STATUS_DONE) {
6699  result = MZ_TRUE;
6700  break;
6701  }
6702  else if (status != TDEFL_STATUS_OKAY)
6703  break;
6704  }
6705 
6706  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pComp);
6707 
6708  if (!result) {
6709  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pRead_buf);
6710  MZ_FCLOSE(pSrc_file);
6711  return MZ_FALSE;
6712  }
6713 
6714  comp_size = state.m_comp_size;
6715  cur_archive_file_ofs = state.m_cur_archive_file_ofs;
6716 
6717  method = MZ_DEFLATED;
6718  }
6719 
6720  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pRead_buf);
6721  }
6722 
6723  MZ_FCLOSE(pSrc_file);
6724  pSrc_file = NULL;
6725 
6726  // no zip64 support yet
6727  if ((comp_size > 0xFFFFFFFF) || (cur_archive_file_ofs > 0xFFFFFFFF))
6728  return MZ_FALSE;
6729 
6730  if (!mz_zip_writer_create_local_dir_header(
6731  pZip, local_dir_header, (mz_uint16)archive_name_size, 0, uncomp_size,
6732  comp_size, uncomp_crc32, method, 0, dos_time, dos_date))
6733  return MZ_FALSE;
6734 
6735  if (pZip->m_pWrite(pZip->m_pIO_opaque, local_dir_header_ofs, local_dir_header,
6736  sizeof(local_dir_header)) != sizeof(local_dir_header))
6737  return MZ_FALSE;
6738 
6739  if (!mz_zip_writer_add_to_central_dir(
6740  pZip, pArchive_name, (mz_uint16)archive_name_size, NULL, 0, pComment,
6741  comment_size, uncomp_size, comp_size, uncomp_crc32, method, 0,
6742  dos_time, dos_date, local_dir_header_ofs, ext_attributes))
6743  return MZ_FALSE;
6744 
6745  pZip->m_total_files++;
6746  pZip->m_archive_size = cur_archive_file_ofs;
6747 
6748  return MZ_TRUE;
6749  }
6750 #endif // #ifndef MINIZ_NO_STDIO
6751 
6752  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_add_from_zip_reader(mz_zip_archive *pZip,
6753  mz_zip_archive *pSource_zip,
6754  mz_uint file_index) {
6755  mz_uint n, bit_flags, num_alignment_padding_bytes;
6756  mz_uint64 comp_bytes_remaining, local_dir_header_ofs;
6757  mz_uint64 cur_src_file_ofs, cur_dst_file_ofs;
6758  mz_uint32
6759  local_header_u32[(MZ_ZIP_LOCAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE + sizeof(mz_uint32) - 1) /
6760  sizeof(mz_uint32)];
6761  mz_uint8 *pLocal_header = (mz_uint8 *)local_header_u32;
6762  mz_uint8 central_header[MZ_ZIP_CENTRAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE];
6763  size_t orig_central_dir_size;
6764  mz_zip_internal_state *pState;
6765  void *pBuf;
6766  const mz_uint8 *pSrc_central_header;
6767 
6768  if ((!pZip) || (!pZip->m_pState) || (pZip->m_zip_mode != MZ_ZIP_MODE_WRITING))
6769  return MZ_FALSE;
6770  if (NULL ==
6771  (pSrc_central_header = mz_zip_reader_get_cdh(pSource_zip, file_index)))
6772  return MZ_FALSE;
6773  pState = pZip->m_pState;
6774 
6775  num_alignment_padding_bytes =
6776  mz_zip_writer_compute_padding_needed_for_file_alignment(pZip);
6777 
6778  // no zip64 support yet
6779  if ((pZip->m_total_files == 0xFFFF) ||
6780  ((pZip->m_archive_size + num_alignment_padding_bytes +
6781  MZ_ZIP_LOCAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE + MZ_ZIP_CENTRAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE) >
6782  0xFFFFFFFF))
6783  return MZ_FALSE;
6784 
6785  cur_src_file_ofs =
6786  MZ_READ_LE32(pSrc_central_header + MZ_ZIP_CDH_LOCAL_HEADER_OFS);
6787  cur_dst_file_ofs = pZip->m_archive_size;
6788 
6789  if (pSource_zip->m_pRead(pSource_zip->m_pIO_opaque, cur_src_file_ofs,
6790  pLocal_header, MZ_ZIP_LOCAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE) !=
6791  MZ_ZIP_LOCAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE)
6792  return MZ_FALSE;
6793  if (MZ_READ_LE32(pLocal_header) != MZ_ZIP_LOCAL_DIR_HEADER_SIG)
6794  return MZ_FALSE;
6795  cur_src_file_ofs += MZ_ZIP_LOCAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE;
6796 
6797  if (!mz_zip_writer_write_zeros(pZip, cur_dst_file_ofs,
6798  num_alignment_padding_bytes))
6799  return MZ_FALSE;
6800  cur_dst_file_ofs += num_alignment_padding_bytes;
6801  local_dir_header_ofs = cur_dst_file_ofs;
6802  if (pZip->m_file_offset_alignment) {
6803  MZ_ASSERT((local_dir_header_ofs & (pZip->m_file_offset_alignment - 1)) ==
6804  0);
6805  }
6806 
6807  if (pZip->m_pWrite(pZip->m_pIO_opaque, cur_dst_file_ofs, pLocal_header,
6808  MZ_ZIP_LOCAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE) !=
6809  MZ_ZIP_LOCAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE)
6810  return MZ_FALSE;
6811  cur_dst_file_ofs += MZ_ZIP_LOCAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE;
6812 
6813  n = MZ_READ_LE16(pLocal_header + MZ_ZIP_LDH_FILENAME_LEN_OFS) +
6814  MZ_READ_LE16(pLocal_header + MZ_ZIP_LDH_EXTRA_LEN_OFS);
6815  comp_bytes_remaining =
6816  n + MZ_READ_LE32(pSrc_central_header + MZ_ZIP_CDH_COMPRESSED_SIZE_OFS);
6817 
6818  if (NULL == (pBuf = pZip->m_pAlloc(
6819  pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, 1,
6820  (size_t)MZ_MAX(sizeof(mz_uint32) * 4,
6821  MZ_MIN((mz_uint)MZ_ZIP_MAX_IO_BUF_SIZE,
6822  comp_bytes_remaining)))))
6823  return MZ_FALSE;
6824 
6825  while (comp_bytes_remaining) {
6826  n = (mz_uint)MZ_MIN((mz_uint)MZ_ZIP_MAX_IO_BUF_SIZE, comp_bytes_remaining);
6827  if (pSource_zip->m_pRead(pSource_zip->m_pIO_opaque, cur_src_file_ofs, pBuf,
6828  n) != n) {
6829  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pBuf);
6830  return MZ_FALSE;
6831  }
6832  cur_src_file_ofs += n;
6833 
6834  if (pZip->m_pWrite(pZip->m_pIO_opaque, cur_dst_file_ofs, pBuf, n) != n) {
6835  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pBuf);
6836  return MZ_FALSE;
6837  }
6838  cur_dst_file_ofs += n;
6839 
6840  comp_bytes_remaining -= n;
6841  }
6842 
6843  bit_flags = MZ_READ_LE16(pLocal_header + MZ_ZIP_LDH_BIT_FLAG_OFS);
6844  if (bit_flags & 8) {
6845  // Copy data descriptor
6846  if (pSource_zip->m_pRead(pSource_zip->m_pIO_opaque, cur_src_file_ofs, pBuf,
6847  sizeof(mz_uint32) * 4) != sizeof(mz_uint32) * 4) {
6848  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pBuf);
6849  return MZ_FALSE;
6850  }
6851 
6852  n = sizeof(mz_uint32) * ((MZ_READ_LE32(pBuf) == 0x08074b50) ? 4 : 3);
6853  if (pZip->m_pWrite(pZip->m_pIO_opaque, cur_dst_file_ofs, pBuf, n) != n) {
6854  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pBuf);
6855  return MZ_FALSE;
6856  }
6857 
6858  cur_src_file_ofs += n;
6859  cur_dst_file_ofs += n;
6860  }
6861  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pBuf);
6862 
6863  // no zip64 support yet
6864  if (cur_dst_file_ofs > 0xFFFFFFFF) return MZ_FALSE;
6865 
6866  orig_central_dir_size = pState->m_central_dir.m_size;
6867 
6868  memcpy(central_header, pSrc_central_header, MZ_ZIP_CENTRAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE);
6869  MZ_WRITE_LE32(central_header + MZ_ZIP_CDH_LOCAL_HEADER_OFS,
6870  local_dir_header_ofs);
6871  if (!mz_zip_array_push_back(pZip, &pState->m_central_dir, central_header,
6872  MZ_ZIP_CENTRAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE))
6873  return MZ_FALSE;
6874 
6875  n = MZ_READ_LE16(pSrc_central_header + MZ_ZIP_CDH_FILENAME_LEN_OFS) +
6876  MZ_READ_LE16(pSrc_central_header + MZ_ZIP_CDH_EXTRA_LEN_OFS) +
6877  MZ_READ_LE16(pSrc_central_header + MZ_ZIP_CDH_COMMENT_LEN_OFS);
6878  if (!mz_zip_array_push_back(
6879  pZip, &pState->m_central_dir,
6880  pSrc_central_header + MZ_ZIP_CENTRAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE, n)) {
6881  mz_zip_array_resize(pZip, &pState->m_central_dir, orig_central_dir_size,
6882  MZ_FALSE);
6883  return MZ_FALSE;
6884  }
6885 
6886  if (pState->m_central_dir.m_size > 0xFFFFFFFF) return MZ_FALSE;
6887  n = (mz_uint32)orig_central_dir_size;
6888  if (!mz_zip_array_push_back(pZip, &pState->m_central_dir_offsets, &n, 1)) {
6889  mz_zip_array_resize(pZip, &pState->m_central_dir, orig_central_dir_size,
6890  MZ_FALSE);
6891  return MZ_FALSE;
6892  }
6893 
6894  pZip->m_total_files++;
6895  pZip->m_archive_size = cur_dst_file_ofs;
6896 
6897  return MZ_TRUE;
6898  }
6899 
6900  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_finalize_archive(mz_zip_archive *pZip) {
6901  mz_zip_internal_state *pState;
6902  mz_uint64 central_dir_ofs, central_dir_size;
6903  mz_uint8 hdr[MZ_ZIP_END_OF_CENTRAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE];
6904 
6905  if ((!pZip) || (!pZip->m_pState) || (pZip->m_zip_mode != MZ_ZIP_MODE_WRITING))
6906  return MZ_FALSE;
6907 
6908  pState = pZip->m_pState;
6909 
6910  // no zip64 support yet
6911  if ((pZip->m_total_files > 0xFFFF) ||
6912  ((pZip->m_archive_size + pState->m_central_dir.m_size +
6913  MZ_ZIP_END_OF_CENTRAL_DIR_HEADER_SIZE) > 0xFFFFFFFF))
6914  return MZ_FALSE;
6915 
6916  central_dir_ofs = 0;
6917  central_dir_size = 0;
6918  if (pZip->m_total_files) {
6919  // Write central directory
6920  central_dir_ofs = pZip->m_archive_size;
6921  central_dir_size = pState->m_central_dir.m_size;
6922  pZip->m_central_directory_file_ofs = central_dir_ofs;
6923  if (pZip->m_pWrite(pZip->m_pIO_opaque, central_dir_ofs,
6924  pState->m_central_dir.m_p,
6925  (size_t)central_dir_size) != central_dir_size)
6926  return MZ_FALSE;
6927  pZip->m_archive_size += central_dir_size;
6928  }
6929 
6930  // Write end of central directory record
6931  MZ_CLEAR_OBJ(hdr);
6932  MZ_WRITE_LE32(hdr + MZ_ZIP_ECDH_SIG_OFS,
6933  MZ_ZIP_END_OF_CENTRAL_DIR_HEADER_SIG);
6934  MZ_WRITE_LE16(hdr + MZ_ZIP_ECDH_CDIR_NUM_ENTRIES_ON_DISK_OFS,
6935  pZip->m_total_files);
6936  MZ_WRITE_LE16(hdr + MZ_ZIP_ECDH_CDIR_TOTAL_ENTRIES_OFS, pZip->m_total_files);
6937  MZ_WRITE_LE32(hdr + MZ_ZIP_ECDH_CDIR_SIZE_OFS, central_dir_size);
6938  MZ_WRITE_LE32(hdr + MZ_ZIP_ECDH_CDIR_OFS_OFS, central_dir_ofs);
6939 
6940  if (pZip->m_pWrite(pZip->m_pIO_opaque, pZip->m_archive_size, hdr,
6941  sizeof(hdr)) != sizeof(hdr))
6942  return MZ_FALSE;
6943 #ifndef MINIZ_NO_STDIO
6944  if ((pState->m_pFile) && (MZ_FFLUSH(pState->m_pFile) == EOF)) return MZ_FALSE;
6945 #endif // #ifndef MINIZ_NO_STDIO
6946 
6947  pZip->m_archive_size += sizeof(hdr);
6948 
6949  pZip->m_zip_mode = MZ_ZIP_MODE_WRITING_HAS_BEEN_FINALIZED;
6950  return MZ_TRUE;
6951  }
6952 
6953  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_finalize_heap_archive(mz_zip_archive *pZip, void **pBuf,
6954  size_t *pSize) {
6955  if ((!pZip) || (!pZip->m_pState) || (!pBuf) || (!pSize)) return MZ_FALSE;
6956  if (pZip->m_pWrite != mz_zip_heap_write_func) return MZ_FALSE;
6957  if (!mz_zip_writer_finalize_archive(pZip)) return MZ_FALSE;
6958 
6959  *pBuf = pZip->m_pState->m_pMem;
6960  *pSize = pZip->m_pState->m_mem_size;
6961  pZip->m_pState->m_pMem = NULL;
6962  pZip->m_pState->m_mem_size = pZip->m_pState->m_mem_capacity = 0;
6963  return MZ_TRUE;
6964  }
6965 
6966  mz_bool mz_zip_writer_end(mz_zip_archive *pZip) {
6967  mz_zip_internal_state *pState;
6968  mz_bool status = MZ_TRUE;
6969  if ((!pZip) || (!pZip->m_pState) || (!pZip->m_pAlloc) || (!pZip->m_pFree) ||
6970  ((pZip->m_zip_mode != MZ_ZIP_MODE_WRITING) &&
6971  (pZip->m_zip_mode != MZ_ZIP_MODE_WRITING_HAS_BEEN_FINALIZED)))
6972  return MZ_FALSE;
6973 
6974  pState = pZip->m_pState;
6975  pZip->m_pState = NULL;
6976  mz_zip_array_clear(pZip, &pState->m_central_dir);
6977  mz_zip_array_clear(pZip, &pState->m_central_dir_offsets);
6978  mz_zip_array_clear(pZip, &pState->m_sorted_central_dir_offsets);
6979 
6980 #ifndef MINIZ_NO_STDIO
6981  if (pState->m_pFile) {
6982  MZ_FCLOSE(pState->m_pFile);
6983  pState->m_pFile = NULL;
6984  }
6985 #endif // #ifndef MINIZ_NO_STDIO
6986 
6987  if ((pZip->m_pWrite == mz_zip_heap_write_func) && (pState->m_pMem)) {
6988  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pState->m_pMem);
6989  pState->m_pMem = NULL;
6990  }
6991 
6992  pZip->m_pFree(pZip->m_pAlloc_opaque, pState);
6993  pZip->m_zip_mode = MZ_ZIP_MODE_INVALID;
6994  return status;
6995  }
6996 
6997 #ifndef MINIZ_NO_STDIO
6998  mz_bool mz_zip_add_mem_to_archive_file_in_place(
6999  const char *pZip_filename, const char *pArchive_name, const void *pBuf,
7000  size_t buf_size, const void *pComment, mz_uint16 comment_size,
7001  mz_uint level_and_flags) {
7002  mz_bool status, created_new_archive = MZ_FALSE;
7003  mz_zip_archive zip_archive;
7004  struct MZ_FILE_STAT_STRUCT file_stat;
7005  MZ_CLEAR_OBJ(zip_archive);
7006  if ((int)level_and_flags < 0) level_and_flags = MZ_DEFAULT_LEVEL;
7007  if ((!pZip_filename) || (!pArchive_name) || ((buf_size) && (!pBuf)) ||
7008  ((comment_size) && (!pComment)) ||
7009  ((level_and_flags & 0xF) > MZ_UBER_COMPRESSION))
7010  return MZ_FALSE;
7011  if (!mz_zip_writer_validate_archive_name(pArchive_name)) return MZ_FALSE;
7012  if (MZ_FILE_STAT(pZip_filename, &file_stat) != 0) {
7013  // Create a new archive.
7014  if (!mz_zip_writer_init_file(&zip_archive, pZip_filename, 0))
7015  return MZ_FALSE;
7016  created_new_archive = MZ_TRUE;
7017  }
7018  else {
7019  // Append to an existing archive.
7020  if (!mz_zip_reader_init_file(
7021  &zip_archive, pZip_filename,
7022  level_and_flags | MZ_ZIP_FLAG_DO_NOT_SORT_CENTRAL_DIRECTORY))
7023  return MZ_FALSE;
7024  if (!mz_zip_writer_init_from_reader(&zip_archive, pZip_filename)) {
7025  mz_zip_reader_end(&zip_archive);
7026  return MZ_FALSE;
7027  }
7028  }
7029  status =
7030  mz_zip_writer_add_mem_ex(&zip_archive, pArchive_name, pBuf, buf_size,
7031  pComment, comment_size, level_and_flags, 0, 0);
7032  // Always finalize, even if adding failed for some reason, so we have a valid
7033  // central directory. (This may not always succeed, but we can try.)
7034  if (!mz_zip_writer_finalize_archive(&zip_archive)) status = MZ_FALSE;
7035  if (!mz_zip_writer_end(&zip_archive)) status = MZ_FALSE;
7036  if ((!status) && (created_new_archive)) {
7037  // It's a new archive and something went wrong, so just delete it.
7038  int ignoredStatus = MZ_DELETE_FILE(pZip_filename);
7039  (void)ignoredStatus;
7040  }
7041  return status;
7042  }
7043 
7044  void *mz_zip_extract_archive_file_to_heap(const char *pZip_filename,
7045  const char *pArchive_name,
7046  size_t *pSize, mz_uint flags) {
7047  int file_index;
7048  mz_zip_archive zip_archive;
7049  void *p = NULL;
7050 
7051  if (pSize) *pSize = 0;
7052 
7053  if ((!pZip_filename) || (!pArchive_name)) return NULL;
7054 
7055  MZ_CLEAR_OBJ(zip_archive);
7056  if (!mz_zip_reader_init_file(
7057  &zip_archive, pZip_filename,
7058  flags | MZ_ZIP_FLAG_DO_NOT_SORT_CENTRAL_DIRECTORY))
7059  return NULL;
7060 
7061  if ((file_index = mz_zip_reader_locate_file(&zip_archive, pArchive_name, NULL,
7062  flags)) >= 0)
7063  p = mz_zip_reader_extract_to_heap(&zip_archive, file_index, pSize, flags);
7064 
7065  mz_zip_reader_end(&zip_archive);
7066  return p;
7067  }
7068 
7069 #endif // #ifndef MINIZ_NO_STDIO
7070 
7071 #endif // #ifndef MINIZ_NO_ARCHIVE_WRITING_APIS
7072 
7073 #endif // #ifndef MINIZ_NO_ARCHIVE_APIS
7074 
7075 #ifdef __cplusplus
7076  }
7077 #endif
7078 
7079 #ifdef _MSC_VER
7080 #pragma warning(pop)
7081 #endif
7082 
7083 #endif // MINIZ_HEADER_FILE_ONLY

7121  // Reuse MINIZ_LITTE_ENDIAN macro
7122 
7123 #if defined(_M_IX86) || defined(_M_X64) || defined(__i386__) || \
7124  defined(__i386) || defined(__i486__) || defined(__i486) || \
7125  defined(i386) || defined(__ia64__) || defined(__x86_64__)
7126 // MINIZ_X86_OR_X64_CPU is only used to help set the below macros.
7127 #define MINIZ_X86_OR_X64_CPU 1
7128 #endif
7129 
7130 #if defined(__sparcv9)
7131 // Big endian
7132 #else
7133 #if (__BYTE_ORDER__ == __ORDER_LITTLE_ENDIAN__) || MINIZ_X86_OR_X64_CPU
7134 // Set MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN to 1 if the processor is little endian.
7135 #define MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN 1
7136 #endif
7137 #endif
7138 
7139 #endif // TINYEXR_USE_MINIZ

7143 // unsigned int i;

7146 //
7147 // return bint.c[0] == 1;
7148 //}
7149 
7150  static void SetErrorMessage(const std::string &msg, const char **err) {
7151  if (err) {
7152 #ifdef _WIN32
7153  (*err) = _strdup(msg.c_str());
7154 #else
7155  (*err) = strdup(msg.c_str());
7156 #endif
7157  }
7158  }
7159 
7160  static const int kEXRVersionSize = 8;
7161 
7162  static void cpy2(unsigned short *dst_val, const unsigned short *src_val) {
7163  unsigned char *dst = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(dst_val);
7164  const unsigned char *src = reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(src_val);
7165 
7166  dst[0] = src[0];
7167  dst[1] = src[1];
7168  }
7169 
7170  static void swap2(unsigned short *val) {
7171 #ifdef MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN
7172  (void)val;
7173 #else
7174  unsigned short tmp = *val;
7175  unsigned char *dst = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(val);
7176  unsigned char *src = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(&tmp);
7177 
7178  dst[0] = src[1];
7179  dst[1] = src[0];
7180 #endif
7181  }
7182 
7183 #ifdef __clang__
7184 #pragma clang diagnostic push
7185 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunused-function"
7186 #endif
7187 
7188 #ifdef __GNUC__
7189 #pragma GCC diagnostic push
7190 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wunused-function"
7191 #endif
7192  static void cpy4(int *dst_val, const int *src_val) {
7193  unsigned char *dst = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(dst_val);
7194  const unsigned char *src = reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(src_val);
7195 
7196  dst[0] = src[0];
7197  dst[1] = src[1];
7198  dst[2] = src[2];
7199  dst[3] = src[3];
7200  }
7201 
7202  static void cpy4(unsigned int *dst_val, const unsigned int *src_val) {
7203  unsigned char *dst = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(dst_val);
7204  const unsigned char *src = reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(src_val);
7205 
7206  dst[0] = src[0];
7207  dst[1] = src[1];
7208  dst[2] = src[2];
7209  dst[3] = src[3];
7210  }
7211 
7212  static void cpy4(float *dst_val, const float *src_val) {
7213  unsigned char *dst = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(dst_val);
7214  const unsigned char *src = reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(src_val);
7215 
7216  dst[0] = src[0];
7217  dst[1] = src[1];
7218  dst[2] = src[2];
7219  dst[3] = src[3];
7220  }
7221 #ifdef __clang__
7222 #pragma clang diagnostic pop
7223 #endif
7224 
7225 #ifdef __GNUC__
7226 #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
7227 #endif
7228 
7229  static void swap4(unsigned int *val) {
7230 #ifdef MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN
7231  (void)val;
7232 #else
7233  unsigned int tmp = *val;
7234  unsigned char *dst = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(val);
7235  unsigned char *src = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(&tmp);
7236 
7237  dst[0] = src[3];
7238  dst[1] = src[2];
7239  dst[2] = src[1];
7240  dst[3] = src[0];
7241 #endif
7242  }
7243 
7244  static void swap4(int *val) {
7245 #ifdef MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN
7246  (void)val;
7247 #else
7248  int tmp = *val;
7249  unsigned char *dst = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(val);
7250  unsigned char *src = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(&tmp);
7251 
7252  dst[0] = src[3];
7253  dst[1] = src[2];
7254  dst[2] = src[1];
7255  dst[3] = src[0];
7256 #endif
7257  }
7258 
7259  static void swap4(float *val) {
7260 #ifdef MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN
7261  (void)val;
7262 #else
7263  float tmp = *val;
7264  unsigned char *dst = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(val);
7265  unsigned char *src = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(&tmp);
7266 
7267  dst[0] = src[3];
7268  dst[1] = src[2];
7269  dst[2] = src[1];
7270  dst[3] = src[0];
7271 #endif
7272  }

7276  unsigned char *dst = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(dst_val);
7277  const unsigned char *src = reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(src_val);
7278 
7279  dst[0] = src[0];
7280  dst[1] = src[1];
7281  dst[2] = src[2];
7282  dst[3] = src[3];
7283  dst[4] = src[4];
7284  dst[5] = src[5];
7285  dst[6] = src[6];
7286  dst[7] = src[7];
7287  }
7288 #endif
7289 
7290  static void swap8(tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 *val) {
7291 #ifdef MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN
7292  (void)val;
7293 #else
7294  tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 tmp = (*val);
7295  unsigned char *dst = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(val);
7296  unsigned char *src = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(&tmp);
7297 
7298  dst[0] = src[7];
7299  dst[1] = src[6];
7300  dst[2] = src[5];
7301  dst[3] = src[4];
7302  dst[4] = src[3];
7303  dst[5] = src[2];
7304  dst[6] = src[1];
7305  dst[7] = src[0];
7306 #endif
7307  }
7308 
7309  // https://gist.github.com/rygorous/2156668
7310  // Reuse MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN flag from miniz.
7311  union FP32 {
7312  unsigned int u;
7313  float f;
7314  struct {
7315 #if MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN
7316  unsigned int Mantissa : 23;
7317  unsigned int Exponent : 8;
7318  unsigned int Sign : 1;
7319 #else
7320  unsigned int Sign : 1;
7321  unsigned int Exponent : 8;
7322  unsigned int Mantissa : 23;
7323 #endif
7324  } s;
7325  };
7326 
7327 #ifdef __clang__
7328 #pragma clang diagnostic push
7329 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wpadded"
7330 #endif
7331 
7332  union FP16 {
7333  unsigned short u;
7334  struct {
7335 #if MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN
7336  unsigned int Mantissa : 10;
7337  unsigned int Exponent : 5;
7338  unsigned int Sign : 1;
7339 #else
7340  unsigned int Sign : 1;
7341  unsigned int Exponent : 5;
7342  unsigned int Mantissa : 10;
7343 #endif
7344  } s;
7345  };
7346 
7347 #ifdef __clang__
7348 #pragma clang diagnostic pop
7349 #endif
7350 
7351  static FP32 half_to_float(FP16 h) {
7352  static const FP32 magic = { 113 << 23 };
7353  static const unsigned int shifted_exp = 0x7c00
7354  << 13; // exponent mask after shift
7355  FP32 o;
7356 
7357  o.u = (h.u & 0x7fffU) << 13U; // exponent/mantissa bits
7358  unsigned int exp_ = shifted_exp & o.u; // just the exponent
7359  o.u += (127 - 15) << 23; // exponent adjust
7360 
7361  // handle exponent special cases
7362  if (exp_ == shifted_exp) // Inf/NaN?
7363  o.u += (128 - 16) << 23; // extra exp adjust
7364  else if (exp_ == 0) // Zero/Denormal?
7365  {
7366  o.u += 1 << 23; // extra exp adjust
7367  o.f -= magic.f; // renormalize
7368  }
7369 
7370  o.u |= (h.u & 0x8000U) << 16U; // sign bit
7371  return o;
7372  }
7373 
7374  static FP16 float_to_half_full(FP32 f) {
7375  FP16 o = { 0 };
7376 
7377  // Based on ISPC reference code (with minor modifications)
7378  if (f.s.Exponent == 0) // Signed zero/denormal (which will underflow)
7379  o.s.Exponent = 0;
7380  else if (f.s.Exponent == 255) // Inf or NaN (all exponent bits set)
7381  {
7382  o.s.Exponent = 31;
7383  o.s.Mantissa = f.s.Mantissa ? 0x200 : 0; // NaN->qNaN and Inf->Inf
7384  }
7385  else // Normalized number
7386  {
7387  // Exponent unbias the single, then bias the halfp
7388  int newexp = f.s.Exponent - 127 + 15;
7389  if (newexp >= 31) // Overflow, return signed infinity
7390  o.s.Exponent = 31;
7391  else if (newexp <= 0) // Underflow
7392  {
7393  if ((14 - newexp) <= 24) // Mantissa might be non-zero
7394  {
7395  unsigned int mant = f.s.Mantissa | 0x800000; // Hidden 1 bit
7396  o.s.Mantissa = mant >> (14 - newexp);
7397  if ((mant >> (13 - newexp)) & 1) // Check for rounding
7398  o.u++; // Round, might overflow into exp bit, but this is OK
7399  }
7400  }
7401  else {
7402  o.s.Exponent = static_cast<unsigned int>(newexp);
7403  o.s.Mantissa = f.s.Mantissa >> 13;
7404  if (f.s.Mantissa & 0x1000) // Check for rounding
7405  o.u++; // Round, might overflow to inf, this is OK
7406  }
7407  }
7408 
7409  o.s.Sign = f.s.Sign;
7410  return o;
7411  }
7412 
7413  // NOTE: From OpenEXR code
7414  // #define IMF_INCREASING_Y 0
7415  // #define IMF_DECREASING_Y 1
7416  // #define IMF_RAMDOM_Y 2
7417  //
7418  // #define IMF_NO_COMPRESSION 0
7419  // #define IMF_RLE_COMPRESSION 1
7420  // #define IMF_ZIPS_COMPRESSION 2
7421  // #define IMF_ZIP_COMPRESSION 3
7422  // #define IMF_PIZ_COMPRESSION 4
7423  // #define IMF_PXR24_COMPRESSION 5
7424  // #define IMF_B44_COMPRESSION 6
7425  // #define IMF_B44A_COMPRESSION 7
7426 
7427 #ifdef __clang__
7428 #pragma clang diagnostic push
7429 
7430 #if __has_warning("-Wzero-as-null-pointer-constant")
7431 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wzero-as-null-pointer-constant"
7432 #endif
7433 
7434 #endif
7435 
7436  static const char *ReadString(std::string *s, const char *ptr, size_t len) {
7437  // Read untile NULL(\0).
7438  const char *p = ptr;
7439  const char *q = ptr;
7440  while ((size_t(q - ptr) < len) && (*q) != 0) {
7441  q++;
7442  }
7443 
7444  if (size_t(q - ptr) >= len) {
7445  (*s) = std::string();
7446  return NULL;
7447  }
7448 
7449  (*s) = std::string(p, q);
7450 
7451  return q + 1; // skip '\0'
7452  }
7453 
7454  static bool ReadAttribute(std::string *name, std::string *type,
7455  std::vector<unsigned char> *data, size_t *marker_size,
7456  const char *marker, size_t size) {
7457  size_t name_len = strnlen(marker, size);
7458  if (name_len == size) {
7459  // String does not have a terminating character.
7460  return false;
7461  }
7462  *name = std::string(marker, name_len);
7463 
7464  marker += name_len + 1;
7465  size -= name_len + 1;
7466 
7467  size_t type_len = strnlen(marker, size);
7468  if (type_len == size) {
7469  return false;
7470  }
7471  *type = std::string(marker, type_len);
7472 
7473  marker += type_len + 1;
7474  size -= type_len + 1;
7475 
7476  if (size < sizeof(uint32_t)) {
7477  return false;
7478  }
7479 
7480  uint32_t data_len;
7481  memcpy(&data_len, marker, sizeof(uint32_t));
7482  tinyexr::swap4(reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(&data_len));
7483 
7484  if (data_len == 0) {
7485  if ((*type).compare("string") == 0) {
7486  // Accept empty string attribute.
7487 
7488  marker += sizeof(uint32_t);
7489  size -= sizeof(uint32_t);
7490 
7491  *marker_size = name_len + 1 + type_len + 1 + sizeof(uint32_t);
7492 
7493  data->resize(1);
7494  (*data)[0] = '\0';
7495 
7496  return true;
7497  }
7498  else {
7499  return false;
7500  }
7501  }
7502 
7503  marker += sizeof(uint32_t);
7504  size -= sizeof(uint32_t);
7505 
7506  if (size < data_len) {
7507  return false;
7508  }
7509 
7510  data->resize(static_cast<size_t>(data_len));
7511  memcpy(&data->at(0), marker, static_cast<size_t>(data_len));
7512 
7513  *marker_size = name_len + 1 + type_len + 1 + sizeof(uint32_t) + data_len;
7514  return true;
7515  }
7516 
7517  static void WriteAttributeToMemory(std::vector<unsigned char> *out,
7518  const char *name, const char *type,
7519  const unsigned char *data, int len) {
7520  out->insert(out->end(), name, name + strlen(name) + 1);
7521  out->insert(out->end(), type, type + strlen(type) + 1);
7522 
7523  int outLen = len;
7524  tinyexr::swap4(&outLen);
7525  out->insert(out->end(), reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(&outLen),
7526  reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(&outLen) + sizeof(int));
7527  out->insert(out->end(), data, data + len);
7528  }
7529 
7530  typedef struct {
7531  std::string name; // less than 255 bytes long
7532  int pixel_type;
7533  int x_sampling;
7534  int y_sampling;
7535  unsigned char p_linear;
7536  unsigned char pad[3];
7537  } ChannelInfo;
7538 
7539  typedef struct {
7540  int min_x;
7541  int min_y;
7542  int max_x;
7543  int max_y;
7544  } Box2iInfo;
7545 
7546  struct HeaderInfo {
7547  std::vector<tinyexr::ChannelInfo> channels;
7548  std::vector<EXRAttribute> attributes;
7549 
7550  Box2iInfo data_window;
7551  int line_order;
7552  Box2iInfo display_window;
7553  float screen_window_center[2];
7554  float screen_window_width;
7555  float pixel_aspect_ratio;
7556 
7557  int chunk_count;
7558 
7559  // Tiled format
7560  int tiled; // Non-zero if the part is tiled.
7561  int tile_size_x;
7562  int tile_size_y;
7563  int tile_level_mode;
7564  int tile_rounding_mode;
7565 
7566  unsigned int header_len;
7567 
7568  int compression_type;
7569 
7570  // required for multi-part or non-image files
7571  std::string name;
7572  // required for multi-part or non-image files
7573  std::string type;
7574 
7575  void clear() {
7576  channels.clear();
7577  attributes.clear();
7578 
7579  data_window.min_x = 0;
7580  data_window.min_y = 0;
7581  data_window.max_x = 0;
7582  data_window.max_y = 0;
7583  line_order = 0;
7584  display_window.min_x = 0;
7585  display_window.min_y = 0;
7586  display_window.max_x = 0;
7587  display_window.max_y = 0;
7588  screen_window_center[0] = 0.0f;
7589  screen_window_center[1] = 0.0f;
7590  screen_window_width = 0.0f;
7591  pixel_aspect_ratio = 0.0f;
7592 
7593  chunk_count = 0;
7594 
7595  // Tiled format
7596  tiled = 0;
7597  tile_size_x = 0;
7598  tile_size_y = 0;
7599  tile_level_mode = 0;
7600  tile_rounding_mode = 0;
7601 
7602  header_len = 0;
7603  compression_type = 0;
7604 
7605  name.clear();
7606  type.clear();
7607  }
7608  };
7609 
7610  static bool ReadChannelInfo(std::vector<ChannelInfo> &channels,
7611  const std::vector<unsigned char> &data) {
7612  const char *p = reinterpret_cast<const char *>(&data.at(0));
7613 
7614  for (;;) {
7615  if ((*p) == 0) {
7616  break;
7617  }
7618  ChannelInfo info;
7619 
7620  tinyexr_int64 data_len = static_cast<tinyexr_int64>(data.size()) -
7621  (p - reinterpret_cast<const char *>(data.data()));
7622  if (data_len < 0) {
7623  return false;
7624  }
7625 
7626  p = ReadString(&info.name, p, size_t(data_len));
7627  if ((p == NULL) && (info.name.empty())) {
7628  // Buffer overrun. Issue #51.
7629  return false;
7630  }
7631 
7632  const unsigned char *data_end =
7633  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(p) + 16;
7634  if (data_end >= (data.data() + data.size())) {
7635  return false;
7636  }
7637 
7638  memcpy(&info.pixel_type, p, sizeof(int));
7639  p += 4;
7640  info.p_linear = static_cast<unsigned char>(p[0]); // uchar
7641  p += 1 + 3; // reserved: uchar[3]
7642  memcpy(&info.x_sampling, p, sizeof(int)); // int
7643  p += 4;
7644  memcpy(&info.y_sampling, p, sizeof(int)); // int
7645  p += 4;
7646 
7647  tinyexr::swap4(&info.pixel_type);
7648  tinyexr::swap4(&info.x_sampling);
7649  tinyexr::swap4(&info.y_sampling);
7650 
7651  channels.push_back(info);
7652  }
7653 
7654  return true;
7655  }
7656 
7657  static void WriteChannelInfo(std::vector<unsigned char> &data,
7658  const std::vector<ChannelInfo> &channels) {
7659  size_t sz = 0;
7660 
7661  // Calculate total size.
7662  for (size_t c = 0; c < channels.size(); c++) {
7663  sz += strlen(channels[c].name.c_str()) + 1; // +1 for \0
7664  sz += 16; // 4 * int
7665  }
7666  data.resize(sz + 1);
7667 
7668  unsigned char *p = &data.at(0);
7669 
7670  for (size_t c = 0; c < channels.size(); c++) {
7671  memcpy(p, channels[c].name.c_str(), strlen(channels[c].name.c_str()));
7672  p += strlen(channels[c].name.c_str());
7673  (*p) = '\0';
7674  p++;
7675 
7676  int pixel_type = channels[c].pixel_type;
7677  int x_sampling = channels[c].x_sampling;
7678  int y_sampling = channels[c].y_sampling;
7679  tinyexr::swap4(&pixel_type);
7680  tinyexr::swap4(&x_sampling);
7681  tinyexr::swap4(&y_sampling);
7682 
7683  memcpy(p, &pixel_type, sizeof(int));
7684  p += sizeof(int);
7685 
7686  (*p) = channels[c].p_linear;
7687  p += 4;
7688 
7689  memcpy(p, &x_sampling, sizeof(int));
7690  p += sizeof(int);
7691 
7692  memcpy(p, &y_sampling, sizeof(int));
7693  p += sizeof(int);
7694  }
7695 
7696  (*p) = '\0';
7697  }
7698 
7699  static void CompressZip(unsigned char *dst,
7700  tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 &compressedSize,
7701  const unsigned char *src, unsigned long src_size) {
7702  std::vector<unsigned char> tmpBuf(src_size);
7703 
7704  //
7705  // Apply EXR-specific? postprocess. Grabbed from OpenEXR's
7706  // ImfZipCompressor.cpp
7707  //
7708 
7709  //
7710  // Reorder the pixel data.
7711  //
7712 
7713  const char *srcPtr = reinterpret_cast<const char *>(src);
7714 
7715  {
7716  char *t1 = reinterpret_cast<char *>(&tmpBuf.at(0));
7717  char *t2 = reinterpret_cast<char *>(&tmpBuf.at(0)) + (src_size + 1) / 2;
7718  const char *stop = srcPtr + src_size;
7719 
7720  for (;;) {
7721  if (srcPtr < stop)
7722  *(t1++) = *(srcPtr++);
7723  else
7724  break;
7725 
7726  if (srcPtr < stop)
7727  *(t2++) = *(srcPtr++);
7728  else
7729  break;
7730  }
7731  }
7732 
7733  //
7734  // Predictor.
7735  //
7736 
7737  {
7738  unsigned char *t = &tmpBuf.at(0) + 1;
7739  unsigned char *stop = &tmpBuf.at(0) + src_size;
7740  int p = t[-1];
7741 
7742  while (t < stop) {
7743  int d = int(t[0]) - p + (128 + 256);
7744  p = t[0];
7745  t[0] = static_cast<unsigned char>(d);
7746  ++t;
7747  }
7748  }
7749 
7750 #if TINYEXR_USE_MINIZ
7751  //
7752  // Compress the data using miniz
7753  //
7754 
7755  miniz::mz_ulong outSize = miniz::mz_compressBound(src_size);
7756  int ret = miniz::mz_compress(
7757  dst, &outSize, static_cast<const unsigned char *>(&tmpBuf.at(0)),
7758  src_size);
7759  assert(ret == miniz::MZ_OK);
7760  (void)ret;
7761 
7762  compressedSize = outSize;
7763 #else
7764  uLong outSize = compressBound(static_cast<uLong>(src_size));
7765  int ret = compress(dst, &outSize, static_cast<const Bytef *>(&tmpBuf.at(0)),
7766  src_size);
7767  assert(ret == Z_OK);
7768 
7769  compressedSize = outSize;
7770 #endif
7771 
7772  // Use uncompressed data when compressed data is larger than uncompressed.
7773  // (Issue 40)
7774  if (compressedSize >= src_size) {
7775  compressedSize = src_size;
7776  memcpy(dst, src, src_size);
7777  }
7778  }
7779 
7780  static bool DecompressZip(unsigned char *dst,
7781  unsigned long *uncompressed_size /* inout */,
7782  const unsigned char *src, unsigned long src_size) {
7783  if ((*uncompressed_size) == src_size) {
7784  // Data is not compressed(Issue 40).
7785  memcpy(dst, src, src_size);
7786  return true;
7787  }
7788  std::vector<unsigned char> tmpBuf(*uncompressed_size);
7789 
7790 #if TINYEXR_USE_MINIZ
7791  int ret =
7792  miniz::mz_uncompress(&tmpBuf.at(0), uncompressed_size, src, src_size);
7793  if (miniz::MZ_OK != ret) {
7794  return false;
7795  }
7796 #else
7797  int ret = uncompress(&tmpBuf.at(0), uncompressed_size, src, src_size);
7798  if (Z_OK != ret) {
7799  return false;
7800  }
7801 #endif
7802 
7803  //
7804  // Apply EXR-specific? postprocess. Grabbed from OpenEXR's
7805  // ImfZipCompressor.cpp
7806  //
7807 
7808  // Predictor.
7809  {
7810  unsigned char *t = &tmpBuf.at(0) + 1;
7811  unsigned char *stop = &tmpBuf.at(0) + (*uncompressed_size);
7812 
7813  while (t < stop) {
7814  int d = int(t[-1]) + int(t[0]) - 128;
7815  t[0] = static_cast<unsigned char>(d);
7816  ++t;
7817  }
7818  }
7819 
7820  // Reorder the pixel data.
7821  {
7822  const char *t1 = reinterpret_cast<const char *>(&tmpBuf.at(0));
7823  const char *t2 = reinterpret_cast<const char *>(&tmpBuf.at(0)) +
7824  (*uncompressed_size + 1) / 2;
7825  char *s = reinterpret_cast<char *>(dst);
7826  char *stop = s + (*uncompressed_size);
7827 
7828  for (;;) {
7829  if (s < stop)
7830  *(s++) = *(t1++);
7831  else
7832  break;
7833 
7834  if (s < stop)
7835  *(s++) = *(t2++);
7836  else
7837  break;
7838  }
7839  }
7840 
7841  return true;
7842  }
7843 
7844  // RLE code from OpenEXR --------------------------------------
7845 
7846 #ifdef __clang__
7847 #pragma clang diagnostic push
7848 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wsign-conversion"
7849 #if __has_warning("-Wextra-semi-stmt")
7850 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wextra-semi-stmt"
7851 #endif
7852 #endif
7853 
7854 #ifdef _MSC_VER
7855 #pragma warning(push)
7856 #pragma warning(disable : 4204) // nonstandard extension used : non-constant
7857  // aggregate initializer (also supported by GNU
7858  // C and C99, so no big deal)
7859 #pragma warning(disable : 4244) // 'initializing': conversion from '__int64' to
7860  // 'int', possible loss of data
7861 #pragma warning(disable : 4267) // 'argument': conversion from '__int64' to
7862  // 'int', possible loss of data
7863 #pragma warning(disable : 4996) // 'strdup': The POSIX name for this item is
7864  // deprecated. Instead, use the ISO C and C++
7865  // conformant name: _strdup.
7866 #endif
7867 
7868  const int MIN_RUN_LENGTH = 3;
7869  const int MAX_RUN_LENGTH = 127;
7870 
7871  //
7872  // Compress an array of bytes, using run-length encoding,
7873  // and return the length of the compressed data.
7874  //
7875 
7876  static int rleCompress(int inLength, const char in[], signed char out[]) {
7877  const char *inEnd = in + inLength;
7878  const char *runStart = in;
7879  const char *runEnd = in + 1;
7880  signed char *outWrite = out;
7881 
7882  while (runStart < inEnd) {
7883  while (runEnd < inEnd && *runStart == *runEnd &&
7884  runEnd - runStart - 1 < MAX_RUN_LENGTH) {
7885  ++runEnd;
7886  }
7887 
7888  if (runEnd - runStart >= MIN_RUN_LENGTH) {
7889  //
7890  // Compressible run
7891  //
7892 
7893  *outWrite++ = static_cast<char>(runEnd - runStart) - 1;
7894  *outWrite++ = *(reinterpret_cast<const signed char *>(runStart));
7895  runStart = runEnd;
7896  }
7897  else {
7898  //
7899  // Uncompressable run
7900  //
7901 
7902  while (runEnd < inEnd &&
7903  ((runEnd + 1 >= inEnd || *runEnd != *(runEnd + 1)) ||
7904  (runEnd + 2 >= inEnd || *(runEnd + 1) != *(runEnd + 2))) &&
7905  runEnd - runStart < MAX_RUN_LENGTH) {
7906  ++runEnd;
7907  }
7908 
7909  *outWrite++ = static_cast<char>(runStart - runEnd);
7910 
7911  while (runStart < runEnd) {
7912  *outWrite++ = *(reinterpret_cast<const signed char *>(runStart++));
7913  }
7914  }
7915 
7916  ++runEnd;
7917  }
7918 
7919  return static_cast<int>(outWrite - out);
7920  }
7921 
7922  //
7923  // Uncompress an array of bytes compressed with rleCompress().
7924  // Returns the length of the oncompressed data, or 0 if the
7925  // length of the uncompressed data would be more than maxLength.
7926  //
7927 
7928  static int rleUncompress(int inLength, int maxLength, const signed char in[],
7929  char out[]) {
7930  char *outStart = out;
7931 
7932  while (inLength > 0) {
7933  if (*in < 0) {
7934  int count = -(static_cast<int>(*in++));
7935  inLength -= count + 1;
7936 
7937  // Fixes #116: Add bounds check to in buffer.
7938  if ((0 > (maxLength -= count)) || (inLength < 0)) return 0;
7939 
7940  memcpy(out, in, count);
7941  out += count;
7942  in += count;
7943  }
7944  else {
7945  int count = *in++;
7946  inLength -= 2;
7947 
7948  if (0 > (maxLength -= count + 1)) return 0;
7949 
7950  memset(out, *reinterpret_cast<const char *>(in), count + 1);
7951  out += count + 1;
7952 
7953  in++;
7954  }
7955  }
7956 
7957  return static_cast<int>(out - outStart);
7958  }
7959 
7960 #ifdef __clang__
7961 #pragma clang diagnostic pop
7962 #endif
7963 
7964  // End of RLE code from OpenEXR -----------------------------------
7965 
7966  static void CompressRle(unsigned char *dst,
7967  tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 &compressedSize,
7968  const unsigned char *src, unsigned long src_size) {
7969  std::vector<unsigned char> tmpBuf(src_size);
7970 
7971  //
7972  // Apply EXR-specific? postprocess. Grabbed from OpenEXR's
7973  // ImfRleCompressor.cpp
7974  //
7975 
7976  //
7977  // Reorder the pixel data.
7978  //
7979 
7980  const char *srcPtr = reinterpret_cast<const char *>(src);
7981 
7982  {
7983  char *t1 = reinterpret_cast<char *>(&tmpBuf.at(0));
7984  char *t2 = reinterpret_cast<char *>(&tmpBuf.at(0)) + (src_size + 1) / 2;
7985  const char *stop = srcPtr + src_size;
7986 
7987  for (;;) {
7988  if (srcPtr < stop)
7989  *(t1++) = *(srcPtr++);
7990  else
7991  break;
7992 
7993  if (srcPtr < stop)
7994  *(t2++) = *(srcPtr++);
7995  else
7996  break;
7997  }
7998  }
7999 
8000  //
8001  // Predictor.
8002  //
8003 
8004  {
8005  unsigned char *t = &tmpBuf.at(0) + 1;
8006  unsigned char *stop = &tmpBuf.at(0) + src_size;
8007  int p = t[-1];
8008 
8009  while (t < stop) {
8010  int d = int(t[0]) - p + (128 + 256);
8011  p = t[0];
8012  t[0] = static_cast<unsigned char>(d);
8013  ++t;
8014  }
8015  }
8016 
8017  // outSize will be (srcSiz * 3) / 2 at max.
8018  int outSize = rleCompress(static_cast<int>(src_size),
8019  reinterpret_cast<const char *>(&tmpBuf.at(0)),
8020  reinterpret_cast<signed char *>(dst));
8021  assert(outSize > 0);
8022 
8023  compressedSize = static_cast<tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64>(outSize);
8024 
8025  // Use uncompressed data when compressed data is larger than uncompressed.
8026  // (Issue 40)
8027  if (compressedSize >= src_size) {
8028  compressedSize = src_size;
8029  memcpy(dst, src, src_size);
8030  }
8031  }
8032 
8033  static bool DecompressRle(unsigned char *dst,
8034  const unsigned long uncompressed_size,
8035  const unsigned char *src, unsigned long src_size) {
8036  if (uncompressed_size == src_size) {
8037  // Data is not compressed(Issue 40).
8038  memcpy(dst, src, src_size);
8039  return true;
8040  }
8041 
8042  // Workaround for issue #112.
8043  // TODO(syoyo): Add more robust out-of-bounds check in `rleUncompress`.
8044  if (src_size <= 2) {
8045  return false;
8046  }
8047 
8048  std::vector<unsigned char> tmpBuf(uncompressed_size);
8049 
8050  int ret = rleUncompress(static_cast<int>(src_size),
8051  static_cast<int>(uncompressed_size),
8052  reinterpret_cast<const signed char *>(src),
8053  reinterpret_cast<char *>(&tmpBuf.at(0)));
8054  if (ret != static_cast<int>(uncompressed_size)) {
8055  return false;
8056  }
8057 
8058  //
8059  // Apply EXR-specific? postprocess. Grabbed from OpenEXR's
8060  // ImfRleCompressor.cpp
8061  //
8062 
8063  // Predictor.
8064  {
8065  unsigned char *t = &tmpBuf.at(0) + 1;
8066  unsigned char *stop = &tmpBuf.at(0) + uncompressed_size;
8067 
8068  while (t < stop) {
8069  int d = int(t[-1]) + int(t[0]) - 128;
8070  t[0] = static_cast<unsigned char>(d);
8071  ++t;
8072  }
8073  }
8074 
8075  // Reorder the pixel data.
8076  {
8077  const char *t1 = reinterpret_cast<const char *>(&tmpBuf.at(0));
8078  const char *t2 = reinterpret_cast<const char *>(&tmpBuf.at(0)) +
8079  (uncompressed_size + 1) / 2;
8080  char *s = reinterpret_cast<char *>(dst);
8081  char *stop = s + uncompressed_size;
8082 
8083  for (;;) {
8084  if (s < stop)
8085  *(s++) = *(t1++);
8086  else
8087  break;
8088 
8089  if (s < stop)
8090  *(s++) = *(t2++);
8091  else
8092  break;
8093  }
8094  }
8095 
8096  return true;
8097  }
8098 
8099 #if TINYEXR_USE_PIZ
8100 
8101 #ifdef __clang__
8102 #pragma clang diagnostic push
8103 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wc++11-long-long"
8104 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wold-style-cast"
8105 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wpadded"
8106 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wsign-conversion"
8107 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wc++11-extensions"
8108 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wconversion"
8109 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wc++98-compat-pedantic"
8110 
8111 #if __has_warning("-Wcast-qual")
8112 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wcast-qual"
8113 #endif
8114 
8115 #if __has_warning("-Wextra-semi-stmt")
8116 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wextra-semi-stmt"
8117 #endif
8118 
8119 #endif
8120 
8121  //
8122  // PIZ compress/uncompress, based on OpenEXR's ImfPizCompressor.cpp
8123  //
8124  // -----------------------------------------------------------------
8125  // Copyright (c) 2004, Industrial Light & Magic, a division of Lucas
8126  // Digital Ltd. LLC)
8127  // (3 clause BSD license)
8128  //
8129 
8130  struct PIZChannelData {
8131  unsigned short *start;
8132  unsigned short *end;
8133  int nx;
8134  int ny;
8135  int ys;
8136  int size;
8137  };
8138 
8139  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8140  //
8141  // 16-bit Haar Wavelet encoding and decoding
8142  //
8143  // The source code in this file is derived from the encoding
8144  // and decoding routines written by Christian Rouet for his
8145  // PIZ image file format.
8146  //
8147  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8148 
8149  //
8150  // Wavelet basis functions without modulo arithmetic; they produce
8151  // the best compression ratios when the wavelet-transformed data are
8152  // Huffman-encoded, but the wavelet transform works only for 14-bit
8153  // data (untransformed data values must be less than (1 << 14)).
8154  //
8155 
8156  inline void wenc14(unsigned short a, unsigned short b, unsigned short &l,
8157  unsigned short &h) {
8158  short as = static_cast<short>(a);
8159  short bs = static_cast<short>(b);
8160 
8161  short ms = (as + bs) >> 1;
8162  short ds = as - bs;
8163 
8164  l = static_cast<unsigned short>(ms);
8165  h = static_cast<unsigned short>(ds);
8166  }
8167 
8168  inline void wdec14(unsigned short l, unsigned short h, unsigned short &a,
8169  unsigned short &b) {
8170  short ls = static_cast<short>(l);
8171  short hs = static_cast<short>(h);
8172 
8173  int hi = hs;
8174  int ai = ls + (hi & 1) + (hi >> 1);
8175 
8176  short as = static_cast<short>(ai);
8177  short bs = static_cast<short>(ai - hi);
8178 
8179  a = static_cast<unsigned short>(as);
8180  b = static_cast<unsigned short>(bs);
8181  }
8182 
8183  //
8184  // Wavelet basis functions with modulo arithmetic; they work with full
8185  // 16-bit data, but Huffman-encoding the wavelet-transformed data doesn't
8186  // compress the data quite as well.
8187  //
8188 
8189  const int NBITS = 16;
8190  const int A_OFFSET = 1 << (NBITS - 1);
8191  const int M_OFFSET = 1 << (NBITS - 1);
8192  const int MOD_MASK = (1 << NBITS) - 1;
8193 
8194  inline void wenc16(unsigned short a, unsigned short b, unsigned short &l,
8195  unsigned short &h) {
8196  int ao = (a + A_OFFSET) & MOD_MASK;
8197  int m = ((ao + b) >> 1);
8198  int d = ao - b;
8199 
8200  if (d < 0) m = (m + M_OFFSET) & MOD_MASK;
8201 
8202  d &= MOD_MASK;
8203 
8204  l = static_cast<unsigned short>(m);
8205  h = static_cast<unsigned short>(d);
8206  }
8207 
8208  inline void wdec16(unsigned short l, unsigned short h, unsigned short &a,
8209  unsigned short &b) {
8210  int m = l;
8211  int d = h;
8212  int bb = (m - (d >> 1)) & MOD_MASK;
8213  int aa = (d + bb - A_OFFSET) & MOD_MASK;
8214  b = static_cast<unsigned short>(bb);
8215  a = static_cast<unsigned short>(aa);
8216  }
8217 
8218  //
8219  // 2D Wavelet encoding:
8220  //
8221 
8222  static void wav2Encode(
8223  unsigned short *in, // io: values are transformed in place
8224  int nx, // i : x size
8225  int ox, // i : x offset
8226  int ny, // i : y size
8227  int oy, // i : y offset
8228  unsigned short mx) // i : maximum in[x][y] value
8229  {
8230  bool w14 = (mx < (1 << 14));
8231  int n = (nx > ny) ? ny : nx;
8232  int p = 1; // == 1 << level
8233  int p2 = 2; // == 1 << (level+1)
8234 
8235  //
8236  // Hierarchical loop on smaller dimension n
8237  //
8238 
8239  while (p2 <= n) {
8240  unsigned short *py = in;
8241  unsigned short *ey = in + oy * (ny - p2);
8242  int oy1 = oy * p;
8243  int oy2 = oy * p2;
8244  int ox1 = ox * p;
8245  int ox2 = ox * p2;
8246  unsigned short i00, i01, i10, i11;
8247 
8248  //
8249  // Y loop
8250  //
8251 
8252  for (; py <= ey; py += oy2) {
8253  unsigned short *px = py;
8254  unsigned short *ex = py + ox * (nx - p2);
8255 
8256  //
8257  // X loop
8258  //
8259 
8260  for (; px <= ex; px += ox2) {
8261  unsigned short *p01 = px + ox1;
8262  unsigned short *p10 = px + oy1;
8263  unsigned short *p11 = p10 + ox1;
8264 
8265  //
8266  // 2D wavelet encoding
8267  //
8268 
8269  if (w14) {
8270  wenc14(*px, *p01, i00, i01);
8271  wenc14(*p10, *p11, i10, i11);
8272  wenc14(i00, i10, *px, *p10);
8273  wenc14(i01, i11, *p01, *p11);
8274  }
8275  else {
8276  wenc16(*px, *p01, i00, i01);
8277  wenc16(*p10, *p11, i10, i11);
8278  wenc16(i00, i10, *px, *p10);
8279  wenc16(i01, i11, *p01, *p11);
8280  }
8281  }
8282 
8283  //
8284  // Encode (1D) odd column (still in Y loop)
8285  //
8286 
8287  if (nx & p) {
8288  unsigned short *p10 = px + oy1;
8289 
8290  if (w14)
8291  wenc14(*px, *p10, i00, *p10);
8292  else
8293  wenc16(*px, *p10, i00, *p10);
8294 
8295  *px = i00;
8296  }
8297  }
8298 
8299  //
8300  // Encode (1D) odd line (must loop in X)
8301  //
8302 
8303  if (ny & p) {
8304  unsigned short *px = py;
8305  unsigned short *ex = py + ox * (nx - p2);
8306 
8307  for (; px <= ex; px += ox2) {
8308  unsigned short *p01 = px + ox1;
8309 
8310  if (w14)
8311  wenc14(*px, *p01, i00, *p01);
8312  else
8313  wenc16(*px, *p01, i00, *p01);
8314 
8315  *px = i00;
8316  }
8317  }
8318 
8319  //
8320  // Next level
8321  //
8322 
8323  p = p2;
8324  p2 <<= 1;
8325  }
8326  }
8327 
8328  //
8329  // 2D Wavelet decoding:
8330  //
8331 
8332  static void wav2Decode(
8333  unsigned short *in, // io: values are transformed in place
8334  int nx, // i : x size
8335  int ox, // i : x offset
8336  int ny, // i : y size
8337  int oy, // i : y offset
8338  unsigned short mx) // i : maximum in[x][y] value
8339  {
8340  bool w14 = (mx < (1 << 14));
8341  int n = (nx > ny) ? ny : nx;
8342  int p = 1;
8343  int p2;
8344 
8345  //
8346  // Search max level
8347  //
8348 
8349  while (p <= n) p <<= 1;
8350 
8351  p >>= 1;
8352  p2 = p;
8353  p >>= 1;
8354 
8355  //
8356  // Hierarchical loop on smaller dimension n
8357  //
8358 
8359  while (p >= 1) {
8360  unsigned short *py = in;
8361  unsigned short *ey = in + oy * (ny - p2);
8362  int oy1 = oy * p;
8363  int oy2 = oy * p2;
8364  int ox1 = ox * p;
8365  int ox2 = ox * p2;
8366  unsigned short i00, i01, i10, i11;
8367 
8368  //
8369  // Y loop
8370  //
8371 
8372  for (; py <= ey; py += oy2) {
8373  unsigned short *px = py;
8374  unsigned short *ex = py + ox * (nx - p2);
8375 
8376  //
8377  // X loop
8378  //
8379 
8380  for (; px <= ex; px += ox2) {
8381  unsigned short *p01 = px + ox1;
8382  unsigned short *p10 = px + oy1;
8383  unsigned short *p11 = p10 + ox1;
8384 
8385  //
8386  // 2D wavelet decoding
8387  //
8388 
8389  if (w14) {
8390  wdec14(*px, *p10, i00, i10);
8391  wdec14(*p01, *p11, i01, i11);
8392  wdec14(i00, i01, *px, *p01);
8393  wdec14(i10, i11, *p10, *p11);
8394  }
8395  else {
8396  wdec16(*px, *p10, i00, i10);
8397  wdec16(*p01, *p11, i01, i11);
8398  wdec16(i00, i01, *px, *p01);
8399  wdec16(i10, i11, *p10, *p11);
8400  }
8401  }
8402 
8403  //
8404  // Decode (1D) odd column (still in Y loop)
8405  //
8406 
8407  if (nx & p) {
8408  unsigned short *p10 = px + oy1;
8409 
8410  if (w14)
8411  wdec14(*px, *p10, i00, *p10);
8412  else
8413  wdec16(*px, *p10, i00, *p10);
8414 
8415  *px = i00;
8416  }
8417  }
8418 
8419  //
8420  // Decode (1D) odd line (must loop in X)
8421  //
8422 
8423  if (ny & p) {
8424  unsigned short *px = py;
8425  unsigned short *ex = py + ox * (nx - p2);
8426 
8427  for (; px <= ex; px += ox2) {
8428  unsigned short *p01 = px + ox1;
8429 
8430  if (w14)
8431  wdec14(*px, *p01, i00, *p01);
8432  else
8433  wdec16(*px, *p01, i00, *p01);
8434 
8435  *px = i00;
8436  }
8437  }
8438 
8439  //
8440  // Next level
8441  //
8442 
8443  p2 = p;
8444  p >>= 1;
8445  }
8446  }
8447 
8448  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8449  //
8450  // 16-bit Huffman compression and decompression.
8451  //
8452  // The source code in this file is derived from the 8-bit
8453  // Huffman compression and decompression routines written
8454  // by Christian Rouet for his PIZ image file format.
8455  //
8456  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8457 
8458  // Adds some modification for tinyexr.
8459 
8460  const int HUF_ENCBITS = 16; // literal (value) bit length
8461  const int HUF_DECBITS = 14; // decoding bit size (>= 8)
8462 
8463  const int HUF_ENCSIZE = (1 << HUF_ENCBITS) + 1; // encoding table size
8464  const int HUF_DECSIZE = 1 << HUF_DECBITS; // decoding table size
8465  const int HUF_DECMASK = HUF_DECSIZE - 1;
8466 
8467  struct HufDec { // short code long code
8468  //-------------------------------
8469  unsigned int len : 8; // code length 0
8470  unsigned int lit : 24; // lit p size
8471  unsigned int *p; // 0 lits
8472  };
8473 
8474  inline long long hufLength(long long code) { return code & 63; }
8475 
8476  inline long long hufCode(long long code) { return code >> 6; }
8477 
8478  inline void outputBits(int nBits, long long bits, long long &c, int &lc,
8479  char *&out) {
8480  c <<= nBits;
8481  lc += nBits;
8482 
8483  c |= bits;
8484 
8485  while (lc >= 8) *out++ = static_cast<char>((c >> (lc -= 8)));
8486  }
8487 
8488  inline long long getBits(int nBits, long long &c, int &lc, const char *&in) {
8489  while (lc < nBits) {
8490  c = (c << 8) | *(reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(in++));
8491  lc += 8;
8492  }
8493 
8494  lc -= nBits;
8495  return (c >> lc) & ((1 << nBits) - 1);
8496  }
8497 
8498  //
8499  // ENCODING TABLE BUILDING & (UN)PACKING
8500  //
8501 
8502  //
8503  // Build a "canonical" Huffman code table:
8504  // - for each (uncompressed) symbol, hcode contains the length
8505  // of the corresponding code (in the compressed data)
8506  // - canonical codes are computed and stored in hcode
8507  // - the rules for constructing canonical codes are as follows:
8508  // * shorter codes (if filled with zeroes to the right)
8509  // have a numerically higher value than longer codes
8510  // * for codes with the same length, numerical values
8511  // increase with numerical symbol values
8512  // - because the canonical code table can be constructed from
8513  // symbol lengths alone, the code table can be transmitted
8514  // without sending the actual code values
8515  // - see http://www.compressconsult.com/huffman/
8516  //
8517 
8518  static void hufCanonicalCodeTable(long long hcode[HUF_ENCSIZE]) {
8519  long long n[59];
8520 
8521  //
8522  // For each i from 0 through 58, count the
8523  // number of different codes of length i, and
8524  // store the count in n[i].
8525  //
8526 
8527  for (int i = 0; i <= 58; ++i) n[i] = 0;
8528 
8529  for (int i = 0; i < HUF_ENCSIZE; ++i) n[hcode[i]] += 1;
8530 
8531  //
8532  // For each i from 58 through 1, compute the
8533  // numerically lowest code with length i, and
8534  // store that code in n[i].
8535  //
8536 
8537  long long c = 0;
8538 
8539  for (int i = 58; i > 0; --i) {
8540  long long nc = ((c + n[i]) >> 1);
8541  n[i] = c;
8542  c = nc;
8543  }
8544 
8545  //
8546  // hcode[i] contains the length, l, of the
8547  // code for symbol i. Assign the next available
8548  // code of length l to the symbol and store both
8549  // l and the code in hcode[i].
8550  //
8551 
8552  for (int i = 0; i < HUF_ENCSIZE; ++i) {
8553  int l = static_cast<int>(hcode[i]);
8554 
8555  if (l > 0) hcode[i] = l | (n[l]++ << 6);
8556  }
8557  }
8558 
8559  //
8560  // Compute Huffman codes (based on frq input) and store them in frq:
8561  // - code structure is : [63:lsb - 6:msb] | [5-0: bit length];
8562  // - max code length is 58 bits;
8563  // - codes outside the range [im-iM] have a null length (unused values);
8564  // - original frequencies are destroyed;
8565  // - encoding tables are used by hufEncode() and hufBuildDecTable();
8566  //
8567 
8568  struct FHeapCompare {
8569  bool operator()(long long *a, long long *b) { return *a > *b; }
8570  };
8571 
8572  static void hufBuildEncTable(
8573  long long *frq, // io: input frequencies [HUF_ENCSIZE], output table
8574  int *im, // o: min frq index
8575  int *iM) // o: max frq index
8576  {
8577  //
8578  // This function assumes that when it is called, array frq
8579  // indicates the frequency of all possible symbols in the data
8580  // that are to be Huffman-encoded. (frq[i] contains the number
8581  // of occurrences of symbol i in the data.)
8582  //
8583  // The loop below does three things:
8584  //
8585  // 1) Finds the minimum and maximum indices that point
8586  // to non-zero entries in frq:
8587  //
8588  // frq[im] != 0, and frq[i] == 0 for all i < im
8589  // frq[iM] != 0, and frq[i] == 0 for all i > iM
8590  //
8591  // 2) Fills array fHeap with pointers to all non-zero
8592  // entries in frq.
8593  //
8594  // 3) Initializes array hlink such that hlink[i] == i
8595  // for all array entries.
8596  //
8597 
8598  std::vector<int> hlink(HUF_ENCSIZE);
8599  std::vector<long long *> fHeap(HUF_ENCSIZE);
8600 
8601  *im = 0;
8602 
8603  while (!frq[*im]) (*im)++;
8604 
8605  int nf = 0;
8606 
8607  for (int i = *im; i < HUF_ENCSIZE; i++) {
8608  hlink[i] = i;
8609 
8610  if (frq[i]) {
8611  fHeap[nf] = &frq[i];
8612  nf++;
8613  *iM = i;
8614  }
8615  }
8616 
8617  //
8618  // Add a pseudo-symbol, with a frequency count of 1, to frq;
8619  // adjust the fHeap and hlink array accordingly. Function
8620  // hufEncode() uses the pseudo-symbol for run-length encoding.
8621  //
8622 
8623  (*iM)++;
8624  frq[*iM] = 1;
8625  fHeap[nf] = &frq[*iM];
8626  nf++;
8627 
8628  //
8629  // Build an array, scode, such that scode[i] contains the number
8630  // of bits assigned to symbol i. Conceptually this is done by
8631  // constructing a tree whose leaves are the symbols with non-zero
8632  // frequency:
8633  //
8634  // Make a heap that contains all symbols with a non-zero frequency,
8635  // with the least frequent symbol on top.
8636  //
8637  // Repeat until only one symbol is left on the heap:
8638  //
8639  // Take the two least frequent symbols off the top of the heap.
8640  // Create a new node that has first two nodes as children, and
8641  // whose frequency is the sum of the frequencies of the first
8642  // two nodes. Put the new node back into the heap.
8643  //
8644  // The last node left on the heap is the root of the tree. For each
8645  // leaf node, the distance between the root and the leaf is the length
8646  // of the code for the corresponding symbol.
8647  //
8648  // The loop below doesn't actually build the tree; instead we compute
8649  // the distances of the leaves from the root on the fly. When a new
8650  // node is added to the heap, then that node's descendants are linked
8651  // into a single linear list that starts at the new node, and the code
8652  // lengths of the descendants (that is, their distance from the root
8653  // of the tree) are incremented by one.
8654  //
8655 
8656  std::make_heap(&fHeap[0], &fHeap[nf], FHeapCompare());
8657 
8658  std::vector<long long> scode(HUF_ENCSIZE);
8659  memset(scode.data(), 0, sizeof(long long) * HUF_ENCSIZE);
8660 
8661  while (nf > 1) {
8662  //
8663  // Find the indices, mm and m, of the two smallest non-zero frq
8664  // values in fHeap, add the smallest frq to the second-smallest
8665  // frq, and remove the smallest frq value from fHeap.
8666  //
8667 
8668  int mm = fHeap[0] - frq;
8669  std::pop_heap(&fHeap[0], &fHeap[nf], FHeapCompare());
8670  --nf;
8671 
8672  int m = fHeap[0] - frq;
8673  std::pop_heap(&fHeap[0], &fHeap[nf], FHeapCompare());
8674 
8675  frq[m] += frq[mm];
8676  std::push_heap(&fHeap[0], &fHeap[nf], FHeapCompare());
8677 
8678  //
8679  // The entries in scode are linked into lists with the
8680  // entries in hlink serving as "next" pointers and with
8681  // the end of a list marked by hlink[j] == j.
8682  //
8683  // Traverse the lists that start at scode[m] and scode[mm].
8684  // For each element visited, increment the length of the
8685  // corresponding code by one bit. (If we visit scode[j]
8686  // during the traversal, then the code for symbol j becomes
8687  // one bit longer.)
8688  //
8689  // Merge the lists that start at scode[m] and scode[mm]
8690  // into a single list that starts at scode[m].
8691  //
8692 
8693  //
8694  // Add a bit to all codes in the first list.
8695  //
8696 
8697  for (int j = m;; j = hlink[j]) {
8698  scode[j]++;
8699 
8700  assert(scode[j] <= 58);
8701 
8702  if (hlink[j] == j) {
8703  //
8704  // Merge the two lists.
8705  //
8706 
8707  hlink[j] = mm;
8708  break;
8709  }
8710  }
8711 
8712  //
8713  // Add a bit to all codes in the second list
8714  //
8715 
8716  for (int j = mm;; j = hlink[j]) {
8717  scode[j]++;
8718 
8719  assert(scode[j] <= 58);
8720 
8721  if (hlink[j] == j) break;
8722  }
8723  }
8724 
8725  //
8726  // Build a canonical Huffman code table, replacing the code
8727  // lengths in scode with (code, code length) pairs. Copy the
8728  // code table from scode into frq.
8729  //
8730 
8731  hufCanonicalCodeTable(scode.data());
8732  memcpy(frq, scode.data(), sizeof(long long) * HUF_ENCSIZE);
8733  }
8734 
8735  //
8736  // Pack an encoding table:
8737  // - only code lengths, not actual codes, are stored
8738  // - runs of zeroes are compressed as follows:
8739  //
8740  // unpacked packed
8741  // --------------------------------
8742  // 1 zero 0 (6 bits)
8743  // 2 zeroes 59
8744  // 3 zeroes 60
8745  // 4 zeroes 61
8746  // 5 zeroes 62
8747  // n zeroes (6 or more) 63 n-6 (6 + 8 bits)
8748  //
8749 
8750  const int SHORT_ZEROCODE_RUN = 59;
8751  const int LONG_ZEROCODE_RUN = 63;
8752  const int SHORTEST_LONG_RUN = 2 + LONG_ZEROCODE_RUN - SHORT_ZEROCODE_RUN;
8753  const int LONGEST_LONG_RUN = 255 + SHORTEST_LONG_RUN;
8754 
8755  static void hufPackEncTable(
8756  const long long *hcode, // i : encoding table [HUF_ENCSIZE]
8757  int im, // i : min hcode index
8758  int iM, // i : max hcode index
8759  char **pcode) // o: ptr to packed table (updated)
8760  {
8761  char *p = *pcode;
8762  long long c = 0;
8763  int lc = 0;
8764 
8765  for (; im <= iM; im++) {
8766  int l = hufLength(hcode[im]);
8767 
8768  if (l == 0) {
8769  int zerun = 1;
8770 
8771  while ((im < iM) && (zerun < LONGEST_LONG_RUN)) {
8772  if (hufLength(hcode[im + 1]) > 0) break;
8773  im++;
8774  zerun++;
8775  }
8776 
8777  if (zerun >= 2) {
8778  if (zerun >= SHORTEST_LONG_RUN) {
8779  outputBits(6, LONG_ZEROCODE_RUN, c, lc, p);
8780  outputBits(8, zerun - SHORTEST_LONG_RUN, c, lc, p);
8781  }
8782  else {
8783  outputBits(6, SHORT_ZEROCODE_RUN + zerun - 2, c, lc, p);
8784  }
8785  continue;
8786  }
8787  }
8788 
8789  outputBits(6, l, c, lc, p);
8790  }
8791 
8792  if (lc > 0) *p++ = (unsigned char)(c << (8 - lc));
8793 
8794  *pcode = p;
8795  }
8796 
8797  //
8798  // Unpack an encoding table packed by hufPackEncTable():
8799  //
8800 
8801  static bool hufUnpackEncTable(
8802  const char **pcode, // io: ptr to packed table (updated)
8803  int ni, // i : input size (in bytes)
8804  int im, // i : min hcode index
8805  int iM, // i : max hcode index
8806  long long *hcode) // o: encoding table [HUF_ENCSIZE]
8807  {
8808  memset(hcode, 0, sizeof(long long) * HUF_ENCSIZE);
8809 
8810  const char *p = *pcode;
8811  long long c = 0;
8812  int lc = 0;
8813 
8814  for (; im <= iM; im++) {
8815  if (p - *pcode >= ni) {
8816  return false;
8817  }
8818 
8819  long long l = hcode[im] = getBits(6, c, lc, p); // code length
8820 
8821  if (l == (long long)LONG_ZEROCODE_RUN) {
8822  if (p - *pcode > ni) {
8823  return false;
8824  }
8825 
8826  int zerun = getBits(8, c, lc, p) + SHORTEST_LONG_RUN;
8827 
8828  if (im + zerun > iM + 1) {
8829  return false;
8830  }
8831 
8832  while (zerun--) hcode[im++] = 0;
8833 
8834  im--;
8835  }
8836  else if (l >= (long long)SHORT_ZEROCODE_RUN) {
8837  int zerun = l - SHORT_ZEROCODE_RUN + 2;
8838 
8839  if (im + zerun > iM + 1) {
8840  return false;
8841  }
8842 
8843  while (zerun--) hcode[im++] = 0;
8844 
8845  im--;
8846  }
8847  }
8848 
8849  *pcode = const_cast<char *>(p);
8850 
8851  hufCanonicalCodeTable(hcode);
8852 
8853  return true;
8854  }
8855 
8856  //
8857  // DECODING TABLE BUILDING
8858  //
8859 
8860  //
8861  // Clear a newly allocated decoding table so that it contains only zeroes.
8862  //
8863 
8864  static void hufClearDecTable(HufDec *hdecod) // io: (allocated by caller)
8865  // decoding table [HUF_DECSIZE]
8866  {
8867  for (int i = 0; i < HUF_DECSIZE; i++) {
8868  hdecod[i].len = 0;
8869  hdecod[i].lit = 0;
8870  hdecod[i].p = NULL;
8871  }
8872  // memset(hdecod, 0, sizeof(HufDec) * HUF_DECSIZE);
8873  }
8874 
8875  //
8876  // Build a decoding hash table based on the encoding table hcode:
8877  // - short codes (<= HUF_DECBITS) are resolved with a single table access;
8878  // - long code entry allocations are not optimized, because long codes are
8879  // unfrequent;
8880  // - decoding tables are used by hufDecode();
8881  //
8882 
8883  static bool hufBuildDecTable(const long long *hcode, // i : encoding table
8884  int im, // i : min index in hcode
8885  int iM, // i : max index in hcode
8886  HufDec *hdecod) // o: (allocated by caller)
8887 // decoding table [HUF_DECSIZE]
8888  {
8889  //
8890  // Init hashtable & loop on all codes.
8891  // Assumes that hufClearDecTable(hdecod) has already been called.
8892  //
8893 
8894  for (; im <= iM; im++) {
8895  long long c = hufCode(hcode[im]);
8896  int l = hufLength(hcode[im]);
8897 
8898  if (c >> l) {
8899  //
8900  // Error: c is supposed to be an l-bit code,
8901  // but c contains a value that is greater
8902  // than the largest l-bit number.
8903  //
8904 
8905  // invalidTableEntry();
8906  return false;
8907  }
8908 
8909  if (l > HUF_DECBITS) {
8910  //
8911  // Long code: add a secondary entry
8912  //
8913 
8914  HufDec *pl = hdecod + (c >> (l - HUF_DECBITS));
8915 
8916  if (pl->len) {
8917  //
8918  // Error: a short code has already
8919  // been stored in table entry *pl.
8920  //
8921 
8922  // invalidTableEntry();
8923  return false;
8924  }
8925 
8926  pl->lit++;
8927 
8928  if (pl->p) {
8929  unsigned int *p = pl->p;
8930  pl->p = new unsigned int[pl->lit];
8931 
8932  for (int i = 0; i < int(pl->lit) - 1; ++i) pl->p[i] = p[i];
8933 
8934  delete[] p;
8935  }
8936  else {
8937  pl->p = new unsigned int[1];
8938  }
8939 
8940  pl->p[pl->lit - 1] = im;
8941  }
8942  else if (l) {
8943  //
8944  // Short code: init all primary entries
8945  //
8946 
8947  HufDec *pl = hdecod + (c << (HUF_DECBITS - l));
8948 
8949  for (long long i = 1ULL << (HUF_DECBITS - l); i > 0; i--, pl++) {
8950  if (pl->len || pl->p) {
8951  //
8952  // Error: a short code or a long code has
8953  // already been stored in table entry *pl.
8954  //
8955 
8956  // invalidTableEntry();
8957  return false;
8958  }
8959 
8960  pl->len = l;
8961  pl->lit = im;
8962  }
8963  }
8964  }
8965 
8966  return true;
8967  }
8968 
8969  //
8970  // Free the long code entries of a decoding table built by hufBuildDecTable()
8971  //
8972 
8973  static void hufFreeDecTable(HufDec *hdecod) // io: Decoding table
8974  {
8975  for (int i = 0; i < HUF_DECSIZE; i++) {
8976  if (hdecod[i].p) {
8977  delete[] hdecod[i].p;
8978  hdecod[i].p = 0;
8979  }
8980  }
8981  }
8982 
8983  //
8984  // ENCODING
8985  //
8986 
8987  inline void outputCode(long long code, long long &c, int &lc, char *&out) {
8988  outputBits(hufLength(code), hufCode(code), c, lc, out);
8989  }
8990 
8991  inline void sendCode(long long sCode, int runCount, long long runCode,
8992  long long &c, int &lc, char *&out) {
8993  //
8994  // Output a run of runCount instances of the symbol sCount.
8995  // Output the symbols explicitly, or if that is shorter, output
8996  // the sCode symbol once followed by a runCode symbol and runCount
8997  // expressed as an 8-bit number.
8998  //
8999 
9000  if (hufLength(sCode) + hufLength(runCode) + 8 < hufLength(sCode) * runCount) {
9001  outputCode(sCode, c, lc, out);
9002  outputCode(runCode, c, lc, out);
9003  outputBits(8, runCount, c, lc, out);
9004  }
9005  else {
9006  while (runCount-- >= 0) outputCode(sCode, c, lc, out);
9007  }
9008  }
9009 
9010  //
9011  // Encode (compress) ni values based on the Huffman encoding table hcode:
9012  //
9013 
9014  static int hufEncode // return: output size (in bits)
9015  (const long long *hcode, // i : encoding table
9016  const unsigned short *in, // i : uncompressed input buffer
9017  const int ni, // i : input buffer size (in bytes)
9018  int rlc, // i : rl code
9019  char *out) // o: compressed output buffer
9020  {
9021  char *outStart = out;
9022  long long c = 0; // bits not yet written to out
9023  int lc = 0; // number of valid bits in c (LSB)
9024  int s = in[0];
9025  int cs = 0;
9026 
9027  //
9028  // Loop on input values
9029  //
9030 
9031  for (int i = 1; i < ni; i++) {
9032  //
9033  // Count same values or send code
9034  //
9035 
9036  if (s == in[i] && cs < 255) {
9037  cs++;
9038  }
9039  else {
9040  sendCode(hcode[s], cs, hcode[rlc], c, lc, out);
9041  cs = 0;
9042  }
9043 
9044  s = in[i];
9045  }
9046 
9047  //
9048  // Send remaining code
9049  //
9050 
9051  sendCode(hcode[s], cs, hcode[rlc], c, lc, out);
9052 
9053  if (lc) *out = (c << (8 - lc)) & 0xff;
9054 
9055  return (out - outStart) * 8 + lc;
9056  }
9057 
9058  //
9059  // DECODING
9060  //
9061 
9062  //
9063  // In order to force the compiler to inline them,
9064  // getChar() and getCode() are implemented as macros
9065  // instead of "inline" functions.
9066  //
9067 
9068 #define getChar(c, lc, in) \
9069  { \
9070  c = (c << 8) | *(unsigned char *)(in++); \
9071  lc += 8; \
9072  }
9073 
9074 #if 0
9075 #define getCode(po, rlc, c, lc, in, out, ob, oe) \
9076  { \
9077  if (po == rlc) { \
9078  if (lc < 8) getChar(c, lc, in); \
9079  \
9080  lc -= 8; \
9081  \
9082  unsigned char cs = (c >> lc); \
9083  \
9084  if (out + cs > oe) return false; \
9085  \
9086  /* TinyEXR issue 78 */ \
9087  unsigned short s = out[-1]; \
9088  \
9089  while (cs-- > 0) *out++ = s; \
9090  } else if (out < oe) { \
9091  *out++ = po; \
9092  } else { \
9093  return false; \
9094  } \
9095  }
9096 #else
9097  static bool getCode(int po, int rlc, long long &c, int &lc, const char *&in,
