9098  const char *in_end, unsigned short *&out,
9099  const unsigned short *ob, const unsigned short *oe) {
9100  (void)ob;
9101  if (po == rlc) {
9102  if (lc < 8) {
9103  /* TinyEXR issue 78 */
9104  if ((in + 1) >= in_end) {
9105  return false;
9106  }
9107 
9108  getChar(c, lc, in);
9109  }
9110 
9111  lc -= 8;
9112 
9113  unsigned char cs = (c >> lc);
9114 
9115  if (out + cs > oe) return false;
9116 
9117  // Bounds check for safety
9118  // Issue 100.
9119  if ((out - 1) < ob) return false;
9120  unsigned short s = out[-1];
9121 
9122  while (cs-- > 0) *out++ = s;
9123  }
9124  else if (out < oe) {
9125  *out++ = po;
9126  }
9127  else {
9128  return false;
9129  }
9130  return true;
9131  }
9132 #endif
9133 
9134  //
9135  // Decode (uncompress) ni bits based on encoding & decoding tables:
9136  //
9137 
9138  static bool hufDecode(const long long *hcode, // i : encoding table
9139  const HufDec *hdecod, // i : decoding table
9140  const char *in, // i : compressed input buffer
9141  int ni, // i : input size (in bits)
9142  int rlc, // i : run-length code
9143  int no, // i : expected output size (in bytes)
9144  unsigned short *out) // o: uncompressed output buffer
9145  {
9146  long long c = 0;
9147  int lc = 0;
9148  unsigned short *outb = out; // begin
9149  unsigned short *oe = out + no; // end
9150  const char *ie = in + (ni + 7) / 8; // input byte size
9151 
9152  //
9153  // Loop on input bytes
9154  //
9155 
9156  while (in < ie) {
9157  getChar(c, lc, in);
9158 
9159  //
9160  // Access decoding table
9161  //
9162 
9163  while (lc >= HUF_DECBITS) {
9164  const HufDec pl = hdecod[(c >> (lc - HUF_DECBITS)) & HUF_DECMASK];
9165 
9166  if (pl.len) {
9167  //
9168  // Get short code
9169  //
9170 
9171  lc -= pl.len;
9172  // std::cout << "lit = " << pl.lit << std::endl;
9173  // std::cout << "rlc = " << rlc << std::endl;
9174  // std::cout << "c = " << c << std::endl;
9175  // std::cout << "lc = " << lc << std::endl;
9176  // std::cout << "in = " << in << std::endl;
9177  // std::cout << "out = " << out << std::endl;
9178  // std::cout << "oe = " << oe << std::endl;
9179  if (!getCode(pl.lit, rlc, c, lc, in, ie, out, outb, oe)) {
9180  return false;
9181  }
9182  }
9183  else {
9184  if (!pl.p) {
9185  return false;
9186  }
9187  // invalidCode(); // wrong code
9188 
9189  //
9190  // Search long code
9191  //
9192 
9193  int j;
9194 
9195  for (j = 0; j < int(pl.lit); j++) {
9196  int l = hufLength(hcode[pl.p[j]]);
9197 
9198  while (lc < l && in < ie) // get more bits
9199  getChar(c, lc, in);
9200 
9201  if (lc >= l) {
9202  if (hufCode(hcode[pl.p[j]]) ==
9203  ((c >> (lc - l)) & (((long long)(1) << l) - 1))) {
9204  //
9205  // Found : get long code
9206  //
9207 
9208  lc -= l;
9209  if (!getCode(pl.p[j], rlc, c, lc, in, ie, out, outb, oe)) {
9210  return false;
9211  }
9212  break;
9213  }
9214  }
9215  }
9216 
9217  if (j == pl.lit) {
9218  return false;
9219  // invalidCode(); // Not found
9220  }
9221  }
9222  }
9223  }
9224 
9225  //
9226  // Get remaining (short) codes
9227  //
9228 
9229  int i = (8 - ni) & 7;
9230  c >>= i;
9231  lc -= i;
9232 
9233  while (lc > 0) {
9234  const HufDec pl = hdecod[(c << (HUF_DECBITS - lc)) & HUF_DECMASK];
9235 
9236  if (pl.len) {
9237  lc -= pl.len;
9238  if (!getCode(pl.lit, rlc, c, lc, in, ie, out, outb, oe)) {
9239  return false;
9240  }
9241  }
9242  else {
9243  return false;
9244  // invalidCode(); // wrong (long) code
9245  }
9246  }
9247 
9248  if (out - outb != no) {
9249  return false;
9250  }
9251  // notEnoughData ();
9252 
9253  return true;
9254  }
9255 
9256  static void countFrequencies(std::vector<long long> &freq,
9257  const unsigned short data[/*n*/], int n) {
9258  for (int i = 0; i < HUF_ENCSIZE; ++i) freq[i] = 0;
9259 
9260  for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) ++freq[data[i]];
9261  }
9262 
9263  static void writeUInt(char buf[4], unsigned int i) {
9264  unsigned char *b = (unsigned char *)buf;
9265 
9266  b[0] = i;
9267  b[1] = i >> 8;
9268  b[2] = i >> 16;
9269  b[3] = i >> 24;
9270  }
9271 
9272  static unsigned int readUInt(const char buf[4]) {
9273  const unsigned char *b = (const unsigned char *)buf;
9274 
9275  return (b[0] & 0x000000ff) | ((b[1] << 8) & 0x0000ff00) |
9276  ((b[2] << 16) & 0x00ff0000) | ((b[3] << 24) & 0xff000000);
9277  }
9278 
9279  //
9280  // EXTERNAL INTERFACE
9281  //
9282 
9283  static int hufCompress(const unsigned short raw[], int nRaw,
9284  char compressed[]) {
9285  if (nRaw == 0) return 0;
9286 
9287  std::vector<long long> freq(HUF_ENCSIZE);
9288 
9289  countFrequencies(freq, raw, nRaw);
9290 
9291  int im = 0;
9292  int iM = 0;
9293  hufBuildEncTable(freq.data(), &im, &iM);
9294 
9295  char *tableStart = compressed + 20;
9296  char *tableEnd = tableStart;
9297  hufPackEncTable(freq.data(), im, iM, &tableEnd);
9298  int tableLength = tableEnd - tableStart;
9299 
9300  char *dataStart = tableEnd;
9301  int nBits = hufEncode(freq.data(), raw, nRaw, iM, dataStart);
9302  int data_length = (nBits + 7) / 8;
9303 
9304  writeUInt(compressed, im);
9305  writeUInt(compressed + 4, iM);
9306  writeUInt(compressed + 8, tableLength);
9307  writeUInt(compressed + 12, nBits);
9308  writeUInt(compressed + 16, 0); // room for future extensions
9309 
9310  return dataStart + data_length - compressed;
9311  }
9312 
9313  static bool hufUncompress(const char compressed[], int nCompressed,
9314  std::vector<unsigned short> *raw) {
9315  if (nCompressed == 0) {
9316  if (raw->size() != 0) return false;
9317 
9318  return false;
9319  }
9320 
9321  int im = readUInt(compressed);
9322  int iM = readUInt(compressed + 4);
9323  // int tableLength = readUInt (compressed + 8);
9324  int nBits = readUInt(compressed + 12);
9325 
9326  if (im < 0 || im >= HUF_ENCSIZE || iM < 0 || iM >= HUF_ENCSIZE) return false;
9327 
9328  const char *ptr = compressed + 20;
9329 
9330  //
9331  // Fast decoder needs at least 2x64-bits of compressed data, and
9332  // needs to be run-able on this platform. Otherwise, fall back
9333  // to the original decoder
9334  //
9335 
9336  // if (FastHufDecoder::enabled() && nBits > 128)
9337  //{
9338  // FastHufDecoder fhd (ptr, nCompressed - (ptr - compressed), im, iM, iM);
9339  // fhd.decode ((unsigned char*)ptr, nBits, raw, nRaw);
9340  //}
9341  // else
9342  {
9343  std::vector<long long> freq(HUF_ENCSIZE);
9344  std::vector<HufDec> hdec(HUF_DECSIZE);
9345 
9346  hufClearDecTable(&hdec.at(0));
9347 
9348  hufUnpackEncTable(&ptr, nCompressed - (ptr - compressed), im, iM,
9349  &freq.at(0));
9350 
9351  {
9352  if (nBits > 8 * (nCompressed - (ptr - compressed))) {
9353  return false;
9354  }
9355 
9356  hufBuildDecTable(&freq.at(0), im, iM, &hdec.at(0));
9357  hufDecode(&freq.at(0), &hdec.at(0), ptr, nBits, iM, raw->size(),
9358  raw->data());
9359  }
9360  // catch (...)
9361  //{
9362  // hufFreeDecTable (hdec);
9363  // throw;
9364  //}
9365 
9366  hufFreeDecTable(&hdec.at(0));
9367  }
9368 
9369  return true;
9370  }
9371 
9372  //
9373  // Functions to compress the range of values in the pixel data
9374  //
9375 
9376  const int USHORT_RANGE = (1 << 16);
9377  const int BITMAP_SIZE = (USHORT_RANGE >> 3);
9378 
9379  static void bitmapFromData(const unsigned short data[/*nData*/], int nData,
9380  unsigned char bitmap[BITMAP_SIZE],
9381  unsigned short &minNonZero,
9382  unsigned short &maxNonZero) {
9383  for (int i = 0; i < BITMAP_SIZE; ++i) bitmap[i] = 0;
9384 
9385  for (int i = 0; i < nData; ++i) bitmap[data[i] >> 3] |= (1 << (data[i] & 7));
9386 
9387  bitmap[0] &= ~1; // zero is not explicitly stored in
9388  // the bitmap; we assume that the
9389  // data always contain zeroes
9390  minNonZero = BITMAP_SIZE - 1;
9391  maxNonZero = 0;
9392 
9393  for (int i = 0; i < BITMAP_SIZE; ++i) {
9394  if (bitmap[i]) {
9395  if (minNonZero > i) minNonZero = i;
9396  if (maxNonZero < i) maxNonZero = i;
9397  }
9398  }
9399  }
9400 
9401  static unsigned short forwardLutFromBitmap(
9402  const unsigned char bitmap[BITMAP_SIZE], unsigned short lut[USHORT_RANGE]) {
9403  int k = 0;
9404 
9405  for (int i = 0; i < USHORT_RANGE; ++i) {
9406  if ((i == 0) || (bitmap[i >> 3] & (1 << (i & 7))))
9407  lut[i] = k++;
9408  else
9409  lut[i] = 0;
9410  }
9411 
9412  return k - 1; // maximum value stored in lut[],
9413  } // i.e. number of ones in bitmap minus 1
9414 
9415  static unsigned short reverseLutFromBitmap(
9416  const unsigned char bitmap[BITMAP_SIZE], unsigned short lut[USHORT_RANGE]) {
9417  int k = 0;
9418 
9419  for (int i = 0; i < USHORT_RANGE; ++i) {
9420  if ((i == 0) || (bitmap[i >> 3] & (1 << (i & 7)))) lut[k++] = i;
9421  }
9422 
9423  int n = k - 1;
9424 
9425  while (k < USHORT_RANGE) lut[k++] = 0;
9426 
9427  return n; // maximum k where lut[k] is non-zero,
9428  } // i.e. number of ones in bitmap minus 1
9429 
9430  static void applyLut(const unsigned short lut[USHORT_RANGE],
9431  unsigned short data[/*nData*/], int nData) {
9432  for (int i = 0; i < nData; ++i) data[i] = lut[data[i]];
9433  }
9434 
9435 #ifdef __clang__
9436 #pragma clang diagnostic pop
9437 #endif // __clang__
9438 
9439 #ifdef _MSC_VER
9440 #pragma warning(pop)
9441 #endif
9442 
9443  static bool CompressPiz(unsigned char *outPtr, unsigned int *outSize,
9444  const unsigned char *inPtr, size_t inSize,
9445  const std::vector<ChannelInfo> &channelInfo,
9446  int data_width, int num_lines) {
9447  std::vector<unsigned char> bitmap(BITMAP_SIZE);
9448  unsigned short minNonZero;
9449  unsigned short maxNonZero;
9450 
9451 #if !MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN
9452  // @todo { PIZ compression on BigEndian architecture. }
9453  assert(0);
9454  return false;
9455 #endif
9456 
9457  // Assume `inSize` is multiple of 2 or 4.
9458  std::vector<unsigned short> tmpBuffer(inSize / sizeof(unsigned short));
9459 
9460  std::vector<PIZChannelData> channelData(channelInfo.size());
9461  unsigned short *tmpBufferEnd = &tmpBuffer.at(0);
9462 
9463  for (size_t c = 0; c < channelData.size(); c++) {
9464  PIZChannelData &cd = channelData[c];
9465 
9466  cd.start = tmpBufferEnd;
9467  cd.end = cd.start;
9468 
9469  cd.nx = data_width;
9470  cd.ny = num_lines;
9471  // cd.ys = c.channel().ySampling;
9472 
9473  size_t pixelSize = sizeof(int); // UINT and FLOAT
9474  if (channelInfo[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
9475  pixelSize = sizeof(short);
9476  }
9477 
9478  cd.size = static_cast<int>(pixelSize / sizeof(short));
9479 
9480  tmpBufferEnd += cd.nx * cd.ny * cd.size;
9481  }
9482 
9483  const unsigned char *ptr = inPtr;
9484  for (int y = 0; y < num_lines; ++y) {
9485  for (size_t i = 0; i < channelData.size(); ++i) {
9486  PIZChannelData &cd = channelData[i];
9487 
9488  // if (modp (y, cd.ys) != 0)
9489  // continue;
9490 
9491  size_t n = static_cast<size_t>(cd.nx * cd.size);
9492  memcpy(cd.end, ptr, n * sizeof(unsigned short));
9493  ptr += n * sizeof(unsigned short);
9494  cd.end += n;
9495  }
9496  }
9497 
9498  bitmapFromData(&tmpBuffer.at(0), static_cast<int>(tmpBuffer.size()),
9499  bitmap.data(), minNonZero, maxNonZero);
9500 
9501  std::vector<unsigned short> lut(USHORT_RANGE);
9502  unsigned short maxValue = forwardLutFromBitmap(bitmap.data(), lut.data());
9503  applyLut(lut.data(), &tmpBuffer.at(0), static_cast<int>(tmpBuffer.size()));
9504 
9505  //
9506  // Store range compression info in _outBuffer
9507  //
9508 
9509  char *buf = reinterpret_cast<char *>(outPtr);
9510 
9511  memcpy(buf, &minNonZero, sizeof(unsigned short));
9512  buf += sizeof(unsigned short);
9513  memcpy(buf, &maxNonZero, sizeof(unsigned short));
9514  buf += sizeof(unsigned short);
9515 
9516  if (minNonZero <= maxNonZero) {
9517  memcpy(buf, reinterpret_cast<char *>(&bitmap[0] + minNonZero),
9518  maxNonZero - minNonZero + 1);
9519  buf += maxNonZero - minNonZero + 1;
9520  }
9521 
9522  //
9523  // Apply wavelet encoding
9524  //
9525 
9526  for (size_t i = 0; i < channelData.size(); ++i) {
9527  PIZChannelData &cd = channelData[i];
9528 
9529  for (int j = 0; j < cd.size; ++j) {
9530  wav2Encode(cd.start + j, cd.nx, cd.size, cd.ny, cd.nx * cd.size,
9531  maxValue);
9532  }
9533  }
9534 
9535  //
9536  // Apply Huffman encoding; append the result to _outBuffer
9537  //
9538 
9539  // length header(4byte), then huff data. Initialize length header with zero,
9540  // then later fill it by `length`.
9541  char *lengthPtr = buf;
9542  int zero = 0;
9543  memcpy(buf, &zero, sizeof(int));
9544  buf += sizeof(int);
9545 
9546  int length =
9547  hufCompress(&tmpBuffer.at(0), static_cast<int>(tmpBuffer.size()), buf);
9548  memcpy(lengthPtr, &length, sizeof(int));
9549 
9550  (*outSize) = static_cast<unsigned int>(
9551  (reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(buf) - outPtr) +
9552  static_cast<unsigned int>(length));
9553 
9554  // Use uncompressed data when compressed data is larger than uncompressed.
9555  // (Issue 40)
9556  if ((*outSize) >= inSize) {
9557  (*outSize) = static_cast<unsigned int>(inSize);
9558  memcpy(outPtr, inPtr, inSize);
9559  }
9560  return true;
9561  }
9562 
9563  static bool DecompressPiz(unsigned char *outPtr, const unsigned char *inPtr,
9564  size_t tmpBufSize, size_t inLen, int num_channels,
9565  const EXRChannelInfo *channels, int data_width,
9566  int num_lines) {
9567  if (inLen == tmpBufSize) {
9568  // Data is not compressed(Issue 40).
9569  memcpy(outPtr, inPtr, inLen);
9570  return true;
9571  }
9572 
9573  std::vector<unsigned char> bitmap(BITMAP_SIZE);
9574  unsigned short minNonZero;
9575  unsigned short maxNonZero;
9576 
9577 #if !MINIZ_LITTLE_ENDIAN
9578  // @todo { PIZ compression on BigEndian architecture. }
9579  assert(0);
9580  return false;
9581 #endif
9582 
9583  memset(bitmap.data(), 0, BITMAP_SIZE);
9584 
9585  const unsigned char *ptr = inPtr;
9586  // minNonZero = *(reinterpret_cast<const unsigned short *>(ptr));
9587  tinyexr::cpy2(&minNonZero, reinterpret_cast<const unsigned short *>(ptr));
9588  // maxNonZero = *(reinterpret_cast<const unsigned short *>(ptr + 2));
9589  tinyexr::cpy2(&maxNonZero, reinterpret_cast<const unsigned short *>(ptr + 2));
9590  ptr += 4;
9591 
9592  if (maxNonZero >= BITMAP_SIZE) {
9593  return false;
9594  }
9595 
9596  if (minNonZero <= maxNonZero) {
9597  memcpy(reinterpret_cast<char *>(&bitmap[0] + minNonZero), ptr,
9598  maxNonZero - minNonZero + 1);
9599  ptr += maxNonZero - minNonZero + 1;
9600  }
9601 
9602  std::vector<unsigned short> lut(USHORT_RANGE);
9603  memset(lut.data(), 0, sizeof(unsigned short) * USHORT_RANGE);
9604  unsigned short maxValue = reverseLutFromBitmap(bitmap.data(), lut.data());
9605 
9606  //
9607  // Huffman decoding
9608  //
9609 
9610  int length;
9611 
9612  // length = *(reinterpret_cast<const int *>(ptr));
9613  tinyexr::cpy4(&length, reinterpret_cast<const int *>(ptr));
9614  ptr += sizeof(int);
9615 
9616  if (size_t((ptr - inPtr) + length) > inLen) {
9617  return false;
9618  }
9619 
9620  std::vector<unsigned short> tmpBuffer(tmpBufSize);
9621  hufUncompress(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(ptr), length, &tmpBuffer);
9622 
9623  //
9624  // Wavelet decoding
9625  //
9626 
9627  std::vector<PIZChannelData> channelData(static_cast<size_t>(num_channels));
9628 
9629  unsigned short *tmpBufferEnd = &tmpBuffer.at(0);
9630 
9631  for (size_t i = 0; i < static_cast<size_t>(num_channels); ++i) {
9632  const EXRChannelInfo &chan = channels[i];
9633 
9634  size_t pixelSize = sizeof(int); // UINT and FLOAT
9635  if (chan.pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
9636  pixelSize = sizeof(short);
9637  }
9638 
9639  channelData[i].start = tmpBufferEnd;
9640  channelData[i].end = channelData[i].start;
9641  channelData[i].nx = data_width;
9642  channelData[i].ny = num_lines;
9643  // channelData[i].ys = 1;
9644  channelData[i].size = static_cast<int>(pixelSize / sizeof(short));
9645 
9646  tmpBufferEnd += channelData[i].nx * channelData[i].ny * channelData[i].size;
9647  }
9648 
9649  for (size_t i = 0; i < channelData.size(); ++i) {
9650  PIZChannelData &cd = channelData[i];
9651 
9652  for (int j = 0; j < cd.size; ++j) {
9653  wav2Decode(cd.start + j, cd.nx, cd.size, cd.ny, cd.nx * cd.size,
9654  maxValue);
9655  }
9656  }
9657 
9658  //
9659  // Expand the pixel data to their original range
9660  //
9661 
9662  applyLut(lut.data(), &tmpBuffer.at(0), static_cast<int>(tmpBufSize));
9663 
9664  for (int y = 0; y < num_lines; y++) {
9665  for (size_t i = 0; i < channelData.size(); ++i) {
9666  PIZChannelData &cd = channelData[i];
9667 
9668  // if (modp (y, cd.ys) != 0)
9669  // continue;
9670 
9671  size_t n = static_cast<size_t>(cd.nx * cd.size);
9672  memcpy(outPtr, cd.end, static_cast<size_t>(n * sizeof(unsigned short)));
9673  outPtr += n * sizeof(unsigned short);
9674  cd.end += n;
9675  }
9676  }
9677 
9678  return true;
9679  }
9680 #endif // TINYEXR_USE_PIZ
9681 
9682 #if TINYEXR_USE_ZFP
9683 
9684  struct ZFPCompressionParam {
9685  double rate;
9686  unsigned int precision;
9687  unsigned int __pad0;
9688  double tolerance;
9689  int type; // TINYEXR_ZFP_COMPRESSIONTYPE_*
9690  unsigned int __pad1;
9691 
9692  ZFPCompressionParam() {
9693  type = TINYEXR_ZFP_COMPRESSIONTYPE_RATE;
9694  rate = 2.0;
9695  precision = 0;
9696  tolerance = 0.0;
9697  }
9698  };
9699 
9700  static bool FindZFPCompressionParam(ZFPCompressionParam *param,
9701  const EXRAttribute *attributes,
9702  int num_attributes, std::string *err) {
9703  bool foundType = false;
9704 
9705  for (int i = 0; i < num_attributes; i++) {
9706  if ((strcmp(attributes[i].name, "zfpCompressionType") == 0)) {
9707  if (attributes[i].size == 1) {
9708  param->type = static_cast<int>(attributes[i].value[0]);
9709  foundType = true;
9710  break;
9711  }
9712  else {
9713  if (err) {
9714  (*err) +=
9715  "zfpCompressionType attribute must be uchar(1 byte) type.\n";
9716  }
9717  return false;
9718  }
9719  }
9720  }
9721 
9722  if (!foundType) {
9723  if (err) {
9724  (*err) += "`zfpCompressionType` attribute not found.\n";
9725  }
9726  return false;
9727  }
9728 
9729  if (param->type == TINYEXR_ZFP_COMPRESSIONTYPE_RATE) {
9730  for (int i = 0; i < num_attributes; i++) {
9731  if ((strcmp(attributes[i].name, "zfpCompressionRate") == 0) &&
9732  (attributes[i].size == 8)) {
9733  param->rate = *(reinterpret_cast<double *>(attributes[i].value));
9734  return true;
9735  }
9736  }
9737 
9738  if (err) {
9739  (*err) += "`zfpCompressionRate` attribute not found.\n";
9740  }
9741 
9742  }
9743  else if (param->type == TINYEXR_ZFP_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PRECISION) {
9744  for (int i = 0; i < num_attributes; i++) {
9745  if ((strcmp(attributes[i].name, "zfpCompressionPrecision") == 0) &&
9746  (attributes[i].size == 4)) {
9747  param->rate = *(reinterpret_cast<int *>(attributes[i].value));
9748  return true;
9749  }
9750  }
9751 
9752  if (err) {
9753  (*err) += "`zfpCompressionPrecision` attribute not found.\n";
9754  }
9755 
9756  }
9757  else if (param->type == TINYEXR_ZFP_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ACCURACY) {
9758  for (int i = 0; i < num_attributes; i++) {
9759  if ((strcmp(attributes[i].name, "zfpCompressionTolerance") == 0) &&
9760  (attributes[i].size == 8)) {
9761  param->tolerance = *(reinterpret_cast<double *>(attributes[i].value));
9762  return true;
9763  }
9764  }
9765 
9766  if (err) {
9767  (*err) += "`zfpCompressionTolerance` attribute not found.\n";
9768  }
9769  }
9770  else {
9771  if (err) {
9772  (*err) += "Unknown value specified for `zfpCompressionType`.\n";
9773  }
9774  }
9775 
9776  return false;
9777  }
9778 
9779  // Assume pixel format is FLOAT for all channels.
9780  static bool DecompressZfp(float *dst, int dst_width, int dst_num_lines,
9781  size_t num_channels, const unsigned char *src,
9782  unsigned long src_size,
9783  const ZFPCompressionParam &param) {
9784  size_t uncompressed_size =
9785  size_t(dst_width) * size_t(dst_num_lines) * num_channels;
9786 
9787  if (uncompressed_size == src_size) {
9788  // Data is not compressed(Issue 40).
9789  memcpy(dst, src, src_size);
9790  }
9791 
9792  zfp_stream *zfp = NULL;
9793  zfp_field *field = NULL;
9794 
9795  assert((dst_width % 4) == 0);
9796  assert((dst_num_lines % 4) == 0);
9797 
9798  if ((size_t(dst_width) & 3U) || (size_t(dst_num_lines) & 3U)) {
9799  return false;
9800  }
9801 
9802  field =
9803  zfp_field_2d(reinterpret_cast<void *>(const_cast<unsigned char *>(src)),
9804  zfp_type_float, static_cast<unsigned int>(dst_width),
9805  static_cast<unsigned int>(dst_num_lines) *
9806  static_cast<unsigned int>(num_channels));
9807  zfp = zfp_stream_open(NULL);
9808 
9809  if (param.type == TINYEXR_ZFP_COMPRESSIONTYPE_RATE) {
9810  zfp_stream_set_rate(zfp, param.rate, zfp_type_float, /* dimension */ 2,
9811  /* write random access */ 0);
9812  }
9813  else if (param.type == TINYEXR_ZFP_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PRECISION) {
9814  zfp_stream_set_precision(zfp, param.precision);
9815  }
9816  else if (param.type == TINYEXR_ZFP_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ACCURACY) {
9817  zfp_stream_set_accuracy(zfp, param.tolerance);
9818  }
9819  else {
9820  assert(0);
9821  }
9822 
9823  size_t buf_size = zfp_stream_maximum_size(zfp, field);
9824  std::vector<unsigned char> buf(buf_size);
9825  memcpy(&buf.at(0), src, src_size);
9826 
9827  bitstream *stream = stream_open(&buf.at(0), buf_size);
9828  zfp_stream_set_bit_stream(zfp, stream);
9829  zfp_stream_rewind(zfp);
9830 
9831  size_t image_size = size_t(dst_width) * size_t(dst_num_lines);
9832 
9833  for (size_t c = 0; c < size_t(num_channels); c++) {
9834  // decompress 4x4 pixel block.
9835  for (size_t y = 0; y < size_t(dst_num_lines); y += 4) {
9836  for (size_t x = 0; x < size_t(dst_width); x += 4) {
9837  float fblock[16];
9838  zfp_decode_block_float_2(zfp, fblock);
9839  for (size_t j = 0; j < 4; j++) {
9840  for (size_t i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
9841  dst[c * image_size + ((y + j) * size_t(dst_width) + (x + i))] =
9842  fblock[j * 4 + i];
9843  }
9844  }
9845  }
9846  }
9847  }
9848 
9849  zfp_field_free(field);
9850  zfp_stream_close(zfp);
9851  stream_close(stream);
9852 
9853  return true;
9854  }
9855 
9856  // Assume pixel format is FLOAT for all channels.
9857  static bool CompressZfp(std::vector<unsigned char> *outBuf,
9858  unsigned int *outSize, const float *inPtr, int width,
9859  int num_lines, int num_channels,
9860  const ZFPCompressionParam &param) {
9861  zfp_stream *zfp = NULL;
9862  zfp_field *field = NULL;
9863 
9864  assert((width % 4) == 0);
9865  assert((num_lines % 4) == 0);
9866 
9867  if ((size_t(width) & 3U) || (size_t(num_lines) & 3U)) {
9868  return false;
9869  }
9870 
9871  // create input array.
9872  field = zfp_field_2d(reinterpret_cast<void *>(const_cast<float *>(inPtr)),
9873  zfp_type_float, static_cast<unsigned int>(width),
9874  static_cast<unsigned int>(num_lines * num_channels));
9875 
9876  zfp = zfp_stream_open(NULL);
9877 
9878  if (param.type == TINYEXR_ZFP_COMPRESSIONTYPE_RATE) {
9879  zfp_stream_set_rate(zfp, param.rate, zfp_type_float, 2, 0);
9880  }
9881  else if (param.type == TINYEXR_ZFP_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PRECISION) {
9882  zfp_stream_set_precision(zfp, param.precision);
9883  }
9884  else if (param.type == TINYEXR_ZFP_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ACCURACY) {
9885  zfp_stream_set_accuracy(zfp, param.tolerance);
9886  }
9887  else {
9888  assert(0);
9889  }
9890 
9891  size_t buf_size = zfp_stream_maximum_size(zfp, field);
9892 
9893  outBuf->resize(buf_size);
9894 
9895  bitstream *stream = stream_open(&outBuf->at(0), buf_size);
9896  zfp_stream_set_bit_stream(zfp, stream);
9897  zfp_field_free(field);
9898 
9899  size_t image_size = size_t(width) * size_t(num_lines);
9900 
9901  for (size_t c = 0; c < size_t(num_channels); c++) {
9902  // compress 4x4 pixel block.
9903  for (size_t y = 0; y < size_t(num_lines); y += 4) {
9904  for (size_t x = 0; x < size_t(width); x += 4) {
9905  float fblock[16];
9906  for (size_t j = 0; j < 4; j++) {
9907  for (size_t i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
9908  fblock[j * 4 + i] =
9909  inPtr[c * image_size + ((y + j) * size_t(width) + (x + i))];
9910  }
9911  }
9912  zfp_encode_block_float_2(zfp, fblock);
9913  }
9914  }
9915  }
9916 
9917  zfp_stream_flush(zfp);
9918  (*outSize) = static_cast<unsigned int>(zfp_stream_compressed_size(zfp));
9919 
9920  zfp_stream_close(zfp);
9921 
9922  return true;
9923  }
9924 
9925 #endif
9926 
9927  //
9928  // -----------------------------------------------------------------
9929  //
9930 
9931  // heuristics
9932 #define TINYEXR_DIMENSION_THRESHOLD (1024 * 8192)
9933 
9934 // TODO(syoyo): Refactor function arguments.
9935  static bool DecodePixelData(/* out */ unsigned char **out_images,
9936  const int *requested_pixel_types,
9937  const unsigned char *data_ptr, size_t data_len,
9938  int compression_type, int line_order, int width,
9939  int height, int x_stride, int y, int line_no,
9940  int num_lines, size_t pixel_data_size,
9941  size_t num_attributes,
9942  const EXRAttribute *attributes, size_t num_channels,
9943  const EXRChannelInfo *channels,
9944  const std::vector<size_t> &channel_offset_list) {
9945  if (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PIZ) { // PIZ
9946 #if TINYEXR_USE_PIZ
9947  if ((width == 0) || (num_lines == 0) || (pixel_data_size == 0)) {
9948  // Invalid input #90
9949  return false;
9950  }
9951 
9952  // Allocate original data size.
9953  std::vector<unsigned char> outBuf(static_cast<size_t>(
9954  static_cast<size_t>(width * num_lines) * pixel_data_size));
9955  size_t tmpBufLen = outBuf.size();
9956 
9957  bool ret = tinyexr::DecompressPiz(
9958  reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(&outBuf.at(0)), data_ptr, tmpBufLen,
9959  data_len, static_cast<int>(num_channels), channels, width, num_lines);
9960 
9961  if (!ret) {
9962  return false;
9963  }
9964 
9965  // For PIZ_COMPRESSION:
9966  // pixel sample data for channel 0 for scanline 0
9967  // pixel sample data for channel 1 for scanline 0
9968  // pixel sample data for channel ... for scanline 0
9969  // pixel sample data for channel n for scanline 0
9970  // pixel sample data for channel 0 for scanline 1
9971  // pixel sample data for channel 1 for scanline 1
9972  // pixel sample data for channel ... for scanline 1
9973  // pixel sample data for channel n for scanline 1
9974  // ...
9975  for (size_t c = 0; c < static_cast<size_t>(num_channels); c++) {
9976  if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
9977  for (size_t v = 0; v < static_cast<size_t>(num_lines); v++) {
9978  const unsigned short *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<unsigned short *>(
9979  &outBuf.at(v * pixel_data_size * static_cast<size_t>(width) +
9980  channel_offset_list[c] * static_cast<size_t>(width)));
9981  for (size_t u = 0; u < static_cast<size_t>(width); u++) {
9982  FP16 hf;
9983 
9984  // hf.u = line_ptr[u];
9985  // use `cpy` to avoid unaligned memory access when compiler's
9986  // optimization is on.
9987  tinyexr::cpy2(&(hf.u), line_ptr + u);
9988 
9989  tinyexr::swap2(reinterpret_cast<unsigned short *>(&hf.u));
9990 
9991  if (requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
9992  unsigned short *image =
9993  reinterpret_cast<unsigned short **>(out_images)[c];
9994  if (line_order == 0) {
9995  image += (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v) *
9996  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
9997  u;
9998  }
9999  else {
10000  image += static_cast<size_t>(
10001  (height - 1 - (line_no + static_cast<int>(v)))) *
10002  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10003  u;
10004  }
10005  *image = hf.u;
10006  }
10007  else { // HALF -> FLOAT
10008  FP32 f32 = half_to_float(hf);
10009  float *image = reinterpret_cast<float **>(out_images)[c];
10010  size_t offset = 0;
10011  if (line_order == 0) {
10012  offset = (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v) *
10013  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10014  u;
10015  }
10016  else {
10017  offset = static_cast<size_t>(
10018  (height - 1 - (line_no + static_cast<int>(v)))) *
10019  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10020  u;
10021  }
10022  image += offset;
10023  *image = f32.f;
10024  }
10025  }
10026  }
10027  }
10028  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_UINT) {
10029  assert(requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_UINT);
10030 
10031  for (size_t v = 0; v < static_cast<size_t>(num_lines); v++) {
10032  const unsigned int *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(
10033  &outBuf.at(v * pixel_data_size * static_cast<size_t>(width) +
10034  channel_offset_list[c] * static_cast<size_t>(width)));
10035  for (size_t u = 0; u < static_cast<size_t>(width); u++) {
10036  unsigned int val;
10037  // val = line_ptr[u];
10038  tinyexr::cpy4(&val, line_ptr + u);
10039 
10040  tinyexr::swap4(&val);
10041 
10042  unsigned int *image =
10043  reinterpret_cast<unsigned int **>(out_images)[c];
10044  if (line_order == 0) {
10045  image += (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v) *
10046  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10047  u;
10048  }
10049  else {
10050  image += static_cast<size_t>(
10051  (height - 1 - (line_no + static_cast<int>(v)))) *
10052  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10053  u;
10054  }
10055  *image = val;
10056  }
10057  }
10058  }
10059  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) {
10060  assert(requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT);
10061  for (size_t v = 0; v < static_cast<size_t>(num_lines); v++) {
10062  const float *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<float *>(&outBuf.at(
10063  v * pixel_data_size * static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10064  channel_offset_list[c] * static_cast<size_t>(x_stride)));
10065  for (size_t u = 0; u < static_cast<size_t>(width); u++) {
10066  float val;
10067  // val = line_ptr[u];
10068  tinyexr::cpy4(&val, line_ptr + u);
10069 
10070  tinyexr::swap4(reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(&val));
10071 
10072  float *image = reinterpret_cast<float **>(out_images)[c];
10073  if (line_order == 0) {
10074  image += (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v) *
10075  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10076  u;
10077  }
10078  else {
10079  image += static_cast<size_t>(
10080  (height - 1 - (line_no + static_cast<int>(v)))) *
10081  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10082  u;
10083  }
10084  *image = val;
10085  }
10086  }
10087  }
10088  else {
10089  assert(0);
10090  }
10091  }
10092 #else
10093  assert(0 && "PIZ is enabled in this build");
10094  return false;
10095 #endif
10096 
10097  }
10098  else if (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIPS ||
10099  compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIP) {
10100  // Allocate original data size.
10101  std::vector<unsigned char> outBuf(static_cast<size_t>(width) *
10102  static_cast<size_t>(num_lines) *
10103  pixel_data_size);
10104 
10105  unsigned long dstLen = static_cast<unsigned long>(outBuf.size());
10106  assert(dstLen > 0);
10107  if (!tinyexr::DecompressZip(
10108  reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(&outBuf.at(0)), &dstLen, data_ptr,
10109  static_cast<unsigned long>(data_len))) {
10110  return false;
10111  }
10112 
10113  // For ZIP_COMPRESSION:
10114  // pixel sample data for channel 0 for scanline 0
10115  // pixel sample data for channel 1 for scanline 0
10116  // pixel sample data for channel ... for scanline 0
10117  // pixel sample data for channel n for scanline 0
10118  // pixel sample data for channel 0 for scanline 1
10119  // pixel sample data for channel 1 for scanline 1
10120  // pixel sample data for channel ... for scanline 1
10121  // pixel sample data for channel n for scanline 1
10122  // ...
10123  for (size_t c = 0; c < static_cast<size_t>(num_channels); c++) {
10124  if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
10125  for (size_t v = 0; v < static_cast<size_t>(num_lines); v++) {
10126  const unsigned short *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<unsigned short *>(
10127  &outBuf.at(v * static_cast<size_t>(pixel_data_size) *
10128  static_cast<size_t>(width) +
10129  channel_offset_list[c] * static_cast<size_t>(width)));
10130  for (size_t u = 0; u < static_cast<size_t>(width); u++) {
10131  tinyexr::FP16 hf;
10132 
10133  // hf.u = line_ptr[u];
10134  tinyexr::cpy2(&(hf.u), line_ptr + u);
10135 
10136  tinyexr::swap2(reinterpret_cast<unsigned short *>(&hf.u));
10137 
10138  if (requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
10139  unsigned short *image =
10140  reinterpret_cast<unsigned short **>(out_images)[c];
10141  if (line_order == 0) {
10142  image += (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v) *
10143  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10144  u;
10145  }
10146  else {
10147  image += (static_cast<size_t>(height) - 1U -
10148  (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v)) *
10149  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10150  u;
10151  }
10152  *image = hf.u;
10153  }
10154  else { // HALF -> FLOAT
10155  tinyexr::FP32 f32 = half_to_float(hf);
10156  float *image = reinterpret_cast<float **>(out_images)[c];
10157  size_t offset = 0;
10158  if (line_order == 0) {
10159  offset = (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v) *
10160  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10161  u;
10162  }
10163  else {
10164  offset = (static_cast<size_t>(height) - 1U -
10165  (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v)) *
10166  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10167  u;
10168  }
10169  image += offset;
10170 
10171  *image = f32.f;
10172  }
10173  }
10174  }
10175  }
10176  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_UINT) {
10177  assert(requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_UINT);
10178 
10179  for (size_t v = 0; v < static_cast<size_t>(num_lines); v++) {
10180  const unsigned int *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(
10181  &outBuf.at(v * pixel_data_size * static_cast<size_t>(width) +
10182  channel_offset_list[c] * static_cast<size_t>(width)));
10183  for (size_t u = 0; u < static_cast<size_t>(width); u++) {
10184  unsigned int val;
10185  // val = line_ptr[u];
10186  tinyexr::cpy4(&val, line_ptr + u);
10187 
10188  tinyexr::swap4(&val);
10189 
10190  unsigned int *image =
10191  reinterpret_cast<unsigned int **>(out_images)[c];
10192  if (line_order == 0) {
10193  image += (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v) *
10194  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10195  u;
10196  }
10197  else {
10198  image += (static_cast<size_t>(height) - 1U -
10199  (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v)) *
10200  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10201  u;
10202  }
10203  *image = val;
10204  }
10205  }
10206  }
10207  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) {
10208  assert(requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT);
10209  for (size_t v = 0; v < static_cast<size_t>(num_lines); v++) {
10210  const float *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<float *>(
10211  &outBuf.at(v * pixel_data_size * static_cast<size_t>(width) +
10212  channel_offset_list[c] * static_cast<size_t>(width)));
10213  for (size_t u = 0; u < static_cast<size_t>(width); u++) {
10214  float val;
10215  // val = line_ptr[u];
10216  tinyexr::cpy4(&val, line_ptr + u);
10217 
10218  tinyexr::swap4(reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(&val));
10219 
10220  float *image = reinterpret_cast<float **>(out_images)[c];
10221  if (line_order == 0) {
10222  image += (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v) *
10223  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10224  u;
10225  }
10226  else {
10227  image += (static_cast<size_t>(height) - 1U -
10228  (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v)) *
10229  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10230  u;
10231  }
10232  *image = val;
10233  }
10234  }
10235  }
10236  else {
10237  assert(0);
10238  return false;
10239  }
10240  }
10241  }
10242  else if (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_RLE) {
10243  // Allocate original data size.
10244  std::vector<unsigned char> outBuf(static_cast<size_t>(width) *
10245  static_cast<size_t>(num_lines) *
10246  pixel_data_size);
10247 
10248  unsigned long dstLen = static_cast<unsigned long>(outBuf.size());
10249  if (dstLen == 0) {
10250  return false;
10251  }
10252 
10253  if (!tinyexr::DecompressRle(
10254  reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(&outBuf.at(0)), dstLen, data_ptr,
10255  static_cast<unsigned long>(data_len))) {
10256  return false;
10257  }
10258 
10259  // For RLE_COMPRESSION:
10260  // pixel sample data for channel 0 for scanline 0
10261  // pixel sample data for channel 1 for scanline 0
10262  // pixel sample data for channel ... for scanline 0
10263  // pixel sample data for channel n for scanline 0
10264  // pixel sample data for channel 0 for scanline 1
10265  // pixel sample data for channel 1 for scanline 1
10266  // pixel sample data for channel ... for scanline 1
10267  // pixel sample data for channel n for scanline 1
10268  // ...
10269  for (size_t c = 0; c < static_cast<size_t>(num_channels); c++) {
10270  if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
10271  for (size_t v = 0; v < static_cast<size_t>(num_lines); v++) {
10272  const unsigned short *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<unsigned short *>(
10273  &outBuf.at(v * static_cast<size_t>(pixel_data_size) *
10274  static_cast<size_t>(width) +
10275  channel_offset_list[c] * static_cast<size_t>(width)));
10276  for (size_t u = 0; u < static_cast<size_t>(width); u++) {
10277  tinyexr::FP16 hf;
10278 
10279  // hf.u = line_ptr[u];
10280  tinyexr::cpy2(&(hf.u), line_ptr + u);
10281 
10282  tinyexr::swap2(reinterpret_cast<unsigned short *>(&hf.u));
10283 
10284  if (requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
10285  unsigned short *image =
10286  reinterpret_cast<unsigned short **>(out_images)[c];
10287  if (line_order == 0) {
10288  image += (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v) *
10289  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10290  u;
10291  }
10292  else {
10293  image += (static_cast<size_t>(height) - 1U -
10294  (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v)) *
10295  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10296  u;
10297  }
10298  *image = hf.u;
10299  }
10300  else { // HALF -> FLOAT
10301  tinyexr::FP32 f32 = half_to_float(hf);
10302  float *image = reinterpret_cast<float **>(out_images)[c];
10303  if (line_order == 0) {
10304  image += (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v) *
10305  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10306  u;
10307  }
10308  else {
10309  image += (static_cast<size_t>(height) - 1U -
10310  (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v)) *
10311  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10312  u;
10313  }
10314  *image = f32.f;
10315  }
10316  }
10317  }
10318  }
10319  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_UINT) {
10320  assert(requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_UINT);
10321 
10322  for (size_t v = 0; v < static_cast<size_t>(num_lines); v++) {
10323  const unsigned int *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(
10324  &outBuf.at(v * pixel_data_size * static_cast<size_t>(width) +
10325  channel_offset_list[c] * static_cast<size_t>(width)));
10326  for (size_t u = 0; u < static_cast<size_t>(width); u++) {
10327  unsigned int val;
10328  // val = line_ptr[u];
10329  tinyexr::cpy4(&val, line_ptr + u);
10330 
10331  tinyexr::swap4(&val);
10332 
10333  unsigned int *image =
10334  reinterpret_cast<unsigned int **>(out_images)[c];
10335  if (line_order == 0) {
10336  image += (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v) *
10337  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10338  u;
10339  }
10340  else {
10341  image += (static_cast<size_t>(height) - 1U -
10342  (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v)) *
10343  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10344  u;
10345  }
10346  *image = val;
10347  }
10348  }
10349  }
10350  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) {
10351  assert(requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT);
10352  for (size_t v = 0; v < static_cast<size_t>(num_lines); v++) {
10353  const float *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<float *>(
10354  &outBuf.at(v * pixel_data_size * static_cast<size_t>(width) +
10355  channel_offset_list[c] * static_cast<size_t>(width)));
10356  for (size_t u = 0; u < static_cast<size_t>(width); u++) {
10357  float val;
10358  // val = line_ptr[u];
10359  tinyexr::cpy4(&val, line_ptr + u);
10360 
10361  tinyexr::swap4(reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(&val));
10362 
10363  float *image = reinterpret_cast<float **>(out_images)[c];
10364  if (line_order == 0) {
10365  image += (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v) *
10366  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10367  u;
10368  }
10369  else {
10370  image += (static_cast<size_t>(height) - 1U -
10371  (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v)) *
10372  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10373  u;
10374  }
10375  *image = val;
10376  }
10377  }
10378  }
10379  else {
10380  assert(0);
10381  return false;
10382  }
10383  }
10384  }
10385  else if (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZFP) {
10386 #if TINYEXR_USE_ZFP
10387  tinyexr::ZFPCompressionParam zfp_compression_param;
10388  std::string e;
10389  if (!tinyexr::FindZFPCompressionParam(&zfp_compression_param, attributes,
10390  int(num_attributes), &e)) {
10391  // This code path should not be reachable.
10392  assert(0);
10393  return false;
10394  }
10395 
10396  // Allocate original data size.
10397  std::vector<unsigned char> outBuf(static_cast<size_t>(width) *
10398  static_cast<size_t>(num_lines) *
10399  pixel_data_size);
10400 
10401  unsigned long dstLen = outBuf.size();
10402  assert(dstLen > 0);
10403  tinyexr::DecompressZfp(reinterpret_cast<float *>(&outBuf.at(0)), width,
10404  num_lines, num_channels, data_ptr,
10405  static_cast<unsigned long>(data_len),
10406  zfp_compression_param);
10407 
10408  // For ZFP_COMPRESSION:
10409  // pixel sample data for channel 0 for scanline 0
10410  // pixel sample data for channel 1 for scanline 0
10411  // pixel sample data for channel ... for scanline 0
10412  // pixel sample data for channel n for scanline 0
10413  // pixel sample data for channel 0 for scanline 1
10414  // pixel sample data for channel 1 for scanline 1
10415  // pixel sample data for channel ... for scanline 1
10416  // pixel sample data for channel n for scanline 1
10417  // ...
10418  for (size_t c = 0; c < static_cast<size_t>(num_channels); c++) {
10419  assert(channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT);
10420  if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) {
10421  assert(requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT);
10422  for (size_t v = 0; v < static_cast<size_t>(num_lines); v++) {
10423  const float *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<float *>(
10424  &outBuf.at(v * pixel_data_size * static_cast<size_t>(width) +
10425  channel_offset_list[c] * static_cast<size_t>(width)));
10426  for (size_t u = 0; u < static_cast<size_t>(width); u++) {
10427  float val;
10428  tinyexr::cpy4(&val, line_ptr + u);
10429 
10430  tinyexr::swap4(reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(&val));
10431 
10432  float *image = reinterpret_cast<float **>(out_images)[c];
10433  if (line_order == 0) {
10434  image += (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v) *
10435  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10436  u;
10437  }
10438  else {
10439  image += (static_cast<size_t>(height) - 1U -
10440  (static_cast<size_t>(line_no) + v)) *
10441  static_cast<size_t>(x_stride) +
10442  u;
10443  }
10444  *image = val;
10445  }
10446  }
10447  }
10448  else {
10449  assert(0);
10450  return false;
10451  }
10452  }
10453 #else
10454  (void)attributes;
10455  (void)num_attributes;
10456  (void)num_channels;
10457  assert(0);
10458  return false;
10459 #endif
10460  }
10461  else if (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_NONE) {
10462  for (size_t c = 0; c < num_channels; c++) {
10463  for (size_t v = 0; v < static_cast<size_t>(num_lines); v++) {
10464  if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
10465  const unsigned short *line_ptr =
10466  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned short *>(
10467  data_ptr + v * pixel_data_size * size_t(width) +
10468  channel_offset_list[c] * static_cast<size_t>(width));
10469 
10470  if (requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
10471  unsigned short *outLine =
10472  reinterpret_cast<unsigned short *>(out_images[c]);
10473  if (line_order == 0) {
10474  outLine += (size_t(y) + v) * size_t(x_stride);
10475  }
10476  else {
10477  outLine +=
10478  (size_t(height) - 1 - (size_t(y) + v)) * size_t(x_stride);
10479  }
10480 
10481  for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
10482  tinyexr::FP16 hf;
10483 
10484  // hf.u = line_ptr[u];
10485  tinyexr::cpy2(&(hf.u), line_ptr + u);
10486 
10487  tinyexr::swap2(reinterpret_cast<unsigned short *>(&hf.u));
10488 
10489  outLine[u] = hf.u;
10490  }
10491  }
10492  else if (requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) {
10493  float *outLine = reinterpret_cast<float *>(out_images[c]);
10494  if (line_order == 0) {
10495  outLine += (size_t(y) + v) * size_t(x_stride);
10496  }
10497  else {
10498  outLine +=
10499  (size_t(height) - 1 - (size_t(y) + v)) * size_t(x_stride);
10500  }
10501 
10502  if (reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(line_ptr + width) >
10503  (data_ptr + data_len)) {
10504  // Insufficient data size
10505  return false;
10506  }
10507 
10508  for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
10509  tinyexr::FP16 hf;
10510 
10511  // address may not be aliged. use byte-wise copy for safety.#76
10512  // hf.u = line_ptr[u];
10513  tinyexr::cpy2(&(hf.u), line_ptr + u);
10514 
10515  tinyexr::swap2(reinterpret_cast<unsigned short *>(&hf.u));
10516 
10517  tinyexr::FP32 f32 = half_to_float(hf);
10518 
10519  outLine[u] = f32.f;
10520  }
10521  }
10522  else {
10523  assert(0);
10524  return false;
10525  }
10526  }
10527  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) {
10528  const float *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<const float *>(
10529  data_ptr + v * pixel_data_size * size_t(width) +
10530  channel_offset_list[c] * static_cast<size_t>(width));
10531 
10532  float *outLine = reinterpret_cast<float *>(out_images[c]);
10533  if (line_order == 0) {
10534  outLine += (size_t(y) + v) * size_t(x_stride);
10535  }
10536  else {
10537  outLine +=
10538  (size_t(height) - 1 - (size_t(y) + v)) * size_t(x_stride);
10539  }
10540 
10541  if (reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(line_ptr + width) >
10542  (data_ptr + data_len)) {
10543  // Insufficient data size
10544  return false;
10545  }
10546 
10547  for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
10548  float val;
10549  tinyexr::cpy4(&val, line_ptr + u);
10550 
10551  tinyexr::swap4(reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(&val));
10552 
10553  outLine[u] = val;
10554  }
10555  }
10556  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_UINT) {
10557  const unsigned int *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<const unsigned int *>(
10558  data_ptr + v * pixel_data_size * size_t(width) +
10559  channel_offset_list[c] * static_cast<size_t>(width));
10560 
10561  unsigned int *outLine =
10562  reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(out_images[c]);
10563  if (line_order == 0) {
10564  outLine += (size_t(y) + v) * size_t(x_stride);
10565  }
10566  else {
10567  outLine +=
10568  (size_t(height) - 1 - (size_t(y) + v)) * size_t(x_stride);
10569  }
10570 
10571  for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
10572  if (reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(line_ptr + u) >=
10573  (data_ptr + data_len)) {
10574  // Corrupsed data?
10575  return false;
10576  }
10577 
10578  unsigned int val;
10579  tinyexr::cpy4(&val, line_ptr + u);
10580 
10581  tinyexr::swap4(reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(&val));
10582 
10583  outLine[u] = val;
10584  }
10585  }
10586  }
10587  }
10588  }
10589 
10590  return true;
10591  }
10592 
10593  static bool DecodeTiledPixelData(
10594  unsigned char **out_images, int *width, int *height,
10595  const int *requested_pixel_types, const unsigned char *data_ptr,
10596  size_t data_len, int compression_type, int line_order, int data_width,
10597  int data_height, int tile_offset_x, int tile_offset_y, int tile_size_x,
10598  int tile_size_y, size_t pixel_data_size, size_t num_attributes,
10599  const EXRAttribute *attributes, size_t num_channels,
10600  const EXRChannelInfo *channels,
10601  const std::vector<size_t> &channel_offset_list) {
10602  // Here, data_width and data_height are the dimensions of the current (sub)level.
10603  if (tile_size_x * tile_offset_x > data_width ||
10604  tile_size_y * tile_offset_y > data_height) {
10605  return false;
10606  }
10607 
10608  // Compute actual image size in a tile.
10609  if ((tile_offset_x + 1) * tile_size_x >= data_width) {
10610  (*width) = data_width - (tile_offset_x * tile_size_x);
10611  }
10612  else {
10613  (*width) = tile_size_x;
10614  }
10615 
10616  if ((tile_offset_y + 1) * tile_size_y >= data_height) {
10617  (*height) = data_height - (tile_offset_y * tile_size_y);
10618  }
10619  else {
10620  (*height) = tile_size_y;
10621  }
10622 
10623  // Image size = tile size.
10624  return DecodePixelData(out_images, requested_pixel_types, data_ptr, data_len,
10625  compression_type, line_order, (*width), tile_size_y,
10626  /* stride */ tile_size_x, /* y */ 0, /* line_no */ 0,
10627  (*height), pixel_data_size, num_attributes, attributes,
10628  num_channels, channels, channel_offset_list);
10629  }
10630 
10631  static bool ComputeChannelLayout(std::vector<size_t> *channel_offset_list,
10632  int *pixel_data_size, size_t *channel_offset,
10633  int num_channels,
10634  const EXRChannelInfo *channels) {
10635  channel_offset_list->resize(static_cast<size_t>(num_channels));
10636 
10637  (*pixel_data_size) = 0;
10638  (*channel_offset) = 0;
10639 
10640  for (size_t c = 0; c < static_cast<size_t>(num_channels); c++) {
10641  (*channel_offset_list)[c] = (*channel_offset);
10642  if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
10643  (*pixel_data_size) += sizeof(unsigned short);
10644  (*channel_offset) += sizeof(unsigned short);
10645  }
10646  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) {
10647  (*pixel_data_size) += sizeof(float);
10648  (*channel_offset) += sizeof(float);
10649  }
10650  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_UINT) {
10651  (*pixel_data_size) += sizeof(unsigned int);
10652  (*channel_offset) += sizeof(unsigned int);
10653  }
10654  else {
10655  // ???
10656  return false;
10657  }
10658  }
10659  return true;
10660  }
10661 
10662  static unsigned char **AllocateImage(int num_channels,
10663  const EXRChannelInfo *channels,
10664  const int *requested_pixel_types,
10665  int data_width, int data_height) {
10666  unsigned char **images =
10667  reinterpret_cast<unsigned char **>(static_cast<float **>(
10668  malloc(sizeof(float *) * static_cast<size_t>(num_channels))));
10669 
10670  for (size_t c = 0; c < static_cast<size_t>(num_channels); c++) {
10671  size_t data_len =
10672  static_cast<size_t>(data_width) * static_cast<size_t>(data_height);
10673  if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
10674  // pixel_data_size += sizeof(unsigned short);
10675  // channel_offset += sizeof(unsigned short);
10676  // Alloc internal image for half type.
10677  if (requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
10678  images[c] =
10679  reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(static_cast<unsigned short *>(
10680  malloc(sizeof(unsigned short) * data_len)));
10681  }
10682  else if (requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) {
10683  images[c] = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(
10684  static_cast<float *>(malloc(sizeof(float) * data_len)));
10685  }
10686  else {
10687  assert(0);
10688  }
10689  }
10690  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) {
10691  // pixel_data_size += sizeof(float);
10692  // channel_offset += sizeof(float);
10693  images[c] = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(
10694  static_cast<float *>(malloc(sizeof(float) * data_len)));
10695  }
10696  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_UINT) {
10697  // pixel_data_size += sizeof(unsigned int);
10698  // channel_offset += sizeof(unsigned int);
10699  images[c] = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(
10700  static_cast<unsigned int *>(malloc(sizeof(unsigned int) * data_len)));
10701  }
10702  else {
10703  assert(0);
10704  }
10705  }
10706 
10707  return images;
10708  }
10709 
10710 #ifdef _WIN32
10711  static inline std::wstring UTF8ToWchar(const std::string &str) {
10712  int wstr_size =
10713  MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, 0, str.data(), (int)str.size(), NULL, 0);
10714  std::wstring wstr(wstr_size, 0);
10715  MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, 0, str.data(), (int)str.size(), &wstr[0],
10716  (int)wstr.size());
10717  return wstr;
10718  }
10719 #endif
10720 
10721 
10722  static int ParseEXRHeader(HeaderInfo *info, bool *empty_header,
10723  const EXRVersion *version, std::string *err,
10724  const unsigned char *buf, size_t size) {
10725  const char *marker = reinterpret_cast<const char *>(&buf[0]);
10726 
10727  if (empty_header) {
10728  (*empty_header) = false;
10729  }
10730 
10731  if (version->multipart) {
10732  if (size > 0 && marker[0] == '\0') {
10733  // End of header list.
10734  if (empty_header) {
10735  (*empty_header) = true;
10736  }
10737  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
10738  }
10739  }
10740 
10741  // According to the spec, the header of every OpenEXR file must contain at
10742  // least the following attributes:
10743  //
10744  // channels chlist
10745  // compression compression
10746  // dataWindow box2i
10747  // displayWindow box2i
10748  // lineOrder lineOrder
10749  // pixelAspectRatio float
10750  // screenWindowCenter v2f
10751  // screenWindowWidth float
10752  bool has_channels = false;
10753  bool has_compression = false;
10754  bool has_data_window = false;
10755  bool has_display_window = false;
10756  bool has_line_order = false;
10757  bool has_pixel_aspect_ratio = false;
10758  bool has_screen_window_center = false;
10759  bool has_screen_window_width = false;
10760  bool has_name = false;
10761  bool has_type = false;
10762 
10763  info->name.clear();
10764  info->type.clear();
10765 
10766  info->data_window.min_x = 0;
10767  info->data_window.min_y = 0;
10768  info->data_window.max_x = 0;
10769  info->data_window.max_y = 0;
10770  info->line_order = 0; // @fixme
10771  info->display_window.min_x = 0;
10772  info->display_window.min_y = 0;
10773  info->display_window.max_x = 0;
10774  info->display_window.max_y = 0;
10775  info->screen_window_center[0] = 0.0f;
10776  info->screen_window_center[1] = 0.0f;
10777  info->screen_window_width = -1.0f;
10778  info->pixel_aspect_ratio = -1.0f;
10779 
10780  info->tiled = 0;
10781  info->tile_size_x = -1;
10782  info->tile_size_y = -1;
10783  info->tile_level_mode = -1;
10784  info->tile_rounding_mode = -1;
10785 
10786  info->attributes.clear();
10787 
10788  // Read attributes
10789  size_t orig_size = size;
10790  for (size_t nattr = 0; nattr < TINYEXR_MAX_HEADER_ATTRIBUTES; nattr++) {
10791  if (0 == size) {
10792  if (err) {
10793  (*err) += "Insufficient data size for attributes.\n";
10794  }
10795  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
10796  }
10797  else if (marker[0] == '\0') {
10798  size--;
10799  break;
10800  }
10801 
10802  std::string attr_name;
10803  std::string attr_type;
10804  std::vector<unsigned char> data;
10805  size_t marker_size;
10806  if (!tinyexr::ReadAttribute(&attr_name, &attr_type, &data, &marker_size,
10807  marker, size)) {
10808  if (err) {
10809  (*err) += "Failed to read attribute.\n";
10810  }
10811  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
10812  }
10813  marker += marker_size;
10814  size -= marker_size;
10815 
10816  // For a multipart file, the version field 9th bit is 0.
10817  if ((version->tiled || version->multipart || version->non_image) && attr_name.compare("tiles") == 0) {
10818  unsigned int x_size, y_size;
10819  unsigned char tile_mode;
10820  assert(data.size() == 9);
10821  memcpy(&x_size, &data.at(0), sizeof(int));
10822  memcpy(&y_size, &data.at(4), sizeof(int));
10823  tile_mode = data[8];
10824  tinyexr::swap4(&x_size);
10825  tinyexr::swap4(&y_size);
10826 
10827  if (x_size > static_cast<unsigned int>(std::numeric_limits<int>::max()) ||
10828  y_size > static_cast<unsigned int>(std::numeric_limits<int>::max())) {
10829  if (err) {
10830  (*err) = "Tile sizes were invalid.";
10831  }
10832  return TINYEXR_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT;
10833  }
10834 
10835  info->tile_size_x = static_cast<int>(x_size);
10836  info->tile_size_y = static_cast<int>(y_size);
10837 
10838  // mode = levelMode + roundingMode * 16
10839  info->tile_level_mode = tile_mode & 0x3;
10840  info->tile_rounding_mode = (tile_mode >> 4) & 0x1;
10841  info->tiled = 1;
10842  }
10843  else if (attr_name.compare("compression") == 0) {
10844  bool ok = false;
10845  if (data[0] < TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PIZ) {
10846  ok = true;
10847  }
10848 
10849  if (data[0] == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PIZ) {
10850 #if TINYEXR_USE_PIZ
10851  ok = true;
10852 #else
10853  if (err) {
10854  (*err) = "PIZ compression is not supported.";
10855  }
10856  return TINYEXR_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT;
10857 #endif
10858  }
10859 
10860  if (data[0] == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZFP) {
10861 #if TINYEXR_USE_ZFP
10862  ok = true;
10863 #else
10864  if (err) {
10865  (*err) = "ZFP compression is not supported.";
10866  }
10867  return TINYEXR_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT;
10868 #endif
10869  }
10870 
10871  if (!ok) {
10872  if (err) {
10873  (*err) = "Unknown compression type.";
10874  }
10875  return TINYEXR_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT;
10876  }
10877 
10878  info->compression_type = static_cast<int>(data[0]);
10879  has_compression = true;
10880 
10881  }
10882  else if (attr_name.compare("channels") == 0) {
10883  // name: zero-terminated string, from 1 to 255 bytes long
10884  // pixel type: int, possible values are: UINT = 0 HALF = 1 FLOAT = 2
10885  // pLinear: unsigned char, possible values are 0 and 1
10886  // reserved: three chars, should be zero
10887  // xSampling: int
10888  // ySampling: int
10889 
10890  if (!ReadChannelInfo(info->channels, data)) {
10891  if (err) {
10892  (*err) += "Failed to parse channel info.\n";
10893  }
10894  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
10895  }
10896 
10897  if (info->channels.size() < 1) {
10898  if (err) {
10899  (*err) += "# of channels is zero.\n";
10900  }
10901  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
10902  }
10903 
10904  has_channels = true;
10905 
10906  }
10907  else if (attr_name.compare("dataWindow") == 0) {
10908  if (data.size() >= 16) {
10909  memcpy(&info->data_window.min_x, &data.at(0), sizeof(int));
10910  memcpy(&info->data_window.min_y, &data.at(4), sizeof(int));
10911  memcpy(&info->data_window.max_x, &data.at(8), sizeof(int));
10912  memcpy(&info->data_window.max_y, &data.at(12), sizeof(int));
10913  tinyexr::swap4(&info->data_window.min_x);
10914  tinyexr::swap4(&info->data_window.min_y);
10915  tinyexr::swap4(&info->data_window.max_x);
10916  tinyexr::swap4(&info->data_window.max_y);
10917  has_data_window = true;
10918  }
10919  }
10920  else if (attr_name.compare("displayWindow") == 0) {
10921  if (data.size() >= 16) {
10922  memcpy(&info->display_window.min_x, &data.at(0), sizeof(int));
10923  memcpy(&info->display_window.min_y, &data.at(4), sizeof(int));
10924  memcpy(&info->display_window.max_x, &data.at(8), sizeof(int));
10925  memcpy(&info->display_window.max_y, &data.at(12), sizeof(int));
10926  tinyexr::swap4(&info->display_window.min_x);
10927  tinyexr::swap4(&info->display_window.min_y);
10928  tinyexr::swap4(&info->display_window.max_x);
10929  tinyexr::swap4(&info->display_window.max_y);
10930 
10931  has_display_window = true;
10932  }
10933  }
10934  else if (attr_name.compare("lineOrder") == 0) {
10935  if (data.size() >= 1) {
10936  info->line_order = static_cast<int>(data[0]);
10937  has_line_order = true;
10938  }
10939  }
10940  else if (attr_name.compare("pixelAspectRatio") == 0) {
10941  if (data.size() >= sizeof(float)) {
10942  memcpy(&info->pixel_aspect_ratio, &data.at(0), sizeof(float));
10943  tinyexr::swap4(&info->pixel_aspect_ratio);
10944  has_pixel_aspect_ratio = true;
10945  }
10946  }
10947  else if (attr_name.compare("screenWindowCenter") == 0) {
10948  if (data.size() >= 8) {
10949  memcpy(&info->screen_window_center[0], &data.at(0), sizeof(float));
10950  memcpy(&info->screen_window_center[1], &data.at(4), sizeof(float));
10951  tinyexr::swap4(&info->screen_window_center[0]);
10952  tinyexr::swap4(&info->screen_window_center[1]);
10953  has_screen_window_center = true;
10954  }
10955  }
10956  else if (attr_name.compare("screenWindowWidth") == 0) {
10957  if (data.size() >= sizeof(float)) {
10958  memcpy(&info->screen_window_width, &data.at(0), sizeof(float));
10959  tinyexr::swap4(&info->screen_window_width);
10960 
10961  has_screen_window_width = true;
10962  }
10963  }
10964  else if (attr_name.compare("chunkCount") == 0) {
10965  if (data.size() >= sizeof(int)) {
10966  memcpy(&info->chunk_count, &data.at(0), sizeof(int));
10967  tinyexr::swap4(&info->chunk_count);
10968  }
10969  }
10970  else if (attr_name.compare("name") == 0) {
10971  if (!data.empty() && data[0]) {
10972  data.push_back(0);
10973  size_t len = strlen(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(&data[0]));
10974  info->name.resize(len);
10975  info->name.assign(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(&data[0]), len);
10976  has_name = true;
10977  }
10978  }
10979  else if (attr_name.compare("type") == 0) {
10980  if (!data.empty() && data[0]) {
10981  data.push_back(0);
10982  size_t len = strlen(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(&data[0]));
10983  info->type.resize(len);
10984  info->type.assign(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(&data[0]), len);
10985  has_type = true;
10986  }
10987  }
10988  else {
10989  // Custom attribute(up to TINYEXR_MAX_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTES)
10990  if (info->attributes.size() < TINYEXR_MAX_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTES) {
10991  EXRAttribute attrib;
10992 #ifdef _MSC_VER
10993  strncpy_s(attrib.name, attr_name.c_str(), 255);
10994  strncpy_s(attrib.type, attr_type.c_str(), 255);
10995 #else
10996  strncpy(attrib.name, attr_name.c_str(), 255);
10997  strncpy(attrib.type, attr_type.c_str(), 255);
10998 #endif
10999  attrib.name[255] = '\0';
11000  attrib.type[255] = '\0';
11001  attrib.size = static_cast<int>(data.size());
11002  attrib.value = static_cast<unsigned char *>(malloc(data.size()));
11003  memcpy(reinterpret_cast<char *>(attrib.value), &data.at(0),
11004  data.size());
11005  info->attributes.push_back(attrib);
11006  }
11007  }
11008  }
11009 
11010  // Check if required attributes exist
11011  {
11012  std::stringstream ss_err;
11013 
11014  if (!has_compression) {
11015  ss_err << "\"compression\" attribute not found in the header."
11016  << std::endl;
11017  }
11018 
11019  if (!has_channels) {
11020  ss_err << "\"channels\" attribute not found in the header." << std::endl;
11021  }
11022 
11023  if (!has_line_order) {
11024  ss_err << "\"lineOrder\" attribute not found in the header." << std::endl;
11025  }
11026 
11027  if (!has_display_window) {
11028  ss_err << "\"displayWindow\" attribute not found in the header."
11029  << std::endl;
11030  }
11031 
11032  if (!has_data_window) {
11033  ss_err << "\"dataWindow\" attribute not found in the header or invalid."
11034  << std::endl;
11035  }
11036 
11037  if (!has_pixel_aspect_ratio) {
11038  ss_err << "\"pixelAspectRatio\" attribute not found in the header."
11039  << std::endl;
11040  }
11041 
11042  if (!has_screen_window_width) {
11043  ss_err << "\"screenWindowWidth\" attribute not found in the header."
11044  << std::endl;
11045  }
11046 
11047  if (!has_screen_window_center) {
11048  ss_err << "\"screenWindowCenter\" attribute not found in the header."
11049  << std::endl;
11050  }
11051 
11052  if (version->multipart || version->non_image) {
11053  if (!has_name) {
11054  ss_err << "\"name\" attribute not found in the header."
11055  << std::endl;
11056  }
11057  if (!has_type) {
11058  ss_err << "\"type\" attribute not found in the header."
11059  << std::endl;
11060  }
11061  }
11062 
11063  if (!(ss_err.str().empty())) {
11064  if (err) {
11065  (*err) += ss_err.str();
11066  }
11067  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_HEADER;
11068  }
11069  }
11070 
11071  info->header_len = static_cast<unsigned int>(orig_size - size);
11072 
11073  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
11074  }
11075 
11076  // C++ HeaderInfo to C EXRHeader conversion.
11077  static void ConvertHeader(EXRHeader *exr_header, const HeaderInfo &info) {
11078  exr_header->pixel_aspect_ratio = info.pixel_aspect_ratio;
11079  exr_header->screen_window_center[0] = info.screen_window_center[0];
11080  exr_header->screen_window_center[1] = info.screen_window_center[1];
11081  exr_header->screen_window_width = info.screen_window_width;
11082  exr_header->chunk_count = info.chunk_count;
11083  exr_header->display_window.min_x = info.display_window.min_x;
11084  exr_header->display_window.min_y = info.display_window.min_y;
11085  exr_header->display_window.max_x = info.display_window.max_x;
11086  exr_header->display_window.max_y = info.display_window.max_y;
11087  exr_header->data_window.min_x = info.data_window.min_x;
11088  exr_header->data_window.min_y = info.data_window.min_y;
11089  exr_header->data_window.max_x = info.data_window.max_x;
11090  exr_header->data_window.max_y = info.data_window.max_y;
11091  exr_header->line_order = info.line_order;
11092  exr_header->compression_type = info.compression_type;
11093  exr_header->tiled = info.tiled;
11094  exr_header->tile_size_x = info.tile_size_x;
11095  exr_header->tile_size_y = info.tile_size_y;
11096  exr_header->tile_level_mode = info.tile_level_mode;
11097  exr_header->tile_rounding_mode = info.tile_rounding_mode;
11098 
11099  EXRSetNameAttr(exr_header, info.name.c_str());
11100 
11101  if (!info.type.empty()) {
11102  if (info.type == "scanlineimage") {
11103  assert(!exr_header->tiled);
11104  }
11105  else if (info.type == "tiledimage") {
11106  assert(exr_header->tiled);
11107  }
11108  else if (info.type == "deeptile") {
11109  exr_header->non_image = 1;
11110  assert(exr_header->tiled);
11111  }
11112  else if (info.type == "deepscanline") {
11113  exr_header->non_image = 1;
11114  assert(!exr_header->tiled);
11115  }
11116  else {
11117  assert(false);
11118  }
11119  }
11120 
11121  exr_header->num_channels = static_cast<int>(info.channels.size());
11122 
11123  exr_header->channels = static_cast<EXRChannelInfo *>(malloc(
11124  sizeof(EXRChannelInfo) * static_cast<size_t>(exr_header->num_channels)));
11125  for (size_t c = 0; c < static_cast<size_t>(exr_header->num_channels); c++) {
11126 #ifdef _MSC_VER
11127  strncpy_s(exr_header->channels[c].name, info.channels[c].name.c_str(), 255);
11128 #else
11129  strncpy(exr_header->channels[c].name, info.channels[c].name.c_str(), 255);
11130 #endif
11131  // manually add '\0' for safety.
11132  exr_header->channels[c].name[255] = '\0';
11133 
11134  exr_header->channels[c].pixel_type = info.channels[c].pixel_type;
11135  exr_header->channels[c].p_linear = info.channels[c].p_linear;
11136  exr_header->channels[c].x_sampling = info.channels[c].x_sampling;
11137  exr_header->channels[c].y_sampling = info.channels[c].y_sampling;
11138  }
11139 
11140  exr_header->pixel_types = static_cast<int *>(
11141  malloc(sizeof(int) * static_cast<size_t>(exr_header->num_channels)));
11142  for (size_t c = 0; c < static_cast<size_t>(exr_header->num_channels); c++) {
11143  exr_header->pixel_types[c] = info.channels[c].pixel_type;
11144  }
11145 
11146  // Initially fill with values of `pixel_types`
11147  exr_header->requested_pixel_types = static_cast<int *>(
11148  malloc(sizeof(int) * static_cast<size_t>(exr_header->num_channels)));
11149  for (size_t c = 0; c < static_cast<size_t>(exr_header->num_channels); c++) {
11150  exr_header->requested_pixel_types[c] = info.channels[c].pixel_type;
11151  }
11152 
11153  exr_header->num_custom_attributes = static_cast<int>(info.attributes.size());
11154 
11155  if (exr_header->num_custom_attributes > 0) {
11156  // TODO(syoyo): Report warning when # of attributes exceeds
11157  // `TINYEXR_MAX_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTES`
11158  if (exr_header->num_custom_attributes > TINYEXR_MAX_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTES) {
11159  exr_header->num_custom_attributes = TINYEXR_MAX_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTES;
11160  }
11161 
11162  exr_header->custom_attributes = static_cast<EXRAttribute *>(malloc(
11163  sizeof(EXRAttribute) * size_t(exr_header->num_custom_attributes)));
11164 
11165  for (size_t i = 0; i < info.attributes.size(); i++) {
11166  memcpy(exr_header->custom_attributes[i].name, info.attributes[i].name,
11167  256);
11168  memcpy(exr_header->custom_attributes[i].type, info.attributes[i].type,
11169  256);
11170  exr_header->custom_attributes[i].size = info.attributes[i].size;
11171  // Just copy pointer
11172  exr_header->custom_attributes[i].value = info.attributes[i].value;
11173  }
11174 
11175  }
11176  else {
11177  exr_header->custom_attributes = NULL;
11178  }
11179 
11180  exr_header->header_len = info.header_len;
11181  }
11182 
11183  struct OffsetData {
11184  OffsetData() : num_x_levels(0), num_y_levels(0) {}
11185  std::vector<std::vector<std::vector <tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64> > > offsets;
11186  int num_x_levels;
11187  int num_y_levels;
11188  };
11189 
11190  int LevelIndex(int lx, int ly, int tile_level_mode, int num_x_levels) {
11191  switch (tile_level_mode) {
11192  case TINYEXR_TILE_ONE_LEVEL:
11193  return 0;
11194 
11195  case TINYEXR_TILE_MIPMAP_LEVELS:
11196  return lx;
11197 
11198  case TINYEXR_TILE_RIPMAP_LEVELS:
11199  return lx + ly * num_x_levels;
11200 
11201  default:
11202  assert(false);
11203  }
11204  return 0;
11205  }
11206 
11207  static int LevelSize(int toplevel_size, int level, int tile_rounding_mode) {
11208  assert(level >= 0);
11209 
11210  int b = (int)(1u << (unsigned)level);
11211  int level_size = toplevel_size / b;
11212 
11213  if (tile_rounding_mode == TINYEXR_TILE_ROUND_UP && level_size * b < toplevel_size)
11214  level_size += 1;
11215 
11216  return std::max(level_size, 1);
11217  }
11218 
11219  static int DecodeTiledLevel(EXRImage* exr_image, const EXRHeader* exr_header,
11220  const OffsetData& offset_data,
11221  const std::vector<size_t>& channel_offset_list,
11222  int pixel_data_size,
11223  const unsigned char* head, const size_t size,
11224  std::string* err) {
11225  int num_channels = exr_header->num_channels;
11226 
11227  int level_index = LevelIndex(exr_image->level_x, exr_image->level_y, exr_header->tile_level_mode, offset_data.num_x_levels);
11228  int num_y_tiles = (int)offset_data.offsets[level_index].size();
11229  assert(num_y_tiles);
11230  int num_x_tiles = (int)offset_data.offsets[level_index][0].size();
11231  assert(num_x_tiles);
11232  int num_tiles = num_x_tiles * num_y_tiles;
11233 
11234  int err_code = TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
11235 
11236  enum {
11237  EF_SUCCESS = 0,
11238  EF_INVALID_DATA = 1,
11239  EF_INSUFFICIENT_DATA = 2,
11240  EF_FAILED_TO_DECODE = 4
11241  };
11242 #if TINYEXR_HAS_CXX11 && (TINYEXR_USE_THREAD > 0)
11243  std::atomic<unsigned> error_flag(EF_SUCCESS);
11244 #else
11245  unsigned error_flag(EF_SUCCESS);
11246 #endif
11247 
11248  // Although the spec says : "...the data window is subdivided into an array of smaller rectangles...",
11249  // the IlmImf library allows the dimensions of the tile to be larger (or equal) than the dimensions of the data window.
11250 #if 0
11251  if ((exr_header->tile_size_x > exr_image->width || exr_header->tile_size_y > exr_image->height) &&
11252  exr_image->level_x == 0 && exr_image->level_y == 0) {
11253  if (err) {
11254  (*err) += "Failed to decode tile data.\n";
11255  }
11256  err_code = TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
11257  }
11258 #endif
11259  exr_image->tiles = static_cast<EXRTile*>(
11260  calloc(sizeof(EXRTile), static_cast<size_t>(num_tiles)));
11261 
11262 #if TINYEXR_HAS_CXX11 && (TINYEXR_USE_THREAD > 0)
11263  std::vector<std::thread> workers;
11264  std::atomic<int> tile_count(0);
11265 
11266  int num_threads = std::max(1, int(std::thread::hardware_concurrency()));
11267  if (num_threads > int(num_tiles)) {
11268  num_threads = int(num_tiles);
11269  }
11270 
11271  for (int t = 0; t < num_threads; t++) {
11272  workers.emplace_back(std::thread([&]()
11273  {
11274  int tile_idx = 0;
11275  while ((tile_idx = tile_count++) < num_tiles) {
11276 
11277 #else
11278 #if TINYEXR_USE_OPENMP
11279 #pragma omp parallel for
11280 #endif
11281  for (int tile_idx = 0; tile_idx < num_tiles; tile_idx++) {
11282 #endif
11283  // Allocate memory for each tile.
11284  exr_image->tiles[tile_idx].images = tinyexr::AllocateImage(
11285  num_channels, exr_header->channels,
11286  exr_header->requested_pixel_types, exr_header->tile_size_x,
11287  exr_header->tile_size_y);
11288 
11289  int x_tile = tile_idx % num_x_tiles;
11290  int y_tile = tile_idx / num_x_tiles;
11291  // 16 byte: tile coordinates
11292  // 4 byte : data size
11293  // ~ : data(uncompressed or compressed)
11294  tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 offset = offset_data.offsets[level_index][y_tile][x_tile];
11295  if (offset + sizeof(int) * 5 > size) {
11296  // Insufficient data size.
11297  error_flag |= EF_INSUFFICIENT_DATA;
11298  continue;
11299  }
11300 
11301  size_t data_size =
11302  size_t(size - (offset + sizeof(int) * 5));
11303  const unsigned char* data_ptr =
11304  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char*>(head + offset);
11305 
11306  int tile_coordinates[4];
11307  memcpy(tile_coordinates, data_ptr, sizeof(int) * 4);
11308  tinyexr::swap4(&tile_coordinates[0]);
11309  tinyexr::swap4(&tile_coordinates[1]);
11310  tinyexr::swap4(&tile_coordinates[2]);
11311  tinyexr::swap4(&tile_coordinates[3]);
11312 
11313  if (tile_coordinates[2] != exr_image->level_x) {
11314  // Invalid data.
11315  error_flag |= EF_INVALID_DATA;
11316  continue;
11317  }
11318  if (tile_coordinates[3] != exr_image->level_y) {
11319  // Invalid data.
11320  error_flag |= EF_INVALID_DATA;
11321  continue;
11322  }
11323 
11324  int data_len;
11325  memcpy(&data_len, data_ptr + 16,
11326  sizeof(int)); // 16 = sizeof(tile_coordinates)
11327  tinyexr::swap4(&data_len);
11328 
11329  if (data_len < 2 || size_t(data_len) > data_size) {
11330  // Insufficient data size.
11331  error_flag |= EF_INSUFFICIENT_DATA;
11332  continue;
11333  }
11334 
11335  // Move to data addr: 20 = 16 + 4;
11336  data_ptr += 20;
11337  bool ret = tinyexr::DecodeTiledPixelData(
11338  exr_image->tiles[tile_idx].images,
11339  &(exr_image->tiles[tile_idx].width),
11340  &(exr_image->tiles[tile_idx].height),
11341  exr_header->requested_pixel_types, data_ptr,
11342  static_cast<size_t>(data_len), exr_header->compression_type,
11343  exr_header->line_order,
11344  exr_image->width, exr_image->height,
11345  tile_coordinates[0], tile_coordinates[1], exr_header->tile_size_x,
11346  exr_header->tile_size_y, static_cast<size_t>(pixel_data_size),
11347  static_cast<size_t>(exr_header->num_custom_attributes),
11348  exr_header->custom_attributes,
11349  static_cast<size_t>(exr_header->num_channels),
11350  exr_header->channels, channel_offset_list);
11351 
11352  if (!ret) {
11353  // Failed to decode tile data.
11354  error_flag |= EF_FAILED_TO_DECODE;
11355  }
11356 
11357  exr_image->tiles[tile_idx].offset_x = tile_coordinates[0];
11358  exr_image->tiles[tile_idx].offset_y = tile_coordinates[1];
11359  exr_image->tiles[tile_idx].level_x = tile_coordinates[2];
11360  exr_image->tiles[tile_idx].level_y = tile_coordinates[3];
11361 
11362 #if TINYEXR_HAS_CXX11 && (TINYEXR_USE_THREAD > 0)
11363  }
11364  }));
11365  } // num_thread loop
11366 
11367 for (auto& t : workers) {
11368  t.join();
11369 }
11370 
11371 #else
11372  } // parallel for
11373 #endif
11374 
11375  // Even in the event of an error, the reserved memory may be freed.
11376  exr_image->num_channels = num_channels;
11377  exr_image->num_tiles = static_cast<int>(num_tiles);
11378 
11379  if (error_flag) err_code = TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
11380  if (err) {
11381  if (error_flag & EF_INSUFFICIENT_DATA) {
11382  (*err) += "Insufficient data length.\n";
11383  }
11384  if (error_flag & EF_FAILED_TO_DECODE) {
11385  (*err) += "Failed to decode tile data.\n";
11386  }
11387  }
11388  return err_code;
11389  }
11390 
11391  static int DecodeChunk(EXRImage *exr_image, const EXRHeader *exr_header,
11392  const OffsetData& offset_data,
11393  const unsigned char *head, const size_t size,
11394  std::string *err) {
11395  int num_channels = exr_header->num_channels;
11396 
11397  int num_scanline_blocks = 1;
11398  if (exr_header->compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIP) {
11399  num_scanline_blocks = 16;
11400  }
11401  else if (exr_header->compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PIZ) {
11402  num_scanline_blocks = 32;
11403  }
11404  else if (exr_header->compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZFP) {
11405  num_scanline_blocks = 16;
11406 
11407 #if TINYEXR_USE_ZFP
11408  tinyexr::ZFPCompressionParam zfp_compression_param;
11409  if (!FindZFPCompressionParam(&zfp_compression_param,
11410  exr_header->custom_attributes,
11411  int(exr_header->num_custom_attributes), err)) {
11412  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_HEADER;
11413  }
11414 #endif
11415  }
11416 
11417  if (exr_header->data_window.max_x < exr_header->data_window.min_x ||
11418  exr_header->data_window.max_y < exr_header->data_window.min_y) {
11419  if (err) {
11420  (*err) += "Invalid data window.\n";
11421  }
11422  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
11423  }
11424 
11425  int data_width =
11426  exr_header->data_window.max_x - exr_header->data_window.min_x + 1;
11427  int data_height =
11428  exr_header->data_window.max_y - exr_header->data_window.min_y + 1;
11429 
11430  // Do not allow too large data_width and data_height. header invalid?
11431  {
11432  if ((data_width > TINYEXR_DIMENSION_THRESHOLD) || (data_height > TINYEXR_DIMENSION_THRESHOLD)) {
11433  if (err) {
11434  std::stringstream ss;
11435  ss << "data_with or data_height too large. data_width: " << data_width
11436  << ", "
11437  << "data_height = " << data_height << std::endl;
11438  (*err) += ss.str();
11439  }
11440  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
11441  }
11442  if (exr_header->tiled) {
11443  if ((exr_header->tile_size_x > TINYEXR_DIMENSION_THRESHOLD) || (exr_header->tile_size_y > TINYEXR_DIMENSION_THRESHOLD)) {
11444  if (err) {
11445  std::stringstream ss;
11446  ss << "tile with or tile height too large. tile width: " << exr_header->tile_size_x
11447  << ", "
11448  << "tile height = " << exr_header->tile_size_y << std::endl;
11449  (*err) += ss.str();
11450  }
11451  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
11452  }
11453  }
11454  }
11455 
11456  const std::vector<tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64>& offsets = offset_data.offsets[0][0];
11457  size_t num_blocks = offsets.size();
11458 
11459  std::vector<size_t> channel_offset_list;
11460  int pixel_data_size = 0;
11461  size_t channel_offset = 0;
11462  if (!tinyexr::ComputeChannelLayout(&channel_offset_list, &pixel_data_size,
11463  &channel_offset, num_channels,
11464  exr_header->channels)) {
11465  if (err) {
11466  (*err) += "Failed to compute channel layout.\n";
11467  }
11468  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
11469  }
11470 
11471 #if TINYEXR_HAS_CXX11 && (TINYEXR_USE_THREAD > 0)
11472  std::atomic<bool> invalid_data(false);
11473 #else
11474  bool invalid_data(false);
11475 #endif
11476 
11477  if (exr_header->tiled) {
11478  // value check
11479  if (exr_header->tile_size_x < 0) {
11480  if (err) {
11481  std::stringstream ss;
11482  ss << "Invalid tile size x : " << exr_header->tile_size_x << "\n";
11483  (*err) += ss.str();
11484  }
11485  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_HEADER;
11486  }
11487 
11488  if (exr_header->tile_size_y < 0) {
11489  if (err) {
11490  std::stringstream ss;
11491  ss << "Invalid tile size y : " << exr_header->tile_size_y << "\n";
11492  (*err) += ss.str();
11493  }
11494  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_HEADER;
11495  }
11496  if (exr_header->tile_level_mode != TINYEXR_TILE_RIPMAP_LEVELS) {
11497  EXRImage* level_image = NULL;
11498  for (int level = 0; level < offset_data.num_x_levels; ++level) {
11499  if (!level_image) {
11500  level_image = exr_image;
11501  }
11502  else {
11503  level_image->next_level = new EXRImage;
11504  InitEXRImage(level_image->next_level);
11505  level_image = level_image->next_level;
11506  }
11507  level_image->width =
11508  LevelSize(exr_header->data_window.max_x - exr_header->data_window.min_x + 1, level, exr_header->tile_rounding_mode);
11509  level_image->height =
11510  LevelSize(exr_header->data_window.max_y - exr_header->data_window.min_y + 1, level, exr_header->tile_rounding_mode);
11511  level_image->level_x = level;
11512  level_image->level_y = level;
11513 
11514  int ret = DecodeTiledLevel(level_image, exr_header,
