11515  offset_data,
11516  channel_offset_list,
11517  pixel_data_size,
11518  head, size,
11519  err);
11520  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) return ret;
11521  }
11522  }
11523  else {
11524  EXRImage* level_image = NULL;
11525  for (int level_y = 0; level_y < offset_data.num_y_levels; ++level_y)
11526  for (int level_x = 0; level_x < offset_data.num_x_levels; ++level_x) {
11527  if (!level_image) {
11528  level_image = exr_image;
11529  }
11530  else {
11531  level_image->next_level = new EXRImage;
11532  InitEXRImage(level_image->next_level);
11533  level_image = level_image->next_level;
11534  }
11535 
11536  level_image->width =
11537  LevelSize(exr_header->data_window.max_x - exr_header->data_window.min_x + 1, level_x, exr_header->tile_rounding_mode);
11538  level_image->height =
11539  LevelSize(exr_header->data_window.max_y - exr_header->data_window.min_y + 1, level_y, exr_header->tile_rounding_mode);
11540  level_image->level_x = level_x;
11541  level_image->level_y = level_y;
11542 
11543  int ret = DecodeTiledLevel(level_image, exr_header,
11544  offset_data,
11545  channel_offset_list,
11546  pixel_data_size,
11547  head, size,
11548  err);
11549  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) return ret;
11550  }
11551  }
11552  }
11553  else { // scanline format
11554  // Don't allow too large image(256GB * pixel_data_size or more). Workaround
11555  // for #104.
11556  size_t total_data_len =
11557  size_t(data_width) * size_t(data_height) * size_t(num_channels);
11558  const bool total_data_len_overflown =
11559  sizeof(void *) == 8 ? (total_data_len >= 0x4000000000) : false;
11560  if ((total_data_len == 0) || total_data_len_overflown) {
11561  if (err) {
11562  std::stringstream ss;
11563  ss << "Image data size is zero or too large: width = " << data_width
11564  << ", height = " << data_height << ", channels = " << num_channels
11565  << std::endl;
11566  (*err) += ss.str();
11567  }
11568  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
11569  }
11570 
11571  exr_image->images = tinyexr::AllocateImage(
11572  num_channels, exr_header->channels, exr_header->requested_pixel_types,
11573  data_width, data_height);
11574 
11575 #if TINYEXR_HAS_CXX11 && (TINYEXR_USE_THREAD > 0)
11576  std::vector<std::thread> workers;
11577  std::atomic<int> y_count(0);
11578 
11579  int num_threads = std::max(1, int(std::thread::hardware_concurrency()));
11580  if (num_threads > int(num_blocks)) {
11581  num_threads = int(num_blocks);
11582  }
11583 
11584  for (int t = 0; t < num_threads; t++) {
11585  workers.emplace_back(std::thread([&]() {
11586  int y = 0;
11587  while ((y = y_count++) < int(num_blocks)) {
11588 
11589 #else
11590 
11591 #if TINYEXR_USE_OPENMP
11592 #pragma omp parallel for
11593 #endif
11594  for (int y = 0; y < static_cast<int>(num_blocks); y++) {
11595 
11596 #endif
11597  size_t y_idx = static_cast<size_t>(y);
11598 
11599  if (offsets[y_idx] + sizeof(int) * 2 > size) {
11600  invalid_data = true;
11601  }
11602  else {
11603  // 4 byte: scan line
11604  // 4 byte: data size
11605  // ~ : pixel data(uncompressed or compressed)
11606  size_t data_size =
11607  size_t(size - (offsets[y_idx] + sizeof(int) * 2));
11608  const unsigned char *data_ptr =
11609  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(head + offsets[y_idx]);
11610 
11611  int line_no;
11612  memcpy(&line_no, data_ptr, sizeof(int));
11613  int data_len;
11614  memcpy(&data_len, data_ptr + 4, sizeof(int));
11615  tinyexr::swap4(&line_no);
11616  tinyexr::swap4(&data_len);
11617 
11618  if (size_t(data_len) > data_size) {
11619  invalid_data = true;
11620 
11621  }
11622  else if ((line_no > (2 << 20)) || (line_no < -(2 << 20))) {
11623  // Too large value. Assume this is invalid
11624  // 2**20 = 1048576 = heuristic value.
11625  invalid_data = true;
11626  }
11627  else if (data_len == 0) {
11628  // TODO(syoyo): May be ok to raise the threshold for example
11629  // `data_len < 4`
11630  invalid_data = true;
11631  }
11632  else {
11633  // line_no may be negative.
11634  int end_line_no = (std::min)(line_no + num_scanline_blocks,
11635  (exr_header->data_window.max_y + 1));
11636 
11637  int num_lines = end_line_no - line_no;
11638 
11639  if (num_lines <= 0) {
11640  invalid_data = true;
11641  }
11642  else {
11643  // Move to data addr: 8 = 4 + 4;
11644  data_ptr += 8;
11645 
11646  // Adjust line_no with data_window.bmin.y
11647 
11648  // overflow check
11649  tinyexr_int64 lno =
11650  static_cast<tinyexr_int64>(line_no) -
11651  static_cast<tinyexr_int64>(exr_header->data_window.min_y);
11652  if (lno > std::numeric_limits<int>::max()) {
11653  line_no = -1; // invalid
11654  }
11655  else if (lno < -std::numeric_limits<int>::max()) {
11656  line_no = -1; // invalid
11657  }
11658  else {
11659  line_no -= exr_header->data_window.min_y;
11660  }
11661 
11662  if (line_no < 0) {
11663  invalid_data = true;
11664  }
11665  else {
11666  if (!tinyexr::DecodePixelData(
11667  exr_image->images, exr_header->requested_pixel_types,
11668  data_ptr, static_cast<size_t>(data_len),
11669  exr_header->compression_type, exr_header->line_order,
11670  data_width, data_height, data_width, y, line_no,
11671  num_lines, static_cast<size_t>(pixel_data_size),
11672  static_cast<size_t>(
11673  exr_header->num_custom_attributes),
11674  exr_header->custom_attributes,
11675  static_cast<size_t>(exr_header->num_channels),
11676  exr_header->channels, channel_offset_list)) {
11677  invalid_data = true;
11678  }
11679  }
11680  }
11681  }
11682  }
11683 
11684 #if TINYEXR_HAS_CXX11 && (TINYEXR_USE_THREAD > 0)
11685  }
11686  }));
11687  }
11688 
11689  for (auto &t : workers) {
11690  t.join();
11691  }
11692 #else
11693  } // omp parallel
11694 #endif
11695  }
11696 
11697  if (invalid_data) {
11698  if (err) {
11699  std::stringstream ss;
11700  (*err) += "Invalid data found when decoding pixels.\n";
11701  }
11702  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
11703  }
11704 
11705  // Overwrite `pixel_type` with `requested_pixel_type`.
11706  {
11707  for (int c = 0; c < exr_header->num_channels; c++) {
11708  exr_header->pixel_types[c] = exr_header->requested_pixel_types[c];
11709  }
11710  }
11711 
11712  {
11713  exr_image->num_channels = num_channels;
11714 
11715  exr_image->width = data_width;
11716  exr_image->height = data_height;
11717  }
11718 
11719  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
11720  }
11721 
11722  static bool ReconstructLineOffsets(
11723  std::vector<tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64> *offsets, size_t n,
11724  const unsigned char *head, const unsigned char *marker, const size_t size) {
11725  assert(head < marker);
11726  assert(offsets->size() == n);
11727 
11728  for (size_t i = 0; i < n; i++) {
11729  size_t offset = static_cast<size_t>(marker - head);
11730  // Offset should not exceed whole EXR file/data size.
11731  if ((offset + sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64)) >= size) {
11732  return false;
11733  }
11734 
11735  int y;
11736  unsigned int data_len;
11737 
11738  memcpy(&y, marker, sizeof(int));
11739  memcpy(&data_len, marker + 4, sizeof(unsigned int));
11740 
11741  if (data_len >= size) {
11742  return false;
11743  }
11744 
11745  tinyexr::swap4(&y);
11746  tinyexr::swap4(&data_len);
11747 
11748  (*offsets)[i] = offset;
11749 
11750  marker += data_len + 8; // 8 = 4 bytes(y) + 4 bytes(data_len)
11751  }
11752 
11753  return true;
11754  }
11755 
11756 
11757  static int FloorLog2(unsigned x) {
11758  //
11759  // For x > 0, floorLog2(y) returns floor(log(x)/log(2)).
11760  //
11761  int y = 0;
11762  while (x > 1) {
11763  y += 1;
11764  x >>= 1u;
11765  }
11766  return y;
11767  }
11768 
11769 
11770  static int CeilLog2(unsigned x) {
11771  //
11772  // For x > 0, ceilLog2(y) returns ceil(log(x)/log(2)).
11773  //
11774  int y = 0;
11775  int r = 0;
11776  while (x > 1) {
11777  if (x & 1)
11778  r = 1;
11779 
11780  y += 1;
11781  x >>= 1u;
11782  }
11783  return y + r;
11784  }
11785 
11786  static int RoundLog2(int x, int tile_rounding_mode) {
11787  return (tile_rounding_mode == TINYEXR_TILE_ROUND_DOWN) ? FloorLog2(static_cast<unsigned>(x)) : CeilLog2(static_cast<unsigned>(x));
11788  }
11789 
11790  static int CalculateNumXLevels(const EXRHeader* exr_header) {
11791  int min_x = exr_header->data_window.min_x;
11792  int max_x = exr_header->data_window.max_x;
11793  int min_y = exr_header->data_window.min_y;
11794  int max_y = exr_header->data_window.max_y;
11795 
11796  int num = 0;
11797  switch (exr_header->tile_level_mode) {
11798  case TINYEXR_TILE_ONE_LEVEL:
11799 
11800  num = 1;
11801  break;
11802 
11803  case TINYEXR_TILE_MIPMAP_LEVELS:
11804 
11805  {
11806  int w = max_x - min_x + 1;
11807  int h = max_y - min_y + 1;
11808  num = RoundLog2(std::max(w, h), exr_header->tile_rounding_mode) + 1;
11809  }
11810  break;
11811 
11812  case TINYEXR_TILE_RIPMAP_LEVELS:
11813 
11814  {
11815  int w = max_x - min_x + 1;
11816  num = RoundLog2(w, exr_header->tile_rounding_mode) + 1;
11817  }
11818  break;
11819 
11820  default:
11821 
11822  assert(false);
11823  }
11824 
11825  return num;
11826  }
11827 
11828  static int CalculateNumYLevels(const EXRHeader* exr_header) {
11829  int min_x = exr_header->data_window.min_x;
11830  int max_x = exr_header->data_window.max_x;
11831  int min_y = exr_header->data_window.min_y;
11832  int max_y = exr_header->data_window.max_y;
11833  int num = 0;
11834 
11835  switch (exr_header->tile_level_mode) {
11836  case TINYEXR_TILE_ONE_LEVEL:
11837 
11838  num = 1;
11839  break;
11840 
11841  case TINYEXR_TILE_MIPMAP_LEVELS:
11842 
11843  {
11844  int w = max_x - min_x + 1;
11845  int h = max_y - min_y + 1;
11846  num = RoundLog2(std::max(w, h), exr_header->tile_rounding_mode) + 1;
11847  }
11848  break;
11849 
11850  case TINYEXR_TILE_RIPMAP_LEVELS:
11851 
11852  {
11853  int h = max_y - min_y + 1;
11854  num = RoundLog2(h, exr_header->tile_rounding_mode) + 1;
11855  }
11856  break;
11857 
11858  default:
11859 
11860  assert(false);
11861  }
11862 
11863  return num;
11864  }
11865 
11866  static void CalculateNumTiles(std::vector<int>& numTiles,
11867  int toplevel_size,
11868  int size,
11869  int tile_rounding_mode) {
11870  for (unsigned i = 0; i < numTiles.size(); i++) {
11871  int l = LevelSize(toplevel_size, i, tile_rounding_mode);
11872  assert(l <= std::numeric_limits<int>::max() - size + 1);
11873 
11874  numTiles[i] = (l + size - 1) / size;
11875  }
11876  }
11877 
11878  static void PrecalculateTileInfo(std::vector<int>& num_x_tiles,
11879  std::vector<int>& num_y_tiles,
11880  const EXRHeader* exr_header) {
11881  int min_x = exr_header->data_window.min_x;
11882  int max_x = exr_header->data_window.max_x;
11883  int min_y = exr_header->data_window.min_y;
11884  int max_y = exr_header->data_window.max_y;
11885 
11886  int num_x_levels = CalculateNumXLevels(exr_header);
11887  int num_y_levels = CalculateNumYLevels(exr_header);
11888 
11889  num_x_tiles.resize(num_x_levels);
11890  num_y_tiles.resize(num_y_levels);
11891 
11892  CalculateNumTiles(num_x_tiles,
11893  max_x - min_x + 1,
11894  exr_header->tile_size_x,
11895  exr_header->tile_rounding_mode);
11896 
11897  CalculateNumTiles(num_y_tiles,
11898  max_y - min_y + 1,
11899  exr_header->tile_size_y,
11900  exr_header->tile_rounding_mode);
11901  }
11902 
11903  static void InitSingleResolutionOffsets(OffsetData& offset_data, size_t num_blocks) {
11904  offset_data.offsets.resize(1);
11905  offset_data.offsets[0].resize(1);
11906  offset_data.offsets[0][0].resize(num_blocks);
11907  offset_data.num_x_levels = 1;
11908  offset_data.num_y_levels = 1;
11909  }
11910 
11911  // Return sum of tile blocks.
11912  static int InitTileOffsets(OffsetData& offset_data,
11913  const EXRHeader* exr_header,
11914  const std::vector<int>& num_x_tiles,
11915  const std::vector<int>& num_y_tiles) {
11916  int num_tile_blocks = 0;
11917  offset_data.num_x_levels = static_cast<int>(num_x_tiles.size());
11918  offset_data.num_y_levels = static_cast<int>(num_y_tiles.size());
11919  switch (exr_header->tile_level_mode) {
11920  case TINYEXR_TILE_ONE_LEVEL:
11921  case TINYEXR_TILE_MIPMAP_LEVELS:
11922  assert(offset_data.num_x_levels == offset_data.num_y_levels);
11923  offset_data.offsets.resize(offset_data.num_x_levels);
11924 
11925  for (unsigned int l = 0; l < offset_data.offsets.size(); ++l) {
11926  offset_data.offsets[l].resize(num_y_tiles[l]);
11927 
11928  for (unsigned int dy = 0; dy < offset_data.offsets[l].size(); ++dy) {
11929  offset_data.offsets[l][dy].resize(num_x_tiles[l]);
11930  num_tile_blocks += num_x_tiles[l];
11931  }
11932  }
11933  break;
11934 
11935  case TINYEXR_TILE_RIPMAP_LEVELS:
11936 
11937  offset_data.offsets.resize(static_cast<size_t>(offset_data.num_x_levels) * static_cast<size_t>(offset_data.num_y_levels));
11938 
11939  for (int ly = 0; ly < offset_data.num_y_levels; ++ly) {
11940  for (int lx = 0; lx < offset_data.num_x_levels; ++lx) {
11941  int l = ly * offset_data.num_x_levels + lx;
11942  offset_data.offsets[l].resize(num_y_tiles[ly]);
11943 
11944  for (size_t dy = 0; dy < offset_data.offsets[l].size(); ++dy) {
11945  offset_data.offsets[l][dy].resize(num_x_tiles[lx]);
11946  num_tile_blocks += num_x_tiles[lx];
11947  }
11948  }
11949  }
11950  break;
11951 
11952  default:
11953  assert(false);
11954  }
11955  return num_tile_blocks;
11956  }
11957 
11958  static bool IsAnyOffsetsAreInvalid(const OffsetData& offset_data) {
11959  for (unsigned int l = 0; l < offset_data.offsets.size(); ++l)
11960  for (unsigned int dy = 0; dy < offset_data.offsets[l].size(); ++dy)
11961  for (unsigned int dx = 0; dx < offset_data.offsets[l][dy].size(); ++dx)
11962  if (reinterpret_cast<const tinyexr::tinyexr_int64&>(offset_data.offsets[l][dy][dx]) <= 0)
11963  return true;
11964 
11965  return false;
11966  }
11967 
11968  static bool isValidTile(const EXRHeader* exr_header,
11969  const OffsetData& offset_data,
11970  int dx, int dy, int lx, int ly) {
11971  if (lx < 0 || ly < 0 || dx < 0 || dy < 0) return false;
11972  int num_x_levels = offset_data.num_x_levels;
11973  int num_y_levels = offset_data.num_y_levels;
11974  switch (exr_header->tile_level_mode) {
11975  case TINYEXR_TILE_ONE_LEVEL:
11976 
11977  if (lx == 0 &&
11978  ly == 0 &&
11979  offset_data.offsets.size() > 0 &&
11980  offset_data.offsets[0].size() > static_cast<size_t>(dy) &&
11981  offset_data.offsets[0][dy].size() > static_cast<size_t>(dx)) {
11982  return true;
11983  }
11984 
11985  break;
11986 
11987  case TINYEXR_TILE_MIPMAP_LEVELS:
11988 
11989  if (lx < num_x_levels &&
11990  ly < num_y_levels &&
11991  offset_data.offsets.size() > static_cast<size_t>(lx) &&
11992  offset_data.offsets[lx].size() > static_cast<size_t>(dy) &&
11993  offset_data.offsets[lx][dy].size() > static_cast<size_t>(dx)) {
11994  return true;
11995  }
11996 
11997  break;
11998 
11999  case TINYEXR_TILE_RIPMAP_LEVELS:
12000  {
12001  size_t idx = static_cast<size_t>(lx) + static_cast<size_t>(ly)* static_cast<size_t>(num_x_levels);
12002  if (lx < num_x_levels &&
12003  ly < num_y_levels &&
12004  (offset_data.offsets.size() > idx) &&
12005  offset_data.offsets[idx].size() > static_cast<size_t>(dy) &&
12006  offset_data.offsets[idx][dy].size() > static_cast<size_t>(dx)) {
12007  return true;
12008  }
12009  }
12010 
12011  break;
12012 
12013  default:
12014 
12015  return false;
12016  }
12017 
12018  return false;
12019  }
12020 
12021  static void ReconstructTileOffsets(OffsetData& offset_data,
12022  const EXRHeader* exr_header,
12023  const unsigned char* head, const unsigned char* marker, const size_t size,
12024  bool isMultiPartFile,
12025  bool isDeep) {
12026  int numXLevels = offset_data.num_x_levels;
12027  for (unsigned int l = 0; l < offset_data.offsets.size(); ++l) {
12028  for (unsigned int dy = 0; dy < offset_data.offsets[l].size(); ++dy) {
12029  for (unsigned int dx = 0; dx < offset_data.offsets[l][dy].size(); ++dx) {
12030  tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 tileOffset = marker - head;
12031 
12032  if (isMultiPartFile) {
12033  //int partNumber;
12034  marker += sizeof(int);
12035  }
12036 
12037  int tileX;
12038  memcpy(&tileX, marker, sizeof(int));
12039  tinyexr::swap4(&tileX);
12040  marker += sizeof(int);
12041 
12042  int tileY;
12043  memcpy(&tileY, marker, sizeof(int));
12044  tinyexr::swap4(&tileY);
12045  marker += sizeof(int);
12046 
12047  int levelX;
12048  memcpy(&levelX, marker, sizeof(int));
12049  tinyexr::swap4(&levelX);
12050  marker += sizeof(int);
12051 
12052  int levelY;
12053  memcpy(&levelY, marker, sizeof(int));
12054  tinyexr::swap4(&levelY);
12055  marker += sizeof(int);
12056 
12057  if (isDeep) {
12058  tinyexr::tinyexr_int64 packed_offset_table_size;
12059  memcpy(&packed_offset_table_size, marker, sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_int64));
12060  tinyexr::swap8(reinterpret_cast<tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64*>(&packed_offset_table_size));
12061  marker += sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_int64);
12062 
12063  tinyexr::tinyexr_int64 packed_sample_size;
12064  memcpy(&packed_sample_size, marker, sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_int64));
12065  tinyexr::swap8(reinterpret_cast<tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64*>(&packed_sample_size));
12066  marker += sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_int64);
12067 
12068  // next Int64 is unpacked sample size - skip that too
12069  marker += packed_offset_table_size + packed_sample_size + 8;
12070 
12071  }
12072  else {
12073 
12074  int dataSize;
12075  memcpy(&dataSize, marker, sizeof(int));
12076  tinyexr::swap4(&dataSize);
12077  marker += sizeof(int);
12078  marker += dataSize;
12079  }
12080 
12081  if (!isValidTile(exr_header, offset_data,
12082  tileX, tileY, levelX, levelY))
12083  return;
12084 
12085  int level_idx = LevelIndex(levelX, levelY, exr_header->tile_level_mode, numXLevels);
12086  offset_data.offsets[level_idx][tileY][tileX] = tileOffset;
12087  }
12088  }
12089  }
12090  }
12091 
12092  // marker output is also
12093  static int ReadOffsets(OffsetData& offset_data,
12094  const unsigned char* head,
12095  const unsigned char*& marker,
12096  const size_t size,
12097  const char** err) {
12098  for (unsigned int l = 0; l < offset_data.offsets.size(); ++l) {
12099  for (unsigned int dy = 0; dy < offset_data.offsets[l].size(); ++dy) {
12100  for (unsigned int dx = 0; dx < offset_data.offsets[l][dy].size(); ++dx) {
12101  tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 offset;
12102  if ((marker + sizeof(tinyexr_uint64)) >= (head + size)) {
12103  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Insufficient data size in offset table.", err);
12104  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12105  }
12106 
12107  memcpy(&offset, marker, sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64));
12108  tinyexr::swap8(&offset);
12109  if (offset >= size) {
12110  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid offset value in DecodeEXRImage.", err);
12111  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12112  }
12113  marker += sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64); // = 8
12114  offset_data.offsets[l][dy][dx] = offset;
12115  }
12116  }
12117  }
12118  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
12119  }
12120 
12121  static int DecodeEXRImage(EXRImage *exr_image, const EXRHeader *exr_header,
12122  const unsigned char *head,
12123  const unsigned char *marker, const size_t size,
12124  const char **err) {
12125  if (exr_image == NULL || exr_header == NULL || head == NULL ||
12126  marker == NULL || (size <= tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize)) {
12127  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid argument for DecodeEXRImage().", err);
12128  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
12129  }
12130 
12131  int num_scanline_blocks = 1;
12132  if (exr_header->compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIP) {
12133  num_scanline_blocks = 16;
12134  }
12135  else if (exr_header->compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PIZ) {
12136  num_scanline_blocks = 32;
12137  }
12138  else if (exr_header->compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZFP) {
12139  num_scanline_blocks = 16;
12140  }
12141 
12142  if (exr_header->data_window.max_x < exr_header->data_window.min_x ||
12143  exr_header->data_window.max_x - exr_header->data_window.min_x ==
12144  std::numeric_limits<int>::max()) {
12145  // Issue 63
12146  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid data width value", err);
12147  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12148  }
12149  int data_width =
12150  exr_header->data_window.max_x - exr_header->data_window.min_x + 1;
12151 
12152  if (exr_header->data_window.max_y < exr_header->data_window.min_y ||
12153  exr_header->data_window.max_y - exr_header->data_window.min_y ==
12154  std::numeric_limits<int>::max()) {
12155  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid data height value", err);
12156  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12157  }
12158  int data_height =
12159  exr_header->data_window.max_y - exr_header->data_window.min_y + 1;
12160 
12161  // Do not allow too large data_width and data_height. header invalid?
12162  {
12163  if (data_width > TINYEXR_DIMENSION_THRESHOLD) {
12164  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("data width too large.", err);
12165  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12166  }
12167  if (data_height > TINYEXR_DIMENSION_THRESHOLD) {
12168  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("data height too large.", err);
12169  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12170  }
12171  }
12172 
12173  if (exr_header->tiled) {
12174  if (exr_header->tile_size_x > TINYEXR_DIMENSION_THRESHOLD) {
12175  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("tile width too large.", err);
12176  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12177  }
12178  if (exr_header->tile_size_y > TINYEXR_DIMENSION_THRESHOLD) {
12179  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("tile height too large.", err);
12180  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12181  }
12182  }
12183 
12184  // Read offset tables.
12185  OffsetData offset_data;
12186  size_t num_blocks = 0;
12187  // For a multi-resolution image, the size of the offset table will be calculated from the other attributes of the header.
12188  // If chunk_count > 0 then chunk_count must be equal to the calculated tile count.
12189  if (exr_header->tiled) {
12190  {
12191  std::vector<int> num_x_tiles, num_y_tiles;
12192  PrecalculateTileInfo(num_x_tiles, num_y_tiles, exr_header);
12193  num_blocks = InitTileOffsets(offset_data, exr_header, num_x_tiles, num_y_tiles);
12194  if (exr_header->chunk_count > 0) {
12195  if (exr_header->chunk_count != num_blocks) {
12196  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid offset table size.", err);
12197  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12198  }
12199  }
12200  }
12201 
12202  int ret = ReadOffsets(offset_data, head, marker, size, err);
12203  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) return ret;
12204  if (IsAnyOffsetsAreInvalid(offset_data)) {
12205  ReconstructTileOffsets(offset_data, exr_header,
12206  head, marker, size,
12207  exr_header->multipart, exr_header->non_image);
12208  }
12209  }
12210  else if (exr_header->chunk_count > 0) {
12211  // Use `chunkCount` attribute.
12212  num_blocks = static_cast<size_t>(exr_header->chunk_count);
12213  InitSingleResolutionOffsets(offset_data, num_blocks);
12214  }
12215  else {
12216  num_blocks = static_cast<size_t>(data_height) /
12217  static_cast<size_t>(num_scanline_blocks);
12218  if (num_blocks * static_cast<size_t>(num_scanline_blocks) <
12219  static_cast<size_t>(data_height)) {
12220  num_blocks++;
12221  }
12222 
12223  InitSingleResolutionOffsets(offset_data, num_blocks);
12224  }
12225 
12226  if (!exr_header->tiled) {
12227  std::vector<tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64>& offsets = offset_data.offsets[0][0];
12228  for (size_t y = 0; y < num_blocks; y++) {
12229  tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 offset;
12230  // Issue #81
12231  if ((marker + sizeof(tinyexr_uint64)) >= (head + size)) {
12232  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Insufficient data size in offset table.", err);
12233  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12234  }
12235 
12236  memcpy(&offset, marker, sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64));
12237  tinyexr::swap8(&offset);
12238  if (offset >= size) {
12239  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid offset value in DecodeEXRImage.", err);
12240  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12241  }
12242  marker += sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64); // = 8
12243  offsets[y] = offset;
12244  }
12245 
12246  // If line offsets are invalid, we try to reconstruct it.
12247  // See OpenEXR/IlmImf/ImfScanLineInputFile.cpp::readLineOffsets() for details.
12248  for (size_t y = 0; y < num_blocks; y++) {
12249  if (offsets[y] <= 0) {
12250  // TODO(syoyo) Report as warning?
12251  // if (err) {
12252  // stringstream ss;
12253  // ss << "Incomplete lineOffsets." << std::endl;
12254  // (*err) += ss.str();
12255  //}
12256  bool ret =
12257  ReconstructLineOffsets(&offsets, num_blocks, head, marker, size);
12258  if (ret) {
12259  // OK
12260  break;
12261  }
12262  else {
12263  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(
12264  "Cannot reconstruct lineOffset table in DecodeEXRImage.", err);
12265  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12266  }
12267  }
12268  }
12269  }
12270 
12271  {
12272  std::string e;
12273  int ret = DecodeChunk(exr_image, exr_header, offset_data, head, size, &e);
12274 
12275  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
12276  if (!e.empty()) {
12277  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(e, err);
12278  }
12279 
12280 #if 1
12281  FreeEXRImage(exr_image);
12282 #else
12283  // release memory(if exists)
12284  if ((exr_header->num_channels > 0) && exr_image && exr_image->images) {
12285  for (size_t c = 0; c < size_t(exr_header->num_channels); c++) {
12286  if (exr_image->images[c]) {
12287  free(exr_image->images[c]);
12288  exr_image->images[c] = NULL;
12289  }
12290  }
12291  free(exr_image->images);
12292  exr_image->images = NULL;
12293  }
12294 #endif
12295  }
12296 
12297  return ret;
12298  }
12299  }
12300 
12301  static void GetLayers(const EXRHeader &exr_header,
12302  std::vector<std::string> &layer_names) {
12303  // Naive implementation
12304  // Group channels by layers
12305  // go over all channel names, split by periods
12306  // collect unique names
12307  layer_names.clear();
12308  for (int c = 0; c < exr_header.num_channels; c++) {
12309  std::string full_name(exr_header.channels[c].name);
12310  const size_t pos = full_name.find_last_of('.');
12311  if (pos != std::string::npos && pos != 0 && pos + 1 < full_name.size()) {
12312  full_name.erase(pos);
12313  if (std::find(layer_names.begin(), layer_names.end(), full_name) ==
12314  layer_names.end())
12315  layer_names.push_back(full_name);
12316  }
12317  }
12318  }
12319 
12320  struct LayerChannel {
12321  explicit LayerChannel(size_t i, std::string n) : index(i), name(n) {}
12322  size_t index;
12323  std::string name;
12324  };
12325 
12326  static void ChannelsInLayer(const EXRHeader &exr_header,
12327  const std::string layer_name,
12328  std::vector<LayerChannel> &channels) {
12329  channels.clear();
12330  for (int c = 0; c < exr_header.num_channels; c++) {
12331  std::string ch_name(exr_header.channels[c].name);
12332  if (layer_name.empty()) {
12333  const size_t pos = ch_name.find_last_of('.');
12334  if (pos != std::string::npos && pos < ch_name.size()) {
12335  ch_name = ch_name.substr(pos + 1);
12336  }
12337  }
12338  else {
12339  const size_t pos = ch_name.find(layer_name + '.');
12340  if (pos == std::string::npos) continue;
12341  if (pos == 0) {
12342  ch_name = ch_name.substr(layer_name.size() + 1);
12343  }
12344  }
12345  LayerChannel ch(size_t(c), ch_name);
12346  channels.push_back(ch);
12347  }
12348  }
12349 
12350 } // namespace tinyexr
12351 
12352 int EXRLayers(const char *filename, const char **layer_names[], int *num_layers,
12353  const char **err) {
12354  EXRVersion exr_version;
12355  EXRHeader exr_header;
12356  InitEXRHeader(&exr_header);
12357 
12358  {
12359  int ret = ParseEXRVersionFromFile(&exr_version, filename);
12360  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
12361  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid EXR header.", err);
12362  return ret;
12363  }
12364 
12365  if (exr_version.multipart || exr_version.non_image) {
12366  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(
12367  "Loading multipart or DeepImage is not supported in LoadEXR() API",
12368  err);
12369  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA; // @fixme.
12370  }
12371  }
12372 
12373  int ret = ParseEXRHeaderFromFile(&exr_header, &exr_version, filename, err);
12374  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
12375  FreeEXRHeader(&exr_header);
12376  return ret;
12377  }
12378 
12379  std::vector<std::string> layer_vec;
12380  tinyexr::GetLayers(exr_header, layer_vec);
12381 
12382  (*num_layers) = int(layer_vec.size());
12383  (*layer_names) = static_cast<const char **>(
12384  malloc(sizeof(const char *) * static_cast<size_t>(layer_vec.size())));
12385  for (size_t c = 0; c < static_cast<size_t>(layer_vec.size()); c++) {
12386 #ifdef _MSC_VER
12387  (*layer_names)[c] = _strdup(layer_vec[c].c_str());
12388 #else
12389  (*layer_names)[c] = strdup(layer_vec[c].c_str());
12390 #endif
12391  }
12392 
12393  FreeEXRHeader(&exr_header);
12394  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
12395 }
12396 
12397 int LoadEXR(float **out_rgba, int *width, int *height, const char *filename,
12398  const char **err) {
12399  return LoadEXRWithLayer(out_rgba, width, height, filename,
12400  /* layername */ NULL, err);
12401 }
12402 
12403 int LoadEXRWithLayer(float **out_rgba, int *width, int *height,
12404  const char *filename, const char *layername,
12405  const char **err) {
12406  if (out_rgba == NULL) {
12407  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid argument for LoadEXR()", err);
12408  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
12409  }
12410 
12411  EXRVersion exr_version;
12412  EXRImage exr_image;
12413  EXRHeader exr_header;
12414  InitEXRHeader(&exr_header);
12415  InitEXRImage(&exr_image);
12416 
12417  {
12418  int ret = ParseEXRVersionFromFile(&exr_version, filename);
12419  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
12420  std::stringstream ss;
12421  ss << "Failed to open EXR file or read version info from EXR file. code("
12422  << ret << ")";
12423  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(ss.str(), err);
12424  return ret;
12425  }
12426 
12427  if (exr_version.multipart || exr_version.non_image) {
12428  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(
12429  "Loading multipart or DeepImage is not supported in LoadEXR() API",
12430  err);
12431  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA; // @fixme.
12432  }
12433  }
12434 
12435  {
12436  int ret = ParseEXRHeaderFromFile(&exr_header, &exr_version, filename, err);
12437  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
12438  FreeEXRHeader(&exr_header);
12439  return ret;
12440  }
12441  }
12442 
12443  // Read HALF channel as FLOAT.
12444  for (int i = 0; i < exr_header.num_channels; i++) {
12445  if (exr_header.pixel_types[i] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
12446  exr_header.requested_pixel_types[i] = TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT;
12447  }
12448  }
12449 
12450  // TODO: Probably limit loading to layers (channels) selected by layer index
12451  {
12452  int ret = LoadEXRImageFromFile(&exr_image, &exr_header, filename, err);
12453  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
12454  FreeEXRHeader(&exr_header);
12455  return ret;
12456  }
12457  }
12458 
12459  // RGBA
12460  int idxR = -1;
12461  int idxG = -1;
12462  int idxB = -1;
12463  int idxA = -1;
12464 
12465  std::vector<std::string> layer_names;
12466  tinyexr::GetLayers(exr_header, layer_names);
12467 
12468  std::vector<tinyexr::LayerChannel> channels;
12469  tinyexr::ChannelsInLayer(
12470  exr_header, layername == NULL ? "" : std::string(layername), channels);
12471 
12472  if (channels.size() < 1) {
12473  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Layer Not Found", err);
12474  FreeEXRHeader(&exr_header);
12475  FreeEXRImage(&exr_image);
12476  return TINYEXR_ERROR_LAYER_NOT_FOUND;
12477  }
12478 
12479  size_t ch_count = channels.size() < 4 ? channels.size() : 4;
12480  for (size_t c = 0; c < ch_count; c++) {
12481  const tinyexr::LayerChannel &ch = channels[c];
12482 
12483  if (ch.name == "R") {
12484  idxR = int(ch.index);
12485  }
12486  else if (ch.name == "G") {
12487  idxG = int(ch.index);
12488  }
12489  else if (ch.name == "B") {
12490  idxB = int(ch.index);
12491  }
12492  else if (ch.name == "A") {
12493  idxA = int(ch.index);
12494  }
12495  }
12496 
12497  if (channels.size() == 1) {
12498  int chIdx = int(channels.front().index);
12499  // Grayscale channel only.
12500 
12501  (*out_rgba) = reinterpret_cast<float *>(
12502  malloc(4 * sizeof(float) * static_cast<size_t>(exr_image.width) *
12503  static_cast<size_t>(exr_image.height)));
12504 
12505  if (exr_header.tiled) {
12506  for (int it = 0; it < exr_image.num_tiles; it++) {
12507  for (int j = 0; j < exr_header.tile_size_y; j++) {
12508  for (int i = 0; i < exr_header.tile_size_x; i++) {
12509  const int ii = exr_image.tiles[it].offset_x *
12510  static_cast<int>(exr_header.tile_size_x) +
12511  i;
12512  const int jj = exr_image.tiles[it].offset_y *
12513  static_cast<int>(exr_header.tile_size_y) +
12514  j;
12515  const int idx = ii + jj * static_cast<int>(exr_image.width);
12516 
12517  // out of region check.
12518  if (ii >= exr_image.width) {
12519  continue;
12520  }
12521  if (jj >= exr_image.height) {
12522  continue;
12523  }
12524  const int srcIdx = i + j * exr_header.tile_size_x;
12525  unsigned char **src = exr_image.tiles[it].images;
12526  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 0] =
12527  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[chIdx][srcIdx];
12528  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 1] =
12529  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[chIdx][srcIdx];
12530  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 2] =
12531  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[chIdx][srcIdx];
12532  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 3] =
12533  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[chIdx][srcIdx];
12534  }
12535  }
12536  }
12537  }
12538  else {
12539  for (int i = 0; i < exr_image.width * exr_image.height; i++) {
12540  const float val =
12541  reinterpret_cast<float **>(exr_image.images)[chIdx][i];
12542  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 0] = val;
12543  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 1] = val;
12544  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 2] = val;
12545  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 3] = val;
12546  }
12547  }
12548  }
12549  else {
12550  // Assume RGB(A)
12551 
12552  if (idxR == -1) {
12553  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("R channel not found", err);
12554 
12555  FreeEXRHeader(&exr_header);
12556  FreeEXRImage(&exr_image);
12557  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12558  }
12559 
12560  if (idxG == -1) {
12561  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("G channel not found", err);
12562  FreeEXRHeader(&exr_header);
12563  FreeEXRImage(&exr_image);
12564  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12565  }
12566 
12567  if (idxB == -1) {
12568  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("B channel not found", err);
12569  FreeEXRHeader(&exr_header);
12570  FreeEXRImage(&exr_image);
12571  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12572  }
12573 
12574  (*out_rgba) = reinterpret_cast<float *>(
12575  malloc(4 * sizeof(float) * static_cast<size_t>(exr_image.width) *
12576  static_cast<size_t>(exr_image.height)));
12577  if (exr_header.tiled) {
12578  for (int it = 0; it < exr_image.num_tiles; it++) {
12579  for (int j = 0; j < exr_header.tile_size_y; j++) {
12580  for (int i = 0; i < exr_header.tile_size_x; i++) {
12581  const int ii =
12582  exr_image.tiles[it].offset_x * exr_header.tile_size_x + i;
12583  const int jj =
12584  exr_image.tiles[it].offset_y * exr_header.tile_size_y + j;
12585  const int idx = ii + jj * exr_image.width;
12586 
12587  // out of region check.
12588  if (ii >= exr_image.width) {
12589  continue;
12590  }
12591  if (jj >= exr_image.height) {
12592  continue;
12593  }
12594  const int srcIdx = i + j * exr_header.tile_size_x;
12595  unsigned char **src = exr_image.tiles[it].images;
12596  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 0] =
12597  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[idxR][srcIdx];
12598  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 1] =
12599  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[idxG][srcIdx];
12600  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 2] =
12601  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[idxB][srcIdx];
12602  if (idxA != -1) {
12603  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 3] =
12604  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[idxA][srcIdx];
12605  }
12606  else {
12607  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 3] = 1.0;
12608  }
12609  }
12610  }
12611  }
12612  }
12613  else {
12614  for (int i = 0; i < exr_image.width * exr_image.height; i++) {
12615  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 0] =
12616  reinterpret_cast<float **>(exr_image.images)[idxR][i];
12617  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 1] =
12618  reinterpret_cast<float **>(exr_image.images)[idxG][i];
12619  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 2] =
12620  reinterpret_cast<float **>(exr_image.images)[idxB][i];
12621  if (idxA != -1) {
12622  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 3] =
12623  reinterpret_cast<float **>(exr_image.images)[idxA][i];
12624  }
12625  else {
12626  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 3] = 1.0;
12627  }
12628  }
12629  }
12630  }
12631 
12632  (*width) = exr_image.width;
12633  (*height) = exr_image.height;
12634 
12635  FreeEXRHeader(&exr_header);
12636  FreeEXRImage(&exr_image);
12637 
12638  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
12639 }
12640 
12641 int IsEXR(const char *filename) {
12642  EXRVersion exr_version;
12643 
12644  int ret = ParseEXRVersionFromFile(&exr_version, filename);
12645  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
12646  return ret;
12647  }
12648 
12649  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
12650 }
12651 
12652 int ParseEXRHeaderFromMemory(EXRHeader *exr_header, const EXRVersion *version,
12653  const unsigned char *memory, size_t size,
12654  const char **err) {
12655  if (memory == NULL || exr_header == NULL) {
12656  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(
12657  "Invalid argument. `memory` or `exr_header` argument is null in "
12658  "ParseEXRHeaderFromMemory()",
12659  err);
12660 
12661  // Invalid argument
12662  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
12663  }
12664 
12665  if (size < tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize) {
12666  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Insufficient header/data size.\n", err);
12667  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12668  }
12669 
12670  const unsigned char *marker = memory + tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize;
12671  size_t marker_size = size - tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize;
12672 
12673  tinyexr::HeaderInfo info;
12674  info.clear();
12675 
12676  std::string err_str;
12677  int ret = ParseEXRHeader(&info, NULL, version, &err_str, marker, marker_size);
12678 
12679  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
12680  if (err && !err_str.empty()) {
12681  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(err_str, err);
12682  }
12683  }
12684 
12685  ConvertHeader(exr_header, info);
12686 
12687  exr_header->multipart = version->multipart ? 1 : 0;
12688  exr_header->non_image = version->non_image ? 1 : 0;
12689 
12690  return ret;
12691 }
12692 
12693 int LoadEXRFromMemory(float **out_rgba, int *width, int *height,
12694  const unsigned char *memory, size_t size,
12695  const char **err) {
12696  if (out_rgba == NULL || memory == NULL) {
12697  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid argument for LoadEXRFromMemory", err);
12698  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
12699  }
12700 
12701  EXRVersion exr_version;
12702  EXRImage exr_image;
12703  EXRHeader exr_header;
12704 
12705  InitEXRHeader(&exr_header);
12706 
12707  int ret = ParseEXRVersionFromMemory(&exr_version, memory, size);
12708  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
12709  std::stringstream ss;
12710  ss << "Failed to parse EXR version. code(" << ret << ")";
12711  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(ss.str(), err);
12712  return ret;
12713  }
12714 
12715  ret = ParseEXRHeaderFromMemory(&exr_header, &exr_version, memory, size, err);
12716  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
12717  return ret;
12718  }
12719 
12720  // Read HALF channel as FLOAT.
12721  for (int i = 0; i < exr_header.num_channels; i++) {
12722  if (exr_header.pixel_types[i] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
12723  exr_header.requested_pixel_types[i] = TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT;
12724  }
12725  }
12726 
12727  InitEXRImage(&exr_image);
12728  ret = LoadEXRImageFromMemory(&exr_image, &exr_header, memory, size, err);
12729  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
12730  return ret;
12731  }
12732 
12733  // RGBA
12734  int idxR = -1;
12735  int idxG = -1;
12736  int idxB = -1;
12737  int idxA = -1;
12738  for (int c = 0; c < exr_header.num_channels; c++) {
12739  if (strcmp(exr_header.channels[c].name, "R") == 0) {
12740  idxR = c;
12741  }
12742  else if (strcmp(exr_header.channels[c].name, "G") == 0) {
12743  idxG = c;
12744  }
12745  else if (strcmp(exr_header.channels[c].name, "B") == 0) {
12746  idxB = c;
12747  }
12748  else if (strcmp(exr_header.channels[c].name, "A") == 0) {
12749  idxA = c;
12750  }
12751  }
12752 
12753  // TODO(syoyo): Refactor removing same code as used in LoadEXR().
12754  if (exr_header.num_channels == 1) {
12755  // Grayscale channel only.
12756 
12757  (*out_rgba) = reinterpret_cast<float *>(
12758  malloc(4 * sizeof(float) * static_cast<size_t>(exr_image.width) *
12759  static_cast<size_t>(exr_image.height)));
12760 
12761  if (exr_header.tiled) {
12762  for (int it = 0; it < exr_image.num_tiles; it++) {
12763  for (int j = 0; j < exr_header.tile_size_y; j++) {
12764  for (int i = 0; i < exr_header.tile_size_x; i++) {
12765  const int ii =
12766  exr_image.tiles[it].offset_x * exr_header.tile_size_x + i;
12767  const int jj =
12768  exr_image.tiles[it].offset_y * exr_header.tile_size_y + j;
12769  const int idx = ii + jj * exr_image.width;
12770 
12771  // out of region check.
12772  if (ii >= exr_image.width) {
12773  continue;
12774  }
12775  if (jj >= exr_image.height) {
12776  continue;
12777  }
12778  const int srcIdx = i + j * exr_header.tile_size_x;
12779  unsigned char **src = exr_image.tiles[it].images;
12780  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 0] =
12781  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[0][srcIdx];
12782  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 1] =
12783  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[0][srcIdx];
12784  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 2] =
12785  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[0][srcIdx];
12786  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 3] =
12787  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[0][srcIdx];
12788  }
12789  }
12790  }
12791  }
12792  else {
12793  for (int i = 0; i < exr_image.width * exr_image.height; i++) {
12794  const float val = reinterpret_cast<float **>(exr_image.images)[0][i];
12795  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 0] = val;
12796  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 1] = val;
12797  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 2] = val;
12798  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 3] = val;
12799  }
12800  }
12801 
12802  }
12803  else {
12804  // TODO(syoyo): Support non RGBA image.
12805 
12806  if (idxR == -1) {
12807  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("R channel not found", err);
12808 
12809  // @todo { free exr_image }
12810  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12811  }
12812 
12813  if (idxG == -1) {
12814  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("G channel not found", err);
12815  // @todo { free exr_image }
12816  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12817  }
12818 
12819  if (idxB == -1) {
12820  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("B channel not found", err);
12821  // @todo { free exr_image }
12822  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
12823  }
12824 
12825  (*out_rgba) = reinterpret_cast<float *>(
12826  malloc(4 * sizeof(float) * static_cast<size_t>(exr_image.width) *
12827  static_cast<size_t>(exr_image.height)));
12828 
12829  if (exr_header.tiled) {
12830  for (int it = 0; it < exr_image.num_tiles; it++) {
12831  for (int j = 0; j < exr_header.tile_size_y; j++)
12832  for (int i = 0; i < exr_header.tile_size_x; i++) {
12833  const int ii =
12834  exr_image.tiles[it].offset_x * exr_header.tile_size_x + i;
12835  const int jj =
12836  exr_image.tiles[it].offset_y * exr_header.tile_size_y + j;
12837  const int idx = ii + jj * exr_image.width;
12838 
12839  // out of region check.
12840  if (ii >= exr_image.width) {
12841  continue;
12842  }
12843  if (jj >= exr_image.height) {
12844  continue;
12845  }
12846  const int srcIdx = i + j * exr_header.tile_size_x;
12847  unsigned char **src = exr_image.tiles[it].images;
12848  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 0] =
12849  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[idxR][srcIdx];
12850  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 1] =
12851  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[idxG][srcIdx];
12852  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 2] =
12853  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[idxB][srcIdx];
12854  if (idxA != -1) {
12855  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 3] =
12856  reinterpret_cast<float **>(src)[idxA][srcIdx];
12857  }
12858  else {
12859  (*out_rgba)[4 * idx + 3] = 1.0;
12860  }
12861  }
12862  }
12863  }
12864  else {
12865  for (int i = 0; i < exr_image.width * exr_image.height; i++) {
12866  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 0] =
12867  reinterpret_cast<float **>(exr_image.images)[idxR][i];
12868  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 1] =
12869  reinterpret_cast<float **>(exr_image.images)[idxG][i];
12870  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 2] =
12871  reinterpret_cast<float **>(exr_image.images)[idxB][i];
12872  if (idxA != -1) {
12873  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 3] =
12874  reinterpret_cast<float **>(exr_image.images)[idxA][i];
12875  }
12876  else {
12877  (*out_rgba)[4 * i + 3] = 1.0;
12878  }
12879  }
12880  }
12881  }
12882 
12883  (*width) = exr_image.width;
12884  (*height) = exr_image.height;
12885 
12886  FreeEXRHeader(&exr_header);
12887  FreeEXRImage(&exr_image);
12888 
12889  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
12890 }
12891 
12892 int LoadEXRImageFromFile(EXRImage *exr_image, const EXRHeader *exr_header,
12893  const char *filename, const char **err) {
12894  if (exr_image == NULL) {
12895  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid argument for LoadEXRImageFromFile", err);
12896  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
12897  }
12898 
12899  FILE *fp = NULL;
12900 #ifdef _WIN32
12901 #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__) // MSVC, MinGW gcc or clang
12902  errno_t errcode =
12903  _wfopen_s(&fp, tinyexr::UTF8ToWchar(filename).c_str(), L"rb");
12904  if (errcode != 0) {
12905  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot read file " + std::string(filename), err);
12906  // TODO(syoyo): return wfopen_s erro code
12907  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_OPEN_FILE;
12908  }
12909 #else
12910  // Unknown compiler
12911  fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
12912 #endif
12913 #else
12914  fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
12915 #endif
12916  if (!fp) {
12917  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot read file " + std::string(filename), err);
12918  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_OPEN_FILE;
12919  }
12920 
12921  size_t filesize;
12922  // Compute size
12923  fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_END);
12924  filesize = static_cast<size_t>(ftell(fp));
12925  fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_SET);
12926 
12927  if (filesize < 16) {
12928  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("File size too short " + std::string(filename),
12929  err);
12930  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_FILE;
12931  }
12932 
12933  std::vector<unsigned char> buf(filesize); // @todo { use mmap }
12934  {
12935  size_t ret;
12936  ret = fread(&buf[0], 1, filesize, fp);
12937  assert(ret == filesize);
12938  fclose(fp);
12939  (void)ret;
12940  }
12941 
12942  return LoadEXRImageFromMemory(exr_image, exr_header, &buf.at(0), filesize,
12943  err);
12944 }
12945 
12946 int LoadEXRImageFromMemory(EXRImage *exr_image, const EXRHeader *exr_header,
12947  const unsigned char *memory, const size_t size,
12948  const char **err) {
12949  if (exr_image == NULL || memory == NULL ||
12950  (size < tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize)) {
12951  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid argument for LoadEXRImageFromMemory",
12952  err);
12953  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
12954  }
12955 
12956  if (exr_header->header_len == 0) {
12957  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("EXRHeader variable is not initialized.", err);
12958  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
12959  }
12960 
12961  const unsigned char *head = memory;
12962  const unsigned char *marker = reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(
12963  memory + exr_header->header_len +
12964  8); // +8 for magic number + version header.
12965  return tinyexr::DecodeEXRImage(exr_image, exr_header, head, marker, size,
12966  err);
12967 }
12968 
12969 namespace tinyexr
12970 {
12971 
12972  // out_data must be allocated initially with the block-header size
12973  // of the current image(-part) type
12974  static bool EncodePixelData(/* out */ std::vector<unsigned char>& out_data,
12975  const unsigned char* const* images,
12976  const int* requested_pixel_types,
12977  int compression_type,
12978  int line_order,
12979  int width, // for tiled : tile.width
12980  int height, // for tiled : header.tile_size_y
12981  int x_stride, // for tiled : header.tile_size_x
12982  int line_no, // for tiled : 0
12983  int num_lines, // for tiled : tile.height
12984  size_t pixel_data_size,
12985  const std::vector<ChannelInfo>& channels,
12986  const std::vector<size_t>& channel_offset_list,
12987  const void* compression_param = 0) // zfp compression param
12988  {
12989  size_t buf_size = static_cast<size_t>(width) *
12990  static_cast<size_t>(num_lines) *
12991  static_cast<size_t>(pixel_data_size);
12992  //int last2bit = (buf_size & 3);
12993  // buf_size must be multiple of four
12994  //if(last2bit) buf_size += 4 - last2bit;
12995  std::vector<unsigned char> buf(buf_size);
12996 
12997  size_t start_y = static_cast<size_t>(line_no);
12998  for (size_t c = 0; c < channels.size(); c++) {
12999  if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
13000  if (requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) {
13001  for (int y = 0; y < num_lines; y++) {
13002  // Assume increasing Y
13003  float *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<float *>(&buf.at(
13004  static_cast<size_t>(pixel_data_size * y * width) +
13005  channel_offset_list[c] *
13006  static_cast<size_t>(width)));
13007  for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
13008  tinyexr::FP16 h16;
13009  h16.u = reinterpret_cast<const unsigned short * const *>(
13010  images)[c][(y + start_y) * x_stride + x];
13011 
13012  tinyexr::FP32 f32 = half_to_float(h16);
13013 
13014  tinyexr::swap4(&f32.f);
13015 
13016  // line_ptr[x] = f32.f;
13017  tinyexr::cpy4(line_ptr + x, &(f32.f));
13018  }
13019  }
13020  }
13021  else if (requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
13022  for (int y = 0; y < num_lines; y++) {
13023  // Assume increasing Y
13024  unsigned short *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<unsigned short *>(
13025  &buf.at(static_cast<size_t>(pixel_data_size * y *
13026  width) +
13027  channel_offset_list[c] *
13028  static_cast<size_t>(width)));
13029  for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
13030  unsigned short val = reinterpret_cast<const unsigned short * const *>(
13031  images)[c][(y + start_y) * x_stride + x];
13032 
13033  tinyexr::swap2(&val);
13034 
13035  // line_ptr[x] = val;
13036  tinyexr::cpy2(line_ptr + x, &val);
13037  }
13038  }
13039  }
13040  else {
13041  assert(0);
13042  }
13043 
13044  }
13045  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) {
13046  if (requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
13047  for (int y = 0; y < num_lines; y++) {
13048  // Assume increasing Y
13049  unsigned short *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<unsigned short *>(
13050  &buf.at(static_cast<size_t>(pixel_data_size * y *
13051  width) +
13052  channel_offset_list[c] *
13053  static_cast<size_t>(width)));
13054  for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
13055  tinyexr::FP32 f32;
13056  f32.f = reinterpret_cast<const float * const *>(
13057  images)[c][(y + start_y) * x_stride + x];
13058 
13059  tinyexr::FP16 h16;
13060  h16 = float_to_half_full(f32);
13061 
13062  tinyexr::swap2(reinterpret_cast<unsigned short *>(&h16.u));
13063 
13064  // line_ptr[x] = h16.u;
13065  tinyexr::cpy2(line_ptr + x, &(h16.u));
13066  }
13067  }
13068  }
13069  else if (requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) {
13070  for (int y = 0; y < num_lines; y++) {
13071  // Assume increasing Y
13072  float *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<float *>(&buf.at(
13073  static_cast<size_t>(pixel_data_size * y * width) +
13074  channel_offset_list[c] *
13075  static_cast<size_t>(width)));
13076  for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
13077  float val = reinterpret_cast<const float * const *>(
13078  images)[c][(y + start_y) * x_stride + x];
13079 
13080  tinyexr::swap4(&val);
13081 
13082  // line_ptr[x] = val;
13083  tinyexr::cpy4(line_ptr + x, &val);
13084  }
13085  }
13086  }
13087  else {
13088  assert(0);
13089  }
13090  }
13091  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_UINT) {
13092  for (int y = 0; y < num_lines; y++) {
13093  // Assume increasing Y
13094  unsigned int *line_ptr = reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(&buf.at(
13095  static_cast<size_t>(pixel_data_size * y * width) +
13096  channel_offset_list[c] * static_cast<size_t>(width)));
13097  for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
13098  unsigned int val = reinterpret_cast<const unsigned int * const *>(
13099  images)[c][(y + start_y) * x_stride + x];
13100 
13101  tinyexr::swap4(&val);
13102 
13103  // line_ptr[x] = val;
13104  tinyexr::cpy4(line_ptr + x, &val);
13105  }
13106  }
13107  }
13108  }
13109 
13110  if (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_NONE) {
13111  // 4 byte: scan line
13112  // 4 byte: data size
13113  // ~ : pixel data(uncompressed)
13114  out_data.insert(out_data.end(), buf.begin(), buf.end());
13115 
13116  }
13117  else if ((compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIPS) ||
13118  (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIP)) {
13119 #if TINYEXR_USE_MINIZ
13120  std::vector<unsigned char> block(tinyexr::miniz::mz_compressBound(
13121  static_cast<unsigned long>(buf.size())));
13122 #else
13123  std::vector<unsigned char> block(
13124  compressBound(static_cast<uLong>(buf.size())));
13125 #endif
13126  tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 outSize = block.size();
13127 
13128  tinyexr::CompressZip(&block.at(0), outSize,
13129  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(&buf.at(0)),
13130  static_cast<unsigned long>(buf.size()));
13131 
13132  // 4 byte: scan line
13133  // 4 byte: data size
13134  // ~ : pixel data(compressed)
13135  unsigned int data_len = static_cast<unsigned int>(outSize); // truncate
13136 
13137  out_data.insert(out_data.end(), block.begin(), block.begin() + data_len);
13138 
13139  }
13140  else if (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_RLE) {
13141  // (buf.size() * 3) / 2 would be enough.
13142  std::vector<unsigned char> block((buf.size() * 3) / 2);
13143 
13144  tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 outSize = block.size();
13145 
13146  tinyexr::CompressRle(&block.at(0), outSize,
13147  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(&buf.at(0)),
13148  static_cast<unsigned long>(buf.size()));
13149 
13150  // 4 byte: scan line
13151  // 4 byte: data size
13152  // ~ : pixel data(compressed)
13153  unsigned int data_len = static_cast<unsigned int>(outSize); // truncate
13154  out_data.insert(out_data.end(), block.begin(), block.begin() + data_len);
13155 
13156  }
13157  else if (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PIZ) {
13158 #if TINYEXR_USE_PIZ
13159  unsigned int bufLen =
13160  8192 + static_cast<unsigned int>(
13161  2 * static_cast<unsigned int>(
13162  buf.size())); // @fixme { compute good bound. }
13163  std::vector<unsigned char> block(bufLen);
13164  unsigned int outSize = static_cast<unsigned int>(block.size());
13165 
13166  CompressPiz(&block.at(0), &outSize,
13167  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(&buf.at(0)),
13168  buf.size(), channels, width, num_lines);
13169 
13170  // 4 byte: scan line
13171  // 4 byte: data size
13172  // ~ : pixel data(compressed)
13173  unsigned int data_len = outSize;
13174  out_data.insert(out_data.end(), block.begin(), block.begin() + data_len);
13175 
13176 #else
13177  assert(0);
13178 #endif
13179  }
13180  else if (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZFP) {
13181 #if TINYEXR_USE_ZFP
13182  const ZFPCompressionParam* zfp_compression_param = reinterpret_cast<const ZFPCompressionParam*>(compression_param);
13183  std::vector<unsigned char> block;
13184  unsigned int outSize;
13185 
13186  tinyexr::CompressZfp(
13187  &block, &outSize, reinterpret_cast<const float *>(&buf.at(0)),
13188  width, num_lines, static_cast<int>(channels.size()), *zfp_compression_param);
13189 
13190  // 4 byte: scan line
13191  // 4 byte: data size
13192  // ~ : pixel data(compressed)
13193  unsigned int data_len = outSize;
13194  out_data.insert(out_data.end(), block.begin(), block.begin() + data_len);
13195 
13196 #else
13197  assert(0);
13198 #endif
13199  }
13200  else {
13201  assert(0);
13202  return false;
13203  }
13204 
13205  return true;
13206  }
13207 
13208  static int EncodeTiledLevel(const EXRImage* level_image, const EXRHeader* exr_header,
13209  const std::vector<tinyexr::ChannelInfo>& channels,
13210  std::vector<std::vector<unsigned char> >& data_list,
13211  size_t start_index, // for data_list
13212  int num_x_tiles, int num_y_tiles,
13213  const std::vector<size_t>& channel_offset_list,
13214  int pixel_data_size,
13215  const void* compression_param, // must be set if zfp compression is enabled
13216  std::string* err) {
13217  int num_tiles = num_x_tiles * num_y_tiles;
13218  assert(num_tiles == level_image->num_tiles);
13219 
13220  if ((exr_header->tile_size_x > level_image->width || exr_header->tile_size_y > level_image->height) &&
13221  level_image->level_x == 0 && level_image->level_y == 0) {
13222  if (err) {
13223  (*err) += "Failed to encode tile data.\n";
13224  }
13225  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
13226  }
13227 
13228 
13229 #if TINYEXR_HAS_CXX11 && (TINYEXR_USE_THREAD > 0)
13230  std::atomic<bool> invalid_data(false);
13231 #else
13232  bool invalid_data(false);
13233 #endif
13234 
13235 #if TINYEXR_HAS_CXX11 && (TINYEXR_USE_THREAD > 0)
13236  std::vector<std::thread> workers;
13237  std::atomic<int> tile_count(0);
13238 
13239  int num_threads = std::max(1, int(std::thread::hardware_concurrency()));
13240  if (num_threads > int(num_tiles)) {
13241  num_threads = int(num_tiles);
13242  }
13243 
13244  for (int t = 0; t < num_threads; t++) {
13245  workers.emplace_back(std::thread([&]() {
13246  int i = 0;
13247  while ((i = tile_count++) < num_tiles) {
13248 
13249 #else
13250  // Use signed int since some OpenMP compiler doesn't allow unsigned type for
13251  // `parallel for`
13252 #if TINYEXR_USE_OPENMP
13253 #pragma omp parallel for
13254 #endif
13255  for (int i = 0; i < num_tiles; i++) {
13256 
13257 #endif
13258  size_t tile_idx = static_cast<size_t>(i);
13259  size_t data_idx = tile_idx + start_index;
13260 
13261  int x_tile = i % num_x_tiles;
13262  int y_tile = i / num_x_tiles;
13263 
13264  EXRTile& tile = level_image->tiles[tile_idx];
13265 
13266  const unsigned char* const* images =
13267  static_cast<const unsigned char* const*>(tile.images);
13268 
13269  data_list[data_idx].resize(5 * sizeof(int));
13270  size_t data_header_size = data_list[data_idx].size();
13271  bool ret = EncodePixelData(data_list[data_idx],
13272  images,
13273  exr_header->requested_pixel_types,
13274  exr_header->compression_type,
13275  0, // increasing y
13276  tile.width,
13277  exr_header->tile_size_y,
13278  exr_header->tile_size_x,
13279  0,
13280  tile.height,
13281  pixel_data_size,
13282  channels,
13283  channel_offset_list,
13284  compression_param);
13285  if (!ret) {
13286  invalid_data = true;
13287  continue;
13288  }
13289  assert(data_list[data_idx].size() > data_header_size);
13290  int data_len = static_cast<int>(data_list[data_idx].size() - data_header_size);
13291  //tileX, tileY, levelX, levelY // pixel_data_size(int)
13292  memcpy(&data_list[data_idx][0], &x_tile, sizeof(int));
13293  memcpy(&data_list[data_idx][4], &y_tile, sizeof(int));
13294  memcpy(&data_list[data_idx][8], &level_image->level_x, sizeof(int));
13295  memcpy(&data_list[data_idx][12], &level_image->level_y, sizeof(int));
13296  memcpy(&data_list[data_idx][16], &data_len, sizeof(int));
13297 
13298  swap4(reinterpret_cast<int*>(&data_list[data_idx][0]));
13299  swap4(reinterpret_cast<int*>(&data_list[data_idx][4]));
13300  swap4(reinterpret_cast<int*>(&data_list[data_idx][8]));
13301  swap4(reinterpret_cast<int*>(&data_list[data_idx][12]));
13302  swap4(reinterpret_cast<int*>(&data_list[data_idx][16]));
13303 
13304 #if TINYEXR_HAS_CXX11 && (TINYEXR_USE_THREAD > 0)
13305  }
13306  }));
13307  }
13308 
13309 for (auto &t : workers) {
13310  t.join();
13311 }
13312 #else
13313  } // omp parallel
13314 #endif
13315 
13316  if (invalid_data) {
13317  if (err) {
13318  (*err) += "Failed to encode tile data.\n";
13319  }
13320  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
13321  }
13322  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
13323  }
13324 
13325  static int NumScanlines(int compression_type) {
13326  int num_scanlines = 1;
13327  if (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIP) {
13328  num_scanlines = 16;
13329  }
13330  else if (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PIZ) {
13331  num_scanlines = 32;
13332  }
13333  else if (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZFP) {
13334  num_scanlines = 16;
13335  }
13336  return num_scanlines;
13337  }
13338 
13339  static int EncodeChunk(const EXRImage* exr_image, const EXRHeader* exr_header,
13340  const std::vector<ChannelInfo>& channels,
13341  int num_blocks,
13342  tinyexr_uint64 chunk_offset, // starting offset of current chunk
13343  bool is_multipart,
13344  OffsetData& offset_data, // output block offsets, must be initialized
13345  std::vector<std::vector<unsigned char> >& data_list, // output
13346  tinyexr_uint64& total_size, // output: ending offset of current chunk
13347  std::string* err) {
13348  int num_scanlines = NumScanlines(exr_header->compression_type);
13349 
13350  data_list.resize(num_blocks);
13351 
13352  std::vector<size_t> channel_offset_list(
13353  static_cast<size_t>(exr_header->num_channels));
13354 
13355  int pixel_data_size = 0;
13356  {
13357  size_t channel_offset = 0;
13358  for (size_t c = 0; c < static_cast<size_t>(exr_header->num_channels); c++) {
13359  channel_offset_list[c] = channel_offset;
13360  if (exr_header->requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) {
13361  pixel_data_size += sizeof(unsigned short);
13362  channel_offset += sizeof(unsigned short);
13363  }
13364  else if (exr_header->requested_pixel_types[c] ==
13365  TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) {
13366  pixel_data_size += sizeof(float);
13367  channel_offset += sizeof(float);
13368  }
13369  else if (exr_header->requested_pixel_types[c] == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_UINT) {
13370  pixel_data_size += sizeof(unsigned int);
13371  channel_offset += sizeof(unsigned int);
13372  }
13373  else {
13374  assert(0);
13375  }
13376  }
13377  }
13378 
13379  const void* compression_param = 0;
13380 #if TINYEXR_USE_ZFP
13381  tinyexr::ZFPCompressionParam zfp_compression_param;
13382 
13383  // Use ZFP compression parameter from custom attributes(if such a parameter
13384  // exists)
13385  {
13386  std::string e;
13387  bool ret = tinyexr::FindZFPCompressionParam(
13388  &zfp_compression_param, exr_header->custom_attributes,
13389  exr_header->num_custom_attributes, &e);
13390 
13391  if (!ret) {
13392  // Use predefined compression parameter.
13393  zfp_compression_param.type = 0;
13394  zfp_compression_param.rate = 2;
13395  }
13396  compression_param = &zfp_compression_param;
13397  }
13398 #endif
13399 
13400  tinyexr_uint64 offset = chunk_offset;
13401  tinyexr_uint64 doffset = is_multipart ? 4u : 0u;
13402 
13403  if (exr_image->tiles) {
13404  const EXRImage* level_image = exr_image;
13405  size_t block_idx = 0;
13406  tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 block_data_size = 0;
13407  int num_levels = (exr_header->tile_level_mode != TINYEXR_TILE_RIPMAP_LEVELS) ?
13408  offset_data.num_x_levels : (offset_data.num_x_levels * offset_data.num_y_levels);
13409  for (int level_index = 0; level_index < num_levels; ++level_index) {
13410  if (!level_image) {
13411  if (err) {
13412  (*err) += "Invalid number of tiled levels for EncodeChunk\n";
13413  }
13414  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
13415  }
13416 
13417  int level_index_from_image = LevelIndex(level_image->level_x, level_image->level_y,
13418  exr_header->tile_level_mode, offset_data.num_x_levels);
13419  if (level_index_from_image != level_index) {
13420  if (err) {
13421  (*err) += "Incorrect level ordering in tiled image\n";
13422  }
13423  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
13424  }
13425  int num_y_tiles = (int)offset_data.offsets[level_index].size();
13426  assert(num_y_tiles);
13427  int num_x_tiles = (int)offset_data.offsets[level_index][0].size();
13428  assert(num_x_tiles);
13429 
13430  std::string e;
13431  int ret = EncodeTiledLevel(level_image,
13432  exr_header,
13433  channels,
13434  data_list,
13435  block_idx,
13436  num_x_tiles,
13437  num_y_tiles,
13438  channel_offset_list,
13439  pixel_data_size,
13440  compression_param,
13441  &e);
13442  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
13443  if (!e.empty() && err) {
13444  (*err) += e;
13445  }
13446  return ret;
13447  }
13448 
13449  for (size_t j = 0; j < static_cast<size_t>(num_y_tiles); ++j)
13450  for (size_t i = 0; i < static_cast<size_t>(num_x_tiles); ++i) {
13451  offset_data.offsets[level_index][j][i] = offset;
13452  swap8(reinterpret_cast<tinyexr_uint64*>(&offset_data.offsets[level_index][j][i]));
13453  offset += data_list[block_idx].size() + doffset;
13454  block_data_size += data_list[block_idx].size();
13455  ++block_idx;
13456  }
13457  level_image = level_image->next_level;
13458  }
13459  assert(block_idx == num_blocks);
13460  total_size = offset;
13461  }
13462  else { // scanlines
13463  std::vector<tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64>& offsets = offset_data.offsets[0][0];
13464 
13465 #if TINYEXR_HAS_CXX11 && (TINYEXR_USE_THREAD > 0)
13466  std::atomic<bool> invalid_data(false);
13467  std::vector<std::thread> workers;
13468  std::atomic<int> block_count(0);
13469 
13470  int num_threads = std::min(std::max(1, int(std::thread::hardware_concurrency())), num_blocks);
13471 
13472  for (int t = 0; t < num_threads; t++) {
13473  workers.emplace_back(std::thread([&]() {
13474  int i = 0;
13475  while ((i = block_count++) < num_blocks) {
13476 
13477 #else
13478  bool invalid_data(false);
13479 #if TINYEXR_USE_OPENMP
13480 #pragma omp parallel for
13481 #endif
13482  for (int i = 0; i < num_blocks; i++) {
13483 
13484 #endif
13485  int start_y = num_scanlines * i;
13486  int end_Y = (std::min)(num_scanlines * (i + 1), exr_image->height);
13487  int num_lines = end_Y - start_y;
13488 
13489  const unsigned char* const* images =
13490  static_cast<const unsigned char* const*>(exr_image->images);
13491 
13492  data_list[i].resize(2 * sizeof(int));
13493  size_t data_header_size = data_list[i].size();
13494 
13495  bool ret = EncodePixelData(data_list[i],
13496  images,
13497  exr_header->requested_pixel_types,
13498  exr_header->compression_type,
13499  0, // increasing y
13500  exr_image->width,
13501  exr_image->height,
13502  exr_image->width,
13503  start_y,
13504  num_lines,
13505  pixel_data_size,
13506  channels,
13507  channel_offset_list,
13508  compression_param);
13509  if (!ret) {
13510  invalid_data = true;
13511  continue; // "break" cannot be used with OpenMP
13512  }
13513  assert(data_list[i].size() > data_header_size);
13514  int data_len = static_cast<int>(data_list[i].size() - data_header_size);
13515  memcpy(&data_list[i][0], &start_y, sizeof(int));
13516  memcpy(&data_list[i][4], &data_len, sizeof(int));
13517 
13518  swap4(reinterpret_cast<int*>(&data_list[i][0]));
13519  swap4(reinterpret_cast<int*>(&data_list[i][4]));
13520 #if TINYEXR_HAS_CXX11 && (TINYEXR_USE_THREAD > 0)
13521  }
13522  }));
13523  }
13524 
13525  for (auto &t : workers) {
13526  t.join();
13527  }
13528 #else
13529  } // omp parallel
13530 #endif
13531 
13532  if (invalid_data) {
13533  if (err) {
13534  (*err) += "Failed to encode scanline data.\n";
13535  }
13536  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
13537  }
13538 
13539  for (size_t i = 0; i < static_cast<size_t>(num_blocks); i++) {
13540  offsets[i] = offset;
13541  tinyexr::swap8(reinterpret_cast<tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 *>(&offsets[i]));
13542  offset += data_list[i].size() + doffset;
13543  }
13544 
13545  total_size = static_cast<size_t>(offset);
13546  }
13547  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
13548  }
13549 
13550  // can save a single or multi-part image (no deep* formats)
13551  static size_t SaveEXRNPartImageToMemory(const EXRImage* exr_images,
13552  const EXRHeader** exr_headers,
13553  unsigned int num_parts,
13554  unsigned char** memory_out, const char** err) {
13555  if (exr_images == NULL || exr_headers == NULL || num_parts == 0 ||
13556  memory_out == NULL) {
13557  SetErrorMessage("Invalid argument for SaveEXRNPartImageToMemory",
13558  err);
13559  return 0;
13560  }
13561  {
13562  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < num_parts; ++i) {
13563  if (exr_headers[i]->compression_type < 0) {
13564  SetErrorMessage("Invalid argument for SaveEXRNPartImageToMemory",
13565  err);
13566  return 0;
13567  }
13568 #if !TINYEXR_USE_PIZ
13569  if (exr_headers[i]->compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PIZ) {
13570  SetErrorMessage("PIZ compression is not supported in this build",
13571  err);
13572  return 0;
13573  }
13574 #endif
13575 #if !TINYEXR_USE_ZFP
13576  if (exr_headers[i]->compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZFP) {
13577  SetErrorMessage("ZFP compression is not supported in this build",
13578  err);
13579  return 0;
13580  }
13581 #else
13582  for (int c = 0; c < exr_header->num_channels; ++c) {
13583  if (exr_headers[i]->requested_pixel_types[c] != TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) {
13584  SetErrorMessage("Pixel type must be FLOAT for ZFP compression",
13585  err);
13586  return 0;
13587  }
13588  }
13589 #endif
13590  }
13591  }
13592 
13593  std::vector<unsigned char> memory;
13594 
13595  // Header
13596  {
13597  const char header[] = { 0x76, 0x2f, 0x31, 0x01 };
13598  memory.insert(memory.end(), header, header + 4);
13599  }
13600 
13601  // Version
13602  // using value from the first header
13603  int long_name = exr_headers[0]->long_name;
13604  {
13605  char marker[] = { 2, 0, 0, 0 };
13606  /* @todo
13607  if (exr_header->non_image) {
13608  marker[1] |= 0x8;
13609  }
13610  */
13611  // tiled
13612  if (num_parts == 1 && exr_images[0].tiles) {
13613  marker[1] |= 0x2;
13614  }
13615  // long_name
13616  if (long_name) {
13617  marker[1] |= 0x4;
13618  }
13619  // multipart
13620  if (num_parts > 1) {
13621  marker[1] |= 0x10;
13622  }
13623  memory.insert(memory.end(), marker, marker + 4);
13624  }
13625 
13626  int total_chunk_count = 0;
13627  std::vector<int> chunk_count(num_parts);
13628  std::vector<OffsetData> offset_data(num_parts);
13629  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < num_parts; ++i) {
13630  if (!exr_images[i].tiles) {
13631  int num_scanlines = NumScanlines(exr_headers[i]->compression_type);
13632  chunk_count[i] =
13633  (exr_images[i].height + num_scanlines - 1) / num_scanlines;
13634  InitSingleResolutionOffsets(offset_data[i], chunk_count[i]);
13635  total_chunk_count += chunk_count[i];
13636  }
13637  else {
13638  {
13639  std::vector<int> num_x_tiles, num_y_tiles;
13640  PrecalculateTileInfo(num_x_tiles, num_y_tiles, exr_headers[i]);
13641  chunk_count[i] =
13642  InitTileOffsets(offset_data[i], exr_headers[i], num_x_tiles, num_y_tiles);
13643  total_chunk_count += chunk_count[i];
13644  }
13645  }
13646  }
13647  // Write attributes to memory buffer.
13648  std::vector< std::vector<tinyexr::ChannelInfo> > channels(num_parts);
13649  {
13650  std::set<std::string> partnames;
13651  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < num_parts; ++i) {
13652  //channels
13653  {
13654  std::vector<unsigned char> data;
13655 
13656  for (int c = 0; c < exr_headers[i]->num_channels; c++) {
13657  tinyexr::ChannelInfo info;
13658  info.p_linear = 0;
13659  info.pixel_type = exr_headers[i]->requested_pixel_types[c];
13660  info.x_sampling = 1;
13661  info.y_sampling = 1;
13662  info.name = std::string(exr_headers[i]->channels[c].name);
13663  channels[i].push_back(info);
13664  }
13665 
13666  tinyexr::WriteChannelInfo(data, channels[i]);
13667 
13668  tinyexr::WriteAttributeToMemory(&memory, "channels", "chlist", &data.at(0),
13669  static_cast<int>(data.size()));
13670  }
13671 
13672  {
13673  int comp = exr_headers[i]->compression_type;
13674  swap4(&comp);
13675  WriteAttributeToMemory(
13676  &memory, "compression", "compression",
13677  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char*>(&comp), 1);
13678  }
13679 
13680  {
13681  int data[4] = { 0, 0, exr_images[i].width - 1, exr_images[i].height - 1 };
13682  swap4(&data[0]);
13683  swap4(&data[1]);
13684  swap4(&data[2]);
13685  swap4(&data[3]);
13686  WriteAttributeToMemory(
13687  &memory, "dataWindow", "box2i",
13688  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char*>(data), sizeof(int) * 4);
13689 
13690  int data0[4] = { 0, 0, exr_images[0].width - 1, exr_images[0].height - 1 };
13691  swap4(&data0[0]);
13692  swap4(&data0[1]);
13693  swap4(&data0[2]);
13694  swap4(&data0[3]);
13695  // Note: must be the same across parts (currently, using value from the first header)
13696  WriteAttributeToMemory(
13697  &memory, "displayWindow", "box2i",
13698  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char*>(data0), sizeof(int) * 4);
13699  }
13700 
13701  {
13702  unsigned char line_order = 0; // @fixme { read line_order from EXRHeader }
13703  WriteAttributeToMemory(&memory, "lineOrder", "lineOrder",
13704  &line_order, 1);
13705  }
13706 
13707  {
13708  // Note: must be the same across parts
13709  float aspectRatio = 1.0f;
13710  swap4(&aspectRatio);
13711  WriteAttributeToMemory(
13712  &memory, "pixelAspectRatio", "float",
13713  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char*>(&aspectRatio), sizeof(float));
13714  }
13715 
13716  {
13717  float center[2] = { 0.0f, 0.0f };
13718  swap4(&center[0]);
13719  swap4(&center[1]);
13720  WriteAttributeToMemory(
13721  &memory, "screenWindowCenter", "v2f",
13722  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char*>(center), 2 * sizeof(float));
13723  }
13724 
13725  {
13726  float w = 1.0f;
13727  swap4(&w);
13728  WriteAttributeToMemory(&memory, "screenWindowWidth", "float",
13729  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char*>(&w),
13730  sizeof(float));
13731  }
13732 
13733  if (exr_images[i].tiles) {
13734  unsigned char tile_mode = static_cast<unsigned char>(exr_headers[i]->tile_level_mode & 0x3);
13735  if (exr_headers[i]->tile_rounding_mode) tile_mode |= (1u << 4u);
13736  //unsigned char data[9] = { 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0 };
13737  unsigned int datai[3] = { 0, 0, 0 };
13738  unsigned char* data = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char*>(&datai[0]);
13739  datai[0] = static_cast<unsigned int>(exr_headers[i]->tile_size_x);
13740  datai[1] = static_cast<unsigned int>(exr_headers[i]->tile_size_y);
13741  data[8] = tile_mode;
13742  swap4(reinterpret_cast<unsigned int*>(&data[0]));
13743  swap4(reinterpret_cast<unsigned int*>(&data[4]));
13744  WriteAttributeToMemory(
13745  &memory, "tiles", "tiledesc",
13746  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char*>(data), 9);
13747  }
13748 
13749  // must be present for multi-part files - according to spec.
13750  if (num_parts > 1) {
13751  // name
13752  {
13753  size_t len = 0;
13754  if ((len = strlen(exr_headers[i]->name)) > 0) {
13755  partnames.insert(std::string(exr_headers[i]->name));
13756  if (partnames.size() != i + 1) {
13757  SetErrorMessage("'name' attributes must be unique for a multi-part file", err);
13758  return 0;
13759  }
13760  WriteAttributeToMemory(
13761  &memory, "name", "string",
13762  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char*>(exr_headers[i]->name),
13763  static_cast<int>(len));
13764  }
13765  else {
13766  SetErrorMessage("Invalid 'name' attribute for a multi-part file", err);
13767  return 0;
13768  }
13769  }
13770  // type
13771  {
13772  const char* type = "scanlineimage";
13773  if (exr_images[i].tiles) type = "tiledimage";
13774  WriteAttributeToMemory(
13775  &memory, "type", "string",
13776  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char*>(type),
13777  static_cast<int>(strlen(type)));
13778  }
13779  // chunkCount
13780  {
13781  WriteAttributeToMemory(
13782  &memory, "chunkCount", "int",
13783  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char*>(&chunk_count[i]),
13784  4);
13785  }
13786  }
13787 
13788  // Custom attributes
13789  if (exr_headers[i]->num_custom_attributes > 0) {
13790  for (int j = 0; j < exr_headers[i]->num_custom_attributes; j++) {
13791  tinyexr::WriteAttributeToMemory(
13792  &memory, exr_headers[i]->custom_attributes[j].name,
13793  exr_headers[i]->custom_attributes[j].type,
13794  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char*>(
13795  exr_headers[i]->custom_attributes[j].value),
13796  exr_headers[i]->custom_attributes[j].size);
13797  }
13798  }
13799 
13800  { // end of header
13801  memory.push_back(0);
13802  }
13803  }
13804  }
13805  if (num_parts > 1) {
13806  // end of header list
13807  memory.push_back(0);
13808  }
13809 
13810  tinyexr_uint64 chunk_offset = memory.size() + size_t(total_chunk_count) * sizeof(tinyexr_uint64);
13811 
13812  tinyexr_uint64 total_size = 0;
13813  std::vector< std::vector< std::vector<unsigned char> > > data_lists(num_parts);
13814  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < num_parts; ++i) {
13815  std::string e;
13816  int ret = EncodeChunk(&exr_images[i], exr_headers[i],
13817  channels[i],
13818  chunk_count[i],
13819  // starting offset of current chunk after part-number
13820  chunk_offset,
13821  num_parts > 1,
13822  offset_data[i], // output: block offsets, must be initialized
13823  data_lists[i], // output
13824  total_size, // output
13825  &e);
13826  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
13827  if (!e.empty()) {
13828  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(e, err);
13829  }
13830  return 0;
13831  }
13832  chunk_offset = total_size;
13833  }
13834 
13835  // Allocating required memory
13836  if (total_size == 0) { // something went wrong
13837  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Output memory size is zero", err);
13838  return 0;
13839  }
13840  (*memory_out) = static_cast<unsigned char*>(malloc(total_size));
13841 
13842  // Writing header
13843  memcpy((*memory_out), &memory[0], memory.size());
13844  unsigned char* memory_ptr = *memory_out + memory.size();
13845  size_t sum = memory.size();
13846 
13847  // Writing offset data for chunks
13848  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < num_parts; ++i) {
13849  if (exr_images[i].tiles) {
13850  const EXRImage* level_image = &exr_images[i];
13851  int num_levels = (exr_headers[i]->tile_level_mode != TINYEXR_TILE_RIPMAP_LEVELS) ?
13852  offset_data[i].num_x_levels : (offset_data[i].num_x_levels * offset_data[i].num_y_levels);
13853  for (int level_index = 0; level_index < num_levels; ++level_index) {
13854  for (size_t j = 0; j < offset_data[i].offsets[level_index].size(); ++j) {
13855  size_t num_bytes = sizeof(tinyexr_uint64) * offset_data[i].offsets[level_index][j].size();
13856  sum += num_bytes;
13857  assert(sum <= total_size);
13858  memcpy(memory_ptr,
13859  reinterpret_cast<unsigned char*>(&offset_data[i].offsets[level_index][j][0]),
13860  num_bytes);
13861  memory_ptr += num_bytes;
13862  }
13863  level_image = level_image->next_level;
13864  }
13865  }
13866  else {
13867  size_t num_bytes = sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64) * static_cast<size_t>(chunk_count[i]);
13868  sum += num_bytes;
13869  assert(sum <= total_size);
13870  std::vector<tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64>& offsets = offset_data[i].offsets[0][0];
13871  memcpy(memory_ptr, reinterpret_cast<unsigned char*>(&offsets[0]), num_bytes);
13872  memory_ptr += num_bytes;
13873  }
13874  }
13875 
13876  // Writing chunk data
13877  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < num_parts; ++i) {
13878  for (size_t j = 0; j < static_cast<size_t>(chunk_count[i]); ++j) {
13879  if (num_parts > 1) {
13880  sum += 4;
13881  assert(sum <= total_size);
13882  unsigned int part_number = i;
13883  swap4(&part_number);
13884  memcpy(memory_ptr, &part_number, 4);
13885  memory_ptr += 4;
13886  }
13887  sum += data_lists[i][j].size();
13888  assert(sum <= total_size);
13889  memcpy(memory_ptr, &data_lists[i][j][0], data_lists[i][j].size());
13890  memory_ptr += data_lists[i][j].size();
13891  }
13892  }
13893  assert(sum == total_size);
13894  return total_size; // OK
13895  }
13896 
13897 } // tinyexr
13898 
13899 size_t SaveEXRImageToMemory(const EXRImage* exr_image,
13900  const EXRHeader* exr_header,
13901  unsigned char** memory_out, const char** err) {
13902  return tinyexr::SaveEXRNPartImageToMemory(exr_image, &exr_header, 1, memory_out, err);
13903 }
13904 
13905 int SaveEXRImageToFile(const EXRImage *exr_image, const EXRHeader *exr_header,
13906  const char *filename, const char **err) {
13907  if (exr_image == NULL || filename == NULL ||
13908  exr_header->compression_type < 0) {
13909  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid argument for SaveEXRImageToFile", err);
13910  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
13911  }
13912 
13913 #if !TINYEXR_USE_PIZ
13914  if (exr_header->compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PIZ) {
13915  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("PIZ compression is not supported in this build",
13916  err);
