13917  return TINYEXR_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE;
13918  }
13919 #endif
13920 
13921 #if !TINYEXR_USE_ZFP
13922  if (exr_header->compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZFP) {
13923  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("ZFP compression is not supported in this build",
13924  err);
13925  return TINYEXR_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE;
13926  }
13927 #endif
13928 
13929  FILE *fp = NULL;
13930 #ifdef _WIN32
13931 #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__) // MSVC, MinGW gcc or clang
13932  errno_t errcode =
13933  _wfopen_s(&fp, tinyexr::UTF8ToWchar(filename).c_str(), L"wb");
13934  if (errcode != 0) {
13935  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot write a file: " + std::string(filename),
13936  err);
13937  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_WRITE_FILE;
13938  }
13939 #else
13940  // Unknown compiler
13941  fp = fopen(filename, "wb");
13942 #endif
13943 #else
13944  fp = fopen(filename, "wb");
13945 #endif
13946  if (!fp) {
13947  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot write a file: " + std::string(filename),
13948  err);
13949  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_WRITE_FILE;
13950  }
13951 
13952  unsigned char *mem = NULL;
13953  size_t mem_size = SaveEXRImageToMemory(exr_image, exr_header, &mem, err);
13954  if (mem_size == 0) {
13955  return TINYEXR_ERROR_SERIALZATION_FAILED;
13956  }
13957 
13958  size_t written_size = 0;
13959  if ((mem_size > 0) && mem) {
13960  written_size = fwrite(mem, 1, mem_size, fp);
13961  }
13962  free(mem);
13963 
13964  fclose(fp);
13965 
13966  if (written_size != mem_size) {
13967  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot write a file", err);
13968  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_WRITE_FILE;
13969  }
13970 
13971  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
13972 }
13973 
13974 size_t SaveEXRMultipartImageToMemory(const EXRImage* exr_images,
13975  const EXRHeader** exr_headers,
13976  unsigned int num_parts,
13977  unsigned char** memory_out, const char** err) {
13978  if (exr_images == NULL || exr_headers == NULL || num_parts < 2 ||
13979  memory_out == NULL) {
13980  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid argument for SaveEXRNPartImageToMemory",
13981  err);
13982  return 0;
13983  }
13984  return tinyexr::SaveEXRNPartImageToMemory(exr_images, exr_headers, num_parts, memory_out, err);
13985 }
13986 
13987 int SaveEXRMultipartImageToFile(const EXRImage* exr_images,
13988  const EXRHeader** exr_headers,
13989  unsigned int num_parts,
13990  const char* filename,
13991  const char** err) {
13992  if (exr_images == NULL || exr_headers == NULL || num_parts < 2) {
13993  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid argument for SaveEXRMultipartImageToFile",
13994  err);
13995  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
13996  }
13997 
13998  FILE *fp = NULL;
13999 #ifdef _WIN32
14000 #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__) // MSVC, MinGW gcc or clang
14001  errno_t errcode =
14002  _wfopen_s(&fp, tinyexr::UTF8ToWchar(filename).c_str(), L"wb");
14003  if (errcode != 0) {
14004  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot write a file: " + std::string(filename),
14005  err);
14006  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_WRITE_FILE;
14007  }
14008 #else
14009  // Unknown compiler
14010  fp = fopen(filename, "wb");
14011 #endif
14012 #else
14013  fp = fopen(filename, "wb");
14014 #endif
14015  if (!fp) {
14016  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot write a file: " + std::string(filename),
14017  err);
14018  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_WRITE_FILE;
14019  }
14020 
14021  unsigned char *mem = NULL;
14022  size_t mem_size = SaveEXRMultipartImageToMemory(exr_images, exr_headers, num_parts, &mem, err);
14023  if (mem_size == 0) {
14024  return TINYEXR_ERROR_SERIALZATION_FAILED;
14025  }
14026 
14027  size_t written_size = 0;
14028  if ((mem_size > 0) && mem) {
14029  written_size = fwrite(mem, 1, mem_size, fp);
14030  }
14031  free(mem);
14032 
14033  fclose(fp);
14034 
14035  if (written_size != mem_size) {
14036  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot write a file", err);
14037  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_WRITE_FILE;
14038  }
14039 
14040  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
14041 }
14042 
14043 int LoadDeepEXR(DeepImage *deep_image, const char *filename, const char **err) {
14044  if (deep_image == NULL) {
14045  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid argument for LoadDeepEXR", err);
14046  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
14047  }
14048 
14049 #ifdef _WIN32
14050  FILE *fp = NULL;
14051 #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__) // MSVC, MinGW gcc or clang
14052  errno_t errcode =
14053  _wfopen_s(&fp, tinyexr::UTF8ToWchar(filename).c_str(), L"rb");
14054  if (errcode != 0) {
14055  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot read a file " + std::string(filename),
14056  err);
14057  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_OPEN_FILE;
14058  }
14059 #else
14060  // Unknown compiler
14061  fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
14062 #endif
14063  if (!fp) {
14064  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot read a file " + std::string(filename),
14065  err);
14066  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_OPEN_FILE;
14067  }
14068 #else
14069  FILE *fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
14070  if (!fp) {
14071  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot read a file " + std::string(filename),
14072  err);
14073  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_OPEN_FILE;
14074  }
14075 #endif
14076 
14077  size_t filesize;
14078  // Compute size
14079  fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_END);
14080  filesize = static_cast<size_t>(ftell(fp));
14081  fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_SET);
14082 
14083  if (filesize == 0) {
14084  fclose(fp);
14085  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("File size is zero : " + std::string(filename),
14086  err);
14087  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_FILE;
14088  }
14089 
14090  std::vector<char> buf(filesize); // @todo { use mmap }
14091  {
14092  size_t ret;
14093  ret = fread(&buf[0], 1, filesize, fp);
14094  assert(ret == filesize);
14095  (void)ret;
14096  }
14097  fclose(fp);
14098 
14099  const char *head = &buf[0];
14100  const char *marker = &buf[0];
14101 
14102  // Header check.
14103  {
14104  const char header[] = { 0x76, 0x2f, 0x31, 0x01 };
14105 
14106  if (memcmp(marker, header, 4) != 0) {
14107  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid magic number", err);
14108  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_MAGIC_NUMBER;
14109  }
14110  marker += 4;
14111  }
14112 
14113  // Version, scanline.
14114  {
14115  // ver 2.0, scanline, deep bit on(0x800)
14116  // must be [2, 0, 0, 0]
14117  if (marker[0] != 2 || marker[1] != 8 || marker[2] != 0 || marker[3] != 0) {
14118  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Unsupported version or scanline", err);
14119  return TINYEXR_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT;
14120  }
14121 
14122  marker += 4;
14123  }
14124 
14125  int dx = -1;
14126  int dy = -1;
14127  int dw = -1;
14128  int dh = -1;
14129  int num_scanline_blocks = 1; // 16 for ZIP compression.
14130  int compression_type = -1;
14131  int num_channels = -1;
14132  std::vector<tinyexr::ChannelInfo> channels;
14133 
14134  // Read attributes
14135  size_t size = filesize - tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize;
14136  for (;;) {
14137  if (0 == size) {
14138  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
14139  }
14140  else if (marker[0] == '\0') {
14141  marker++;
14142  size--;
14143  break;
14144  }
14145 
14146  std::string attr_name;
14147  std::string attr_type;
14148  std::vector<unsigned char> data;
14149  size_t marker_size;
14150  if (!tinyexr::ReadAttribute(&attr_name, &attr_type, &data, &marker_size,
14151  marker, size)) {
14152  std::stringstream ss;
14153  ss << "Failed to parse attribute\n";
14154  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(ss.str(), err);
14155  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
14156  }
14157  marker += marker_size;
14158  size -= marker_size;
14159 
14160  if (attr_name.compare("compression") == 0) {
14161  compression_type = data[0];
14162  if (compression_type > TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PIZ) {
14163  std::stringstream ss;
14164  ss << "Unsupported compression type : " << compression_type;
14165  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(ss.str(), err);
14166  return TINYEXR_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT;
14167  }
14168 
14169  if (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIP) {
14170  num_scanline_blocks = 16;
14171  }
14172 
14173  }
14174  else if (attr_name.compare("channels") == 0) {
14175  // name: zero-terminated string, from 1 to 255 bytes long
14176  // pixel type: int, possible values are: UINT = 0 HALF = 1 FLOAT = 2
14177  // pLinear: unsigned char, possible values are 0 and 1
14178  // reserved: three chars, should be zero
14179  // xSampling: int
14180  // ySampling: int
14181 
14182  if (!tinyexr::ReadChannelInfo(channels, data)) {
14183  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Failed to parse channel info", err);
14184  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
14185  }
14186 
14187  num_channels = static_cast<int>(channels.size());
14188 
14189  if (num_channels < 1) {
14190  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid channels format", err);
14191  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
14192  }
14193 
14194  }
14195  else if (attr_name.compare("dataWindow") == 0) {
14196  memcpy(&dx, &data.at(0), sizeof(int));
14197  memcpy(&dy, &data.at(4), sizeof(int));
14198  memcpy(&dw, &data.at(8), sizeof(int));
14199  memcpy(&dh, &data.at(12), sizeof(int));
14200  tinyexr::swap4(&dx);
14201  tinyexr::swap4(&dy);
14202  tinyexr::swap4(&dw);
14203  tinyexr::swap4(&dh);
14204 
14205  }
14206  else if (attr_name.compare("displayWindow") == 0) {
14207  int x;
14208  int y;
14209  int w;
14210  int h;
14211  memcpy(&x, &data.at(0), sizeof(int));
14212  memcpy(&y, &data.at(4), sizeof(int));
14213  memcpy(&w, &data.at(8), sizeof(int));
14214  memcpy(&h, &data.at(12), sizeof(int));
14215  tinyexr::swap4(&x);
14216  tinyexr::swap4(&y);
14217  tinyexr::swap4(&w);
14218  tinyexr::swap4(&h);
14219  }
14220  }
14221 
14222  assert(dx >= 0);
14223  assert(dy >= 0);
14224  assert(dw >= 0);
14225  assert(dh >= 0);
14226  assert(num_channels >= 1);
14227 
14228  int data_width = dw - dx + 1;
14229  int data_height = dh - dy + 1;
14230 
14231  std::vector<float> image(
14232  static_cast<size_t>(data_width * data_height * 4)); // 4 = RGBA
14233 
14234  // Read offset tables.
14235  int num_blocks = data_height / num_scanline_blocks;
14236  if (num_blocks * num_scanline_blocks < data_height) {
14237  num_blocks++;
14238  }
14239 
14240  std::vector<tinyexr::tinyexr_int64> offsets(static_cast<size_t>(num_blocks));
14241 
14242  for (size_t y = 0; y < static_cast<size_t>(num_blocks); y++) {
14243  tinyexr::tinyexr_int64 offset;
14244  memcpy(&offset, marker, sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_int64));
14245  tinyexr::swap8(reinterpret_cast<tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 *>(&offset));
14246  marker += sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_int64); // = 8
14247  offsets[y] = offset;
14248  }
14249 
14250 #if TINYEXR_USE_PIZ
14251  if ((compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_NONE) ||
14252  (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_RLE) ||
14253  (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIPS) ||
14254  (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIP) ||
14255  (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_PIZ)) {
14256 #else
14257  if ((compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_NONE) ||
14258  (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_RLE) ||
14259  (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIPS) ||
14260  (compression_type == TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIP)) {
14261 #endif
14262  // OK
14263  }
14264  else {
14265  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Unsupported compression format", err);
14266  return TINYEXR_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT;
14267  }
14268 
14269  deep_image->image = static_cast<float ***>(
14270  malloc(sizeof(float **) * static_cast<size_t>(num_channels)));
14271  for (int c = 0; c < num_channels; c++) {
14272  deep_image->image[c] = static_cast<float **>(
14273  malloc(sizeof(float *) * static_cast<size_t>(data_height)));
14274  for (int y = 0; y < data_height; y++) {
14275  }
14276  }
14277 
14278  deep_image->offset_table = static_cast<int **>(
14279  malloc(sizeof(int *) * static_cast<size_t>(data_height)));
14280  for (int y = 0; y < data_height; y++) {
14281  deep_image->offset_table[y] = static_cast<int *>(
14282  malloc(sizeof(int) * static_cast<size_t>(data_width)));
14283  }
14284 
14285  for (size_t y = 0; y < static_cast<size_t>(num_blocks); y++) {
14286  const unsigned char *data_ptr =
14287  reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(head + offsets[y]);
14288 
14289  // int: y coordinate
14290  // int64: packed size of pixel offset table
14291  // int64: packed size of sample data
14292  // int64: unpacked size of sample data
14293  // compressed pixel offset table
14294  // compressed sample data
14295  int line_no;
14296  tinyexr::tinyexr_int64 packedOffsetTableSize;
14297  tinyexr::tinyexr_int64 packedSampleDataSize;
14298  tinyexr::tinyexr_int64 unpackedSampleDataSize;
14299  memcpy(&line_no, data_ptr, sizeof(int));
14300  memcpy(&packedOffsetTableSize, data_ptr + 4,
14301  sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_int64));
14302  memcpy(&packedSampleDataSize, data_ptr + 12,
14303  sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_int64));
14304  memcpy(&unpackedSampleDataSize, data_ptr + 20,
14305  sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_int64));
14306 
14307  tinyexr::swap4(&line_no);
14308  tinyexr::swap8(
14309  reinterpret_cast<tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 *>(&packedOffsetTableSize));
14310  tinyexr::swap8(
14311  reinterpret_cast<tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 *>(&packedSampleDataSize));
14312  tinyexr::swap8(
14313  reinterpret_cast<tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 *>(&unpackedSampleDataSize));
14314 
14315  std::vector<int> pixelOffsetTable(static_cast<size_t>(data_width));
14316 
14317  // decode pixel offset table.
14318  {
14319  unsigned long dstLen =
14320  static_cast<unsigned long>(pixelOffsetTable.size() * sizeof(int));
14321  if (!tinyexr::DecompressZip(
14322  reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(&pixelOffsetTable.at(0)),
14323  &dstLen, data_ptr + 28,
14324  static_cast<unsigned long>(packedOffsetTableSize))) {
14325  return false;
14326  }
14327 
14328  assert(dstLen == pixelOffsetTable.size() * sizeof(int));
14329  for (size_t i = 0; i < static_cast<size_t>(data_width); i++) {
14330  deep_image->offset_table[y][i] = pixelOffsetTable[i];
14331  }
14332  }
14333 
14334  std::vector<unsigned char> sample_data(
14335  static_cast<size_t>(unpackedSampleDataSize));
14336 
14337  // decode sample data.
14338  {
14339  unsigned long dstLen = static_cast<unsigned long>(unpackedSampleDataSize);
14340  if (dstLen) {
14341  if (!tinyexr::DecompressZip(
14342  reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(&sample_data.at(0)), &dstLen,
14343  data_ptr + 28 + packedOffsetTableSize,
14344  static_cast<unsigned long>(packedSampleDataSize))) {
14345  return false;
14346  }
14347  assert(dstLen == static_cast<unsigned long>(unpackedSampleDataSize));
14348  }
14349  }
14350 
14351  // decode sample
14352  int sampleSize = -1;
14353  std::vector<int> channel_offset_list(static_cast<size_t>(num_channels));
14354  {
14355  int channel_offset = 0;
14356  for (size_t i = 0; i < static_cast<size_t>(num_channels); i++) {
14357  channel_offset_list[i] = channel_offset;
14358  if (channels[i].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_UINT) { // UINT
14359  channel_offset += 4;
14360  }
14361  else if (channels[i].pixel_type == TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF) { // half
14362  channel_offset += 2;
14363  }
14364  else if (channels[i].pixel_type ==
14365  TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT) { // float
14366  channel_offset += 4;
14367  }
14368  else {
14369  assert(0);
14370  }
14371  }
14372  sampleSize = channel_offset;
14373  }
14374  assert(sampleSize >= 2);
14375 
14376  assert(static_cast<size_t>(
14377  pixelOffsetTable[static_cast<size_t>(data_width - 1)] *
14378  sampleSize) == sample_data.size());
14379  int samples_per_line = static_cast<int>(sample_data.size()) / sampleSize;
14380 
14381  //
14382  // Alloc memory
14383  //
14384 
14385  //
14386  // pixel data is stored as image[channels][pixel_samples]
14387  //
14388  {
14389  tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 data_offset = 0;
14390  for (size_t c = 0; c < static_cast<size_t>(num_channels); c++) {
14391  deep_image->image[c][y] = static_cast<float *>(
14392  malloc(sizeof(float) * static_cast<size_t>(samples_per_line)));
14393 
14394  if (channels[c].pixel_type == 0) { // UINT
14395  for (size_t x = 0; x < static_cast<size_t>(samples_per_line); x++) {
14396  unsigned int ui;
14397  unsigned int *src_ptr = reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(
14398  &sample_data.at(size_t(data_offset) + x * sizeof(int)));
14399  tinyexr::cpy4(&ui, src_ptr);
14400  deep_image->image[c][y][x] = static_cast<float>(ui); // @fixme
14401  }
14402  data_offset +=
14403  sizeof(unsigned int) * static_cast<size_t>(samples_per_line);
14404  }
14405  else if (channels[c].pixel_type == 1) { // half
14406  for (size_t x = 0; x < static_cast<size_t>(samples_per_line); x++) {
14407  tinyexr::FP16 f16;
14408  const unsigned short *src_ptr = reinterpret_cast<unsigned short *>(
14409  &sample_data.at(size_t(data_offset) + x * sizeof(short)));
14410  tinyexr::cpy2(&(f16.u), src_ptr);
14411  tinyexr::FP32 f32 = half_to_float(f16);
14412  deep_image->image[c][y][x] = f32.f;
14413  }
14414  data_offset += sizeof(short) * static_cast<size_t>(samples_per_line);
14415  }
14416  else { // float
14417  for (size_t x = 0; x < static_cast<size_t>(samples_per_line); x++) {
14418  float f;
14419  const float *src_ptr = reinterpret_cast<float *>(
14420  &sample_data.at(size_t(data_offset) + x * sizeof(float)));
14421  tinyexr::cpy4(&f, src_ptr);
14422  deep_image->image[c][y][x] = f;
14423  }
14424  data_offset += sizeof(float) * static_cast<size_t>(samples_per_line);
14425  }
14426  }
14427  }
14428  } // y
14429 
14430  deep_image->width = data_width;
14431  deep_image->height = data_height;
14432 
14433  deep_image->channel_names = static_cast<const char **>(
14434  malloc(sizeof(const char *) * static_cast<size_t>(num_channels)));
14435  for (size_t c = 0; c < static_cast<size_t>(num_channels); c++) {
14436 #ifdef _WIN32
14437  deep_image->channel_names[c] = _strdup(channels[c].name.c_str());
14438 #else
14439  deep_image->channel_names[c] = strdup(channels[c].name.c_str());
14440 #endif
14441  }
14442  deep_image->num_channels = num_channels;
14443 
14444  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
14445  }
14446 
14447 void InitEXRImage(EXRImage *exr_image) {
14448  if (exr_image == NULL) {
14449  return;
14450  }
14451 
14452  exr_image->width = 0;
14453  exr_image->height = 0;
14454  exr_image->num_channels = 0;
14455 
14456  exr_image->images = NULL;
14457  exr_image->tiles = NULL;
14458  exr_image->next_level = NULL;
14459  exr_image->level_x = 0;
14460  exr_image->level_y = 0;
14461 
14462  exr_image->num_tiles = 0;
14463 }
14464 
14465 void FreeEXRErrorMessage(const char *msg) {
14466  if (msg) {
14467  free(reinterpret_cast<void *>(const_cast<char *>(msg)));
14468  }
14469  return;
14470 }
14471 
14472 void InitEXRHeader(EXRHeader *exr_header) {
14473  if (exr_header == NULL) {
14474  return;
14475  }
14476 
14477  memset(exr_header, 0, sizeof(EXRHeader));
14478 }
14479 
14480 int FreeEXRHeader(EXRHeader *exr_header) {
14481  if (exr_header == NULL) {
14482  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
14483  }
14484 
14485  if (exr_header->channels) {
14486  free(exr_header->channels);
14487  }
14488 
14489  if (exr_header->pixel_types) {
14490  free(exr_header->pixel_types);
14491  }
14492 
14493  if (exr_header->requested_pixel_types) {
14494  free(exr_header->requested_pixel_types);
14495  }
14496 
14497  for (int i = 0; i < exr_header->num_custom_attributes; i++) {
14498  if (exr_header->custom_attributes[i].value) {
14499  free(exr_header->custom_attributes[i].value);
14500  }
14501  }
14502 
14503  if (exr_header->custom_attributes) {
14504  free(exr_header->custom_attributes);
14505  }
14506 
14507  EXRSetNameAttr(exr_header, NULL);
14508 
14509  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
14510 }
14511 
14512 void EXRSetNameAttr(EXRHeader* exr_header, const char* name) {
14513  if (exr_header == NULL) {
14514  return;
14515  }
14516  memset(exr_header->name, 0, 256);
14517  if (name != NULL) {
14518  size_t len = std::min(strlen(name), (size_t)255);
14519  if (len) {
14520  memcpy(exr_header->name, name, len);
14521  }
14522  }
14523 }
14524 
14525 int EXRNumLevels(const EXRImage* exr_image) {
14526  if (exr_image == NULL) return 0;
14527  if (exr_image->images) return 1; // scanlines
14528  int levels = 1;
14529  const EXRImage* level_image = exr_image;
14530  while ((level_image = level_image->next_level)) ++levels;
14531  return levels;
14532 }
14533 
14534 int FreeEXRImage(EXRImage *exr_image) {
14535  if (exr_image == NULL) {
14536  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
14537  }
14538 
14539  if (exr_image->next_level) {
14540  FreeEXRImage(exr_image->next_level);
14541  delete exr_image->next_level;
14542  }
14543 
14544  for (int i = 0; i < exr_image->num_channels; i++) {
14545  if (exr_image->images && exr_image->images[i]) {
14546  free(exr_image->images[i]);
14547  }
14548  }
14549 
14550  if (exr_image->images) {
14551  free(exr_image->images);
14552  }
14553 
14554  if (exr_image->tiles) {
14555  for (int tid = 0; tid < exr_image->num_tiles; tid++) {
14556  for (int i = 0; i < exr_image->num_channels; i++) {
14557  if (exr_image->tiles[tid].images && exr_image->tiles[tid].images[i]) {
14558  free(exr_image->tiles[tid].images[i]);
14559  }
14560  }
14561  if (exr_image->tiles[tid].images) {
14562  free(exr_image->tiles[tid].images);
14563  }
14564  }
14565  free(exr_image->tiles);
14566  }
14567 
14568  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
14569 }
14570 
14571 int ParseEXRHeaderFromFile(EXRHeader *exr_header, const EXRVersion *exr_version,
14572  const char *filename, const char **err) {
14573  if (exr_header == NULL || exr_version == NULL || filename == NULL) {
14574  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid argument for ParseEXRHeaderFromFile",
14575  err);
14576  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
14577  }
14578 
14579  FILE *fp = NULL;
14580 #ifdef _WIN32
14581 #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__) // MSVC, MinGW gcc or clang
14582  errno_t errcode =
14583  _wfopen_s(&fp, tinyexr::UTF8ToWchar(filename).c_str(), L"rb");
14584  if (errcode != 0) {
14585  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot read file " + std::string(filename), err);
14586  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_FILE;
14587  }
14588 #else
14589  // Unknown compiler
14590  fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
14591 #endif
14592 #else
14593  fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
14594 #endif
14595  if (!fp) {
14596  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot read file " + std::string(filename), err);
14597  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_OPEN_FILE;
14598  }
14599 
14600  size_t filesize;
14601  // Compute size
14602  fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_END);
14603  filesize = static_cast<size_t>(ftell(fp));
14604  fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_SET);
14605 
14606  std::vector<unsigned char> buf(filesize); // @todo { use mmap }
14607  {
14608  size_t ret;
14609  ret = fread(&buf[0], 1, filesize, fp);
14610  assert(ret == filesize);
14611  fclose(fp);
14612 
14613  if (ret != filesize) {
14614  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("fread() error on " + std::string(filename),
14615  err);
14616  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_FILE;
14617  }
14618  }
14619 
14620  return ParseEXRHeaderFromMemory(exr_header, exr_version, &buf.at(0), filesize,
14621  err);
14622 }
14623 
14624 int ParseEXRMultipartHeaderFromMemory(EXRHeader ***exr_headers,
14625  int *num_headers,
14626  const EXRVersion *exr_version,
14627  const unsigned char *memory, size_t size,
14628  const char **err) {
14629  if (memory == NULL || exr_headers == NULL || num_headers == NULL ||
14630  exr_version == NULL) {
14631  // Invalid argument
14632  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(
14633  "Invalid argument for ParseEXRMultipartHeaderFromMemory", err);
14634  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
14635  }
14636 
14637  if (size < tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize) {
14638  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Data size too short", err);
14639  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
14640  }
14641 
14642  const unsigned char *marker = memory + tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize;
14643  size_t marker_size = size - tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize;
14644 
14645  std::vector<tinyexr::HeaderInfo> infos;
14646 
14647  for (;;) {
14648  tinyexr::HeaderInfo info;
14649  info.clear();
14650 
14651  std::string err_str;
14652  bool empty_header = false;
14653  int ret = ParseEXRHeader(&info, &empty_header, exr_version, &err_str,
14654  marker, marker_size);
14655 
14656  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
14657  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(err_str, err);
14658  return ret;
14659  }
14660 
14661  if (empty_header) {
14662  marker += 1; // skip '\0'
14663  break;
14664  }
14665 
14666  // `chunkCount` must exist in the header.
14667  if (info.chunk_count == 0) {
14668  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(
14669  "`chunkCount' attribute is not found in the header.", err);
14670  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
14671  }
14672 
14673  infos.push_back(info);
14674 
14675  // move to next header.
14676  marker += info.header_len;
14677  size -= info.header_len;
14678  }
14679 
14680  // allocate memory for EXRHeader and create array of EXRHeader pointers.
14681  (*exr_headers) =
14682  static_cast<EXRHeader **>(malloc(sizeof(EXRHeader *) * infos.size()));
14683  for (size_t i = 0; i < infos.size(); i++) {
14684  EXRHeader *exr_header = static_cast<EXRHeader *>(malloc(sizeof(EXRHeader)));
14685  memset(exr_header, 0, sizeof(EXRHeader));
14686 
14687  ConvertHeader(exr_header, infos[i]);
14688 
14689  exr_header->multipart = exr_version->multipart ? 1 : 0;
14690 
14691  (*exr_headers)[i] = exr_header;
14692  }
14693 
14694  (*num_headers) = static_cast<int>(infos.size());
14695 
14696  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
14697 }
14698 
14699 int ParseEXRMultipartHeaderFromFile(EXRHeader ***exr_headers, int *num_headers,
14700  const EXRVersion *exr_version,
14701  const char *filename, const char **err) {
14702  if (exr_headers == NULL || num_headers == NULL || exr_version == NULL ||
14703  filename == NULL) {
14704  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(
14705  "Invalid argument for ParseEXRMultipartHeaderFromFile()", err);
14706  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
14707  }
14708 
14709  FILE *fp = NULL;
14710 #ifdef _WIN32
14711 #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__) // MSVC, MinGW gcc or clang
14712  errno_t errcode =
14713  _wfopen_s(&fp, tinyexr::UTF8ToWchar(filename).c_str(), L"rb");
14714  if (errcode != 0) {
14715  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot read file " + std::string(filename), err);
14716  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_FILE;
14717  }
14718 #else
14719  // Unknown compiler
14720  fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
14721 #endif
14722 #else
14723  fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
14724 #endif
14725  if (!fp) {
14726  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot read file " + std::string(filename), err);
14727  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_OPEN_FILE;
14728  }
14729 
14730  size_t filesize;
14731  // Compute size
14732  fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_END);
14733  filesize = static_cast<size_t>(ftell(fp));
14734  fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_SET);
14735 
14736  std::vector<unsigned char> buf(filesize); // @todo { use mmap }
14737  {
14738  size_t ret;
14739  ret = fread(&buf[0], 1, filesize, fp);
14740  assert(ret == filesize);
14741  fclose(fp);
14742 
14743  if (ret != filesize) {
14744  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("`fread' error. file may be corrupted.", err);
14745  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_FILE;
14746  }
14747  }
14748 
14749  return ParseEXRMultipartHeaderFromMemory(
14750  exr_headers, num_headers, exr_version, &buf.at(0), filesize, err);
14751 }
14752 
14753 int ParseEXRVersionFromMemory(EXRVersion *version, const unsigned char *memory,
14754  size_t size) {
14755  if (version == NULL || memory == NULL) {
14756  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
14757  }
14758 
14759  if (size < tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize) {
14760  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
14761  }
14762 
14763  const unsigned char *marker = memory;
14764 
14765  // Header check.
14766  {
14767  const char header[] = { 0x76, 0x2f, 0x31, 0x01 };
14768 
14769  if (memcmp(marker, header, 4) != 0) {
14770  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_MAGIC_NUMBER;
14771  }
14772  marker += 4;
14773  }
14774 
14775  version->tiled = false;
14776  version->long_name = false;
14777  version->non_image = false;
14778  version->multipart = false;
14779 
14780  // Parse version header.
14781  {
14782  // must be 2
14783  if (marker[0] != 2) {
14784  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_EXR_VERSION;
14785  }
14786 
14787  if (version == NULL) {
14788  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS; // May OK
14789  }
14790 
14791  version->version = 2;
14792 
14793  if (marker[1] & 0x2) { // 9th bit
14794  version->tiled = true;
14795  }
14796  if (marker[1] & 0x4) { // 10th bit
14797  version->long_name = true;
14798  }
14799  if (marker[1] & 0x8) { // 11th bit
14800  version->non_image = true; // (deep image)
14801  }
14802  if (marker[1] & 0x10) { // 12th bit
14803  version->multipart = true;
14804  }
14805  }
14806 
14807  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
14808 }
14809 
14810 int ParseEXRVersionFromFile(EXRVersion *version, const char *filename) {
14811  if (filename == NULL) {
14812  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
14813  }
14814 
14815  FILE *fp = NULL;
14816 #ifdef _WIN32
14817 #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__) // MSVC, MinGW gcc or clang
14818  errno_t err = _wfopen_s(&fp, tinyexr::UTF8ToWchar(filename).c_str(), L"rb");
14819  if (err != 0) {
14820  // TODO(syoyo): return wfopen_s erro code
14821  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_OPEN_FILE;
14822  }
14823 #else
14824  // Unknown compiler
14825  fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
14826 #endif
14827 #else
14828  fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
14829 #endif
14830  if (!fp) {
14831  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_OPEN_FILE;
14832  }
14833 
14834  size_t file_size;
14835  // Compute size
14836  fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_END);
14837  file_size = static_cast<size_t>(ftell(fp));
14838  fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_SET);
14839 
14840  if (file_size < tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize) {
14841  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_FILE;
14842  }
14843 
14844  unsigned char buf[tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize];
14845  size_t ret = fread(&buf[0], 1, tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize, fp);
14846  fclose(fp);
14847 
14848  if (ret != tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize) {
14849  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_FILE;
14850  }
14851 
14852  return ParseEXRVersionFromMemory(version, buf, tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize);
14853 }
14854 
14855 int LoadEXRMultipartImageFromMemory(EXRImage *exr_images,
14856  const EXRHeader **exr_headers,
14857  unsigned int num_parts,
14858  const unsigned char *memory,
14859  const size_t size, const char **err) {
14860  if (exr_images == NULL || exr_headers == NULL || num_parts == 0 ||
14861  memory == NULL || (size <= tinyexr::kEXRVersionSize)) {
14862  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(
14863  "Invalid argument for LoadEXRMultipartImageFromMemory()", err);
14864  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
14865  }
14866 
14867  // compute total header size.
14868  size_t total_header_size = 0;
14869  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < num_parts; i++) {
14870  if (exr_headers[i]->header_len == 0) {
14871  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("EXRHeader variable is not initialized.", err);
14872  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
14873  }
14874 
14875  total_header_size += exr_headers[i]->header_len;
14876  }
14877 
14878  const char *marker = reinterpret_cast<const char *>(
14879  memory + total_header_size + 4 +
14880  4); // +8 for magic number and version header.
14881 
14882  marker += 1; // Skip empty header.
14883 
14884  // NOTE 1:
14885  // In multipart image, There is 'part number' before chunk data.
14886  // 4 byte : part number
14887  // 4+ : chunk
14888  //
14889  // NOTE 2:
14890  // EXR spec says 'part number' is 'unsigned long' but actually this is
14891  // 'unsigned int(4 bytes)' in OpenEXR implementation...
14892  // http://www.openexr.com/openexrfilelayout.pdf
14893 
14894  // Load chunk offset table.
14895  std::vector<tinyexr::OffsetData> chunk_offset_table_list;
14896  chunk_offset_table_list.reserve(num_parts);
14897  for (size_t i = 0; i < static_cast<size_t>(num_parts); i++) {
14898  chunk_offset_table_list.resize(chunk_offset_table_list.size() + 1);
14899  tinyexr::OffsetData& offset_data = chunk_offset_table_list.back();
14900  if (!exr_headers[i]->tiled || exr_headers[i]->tile_level_mode == TINYEXR_TILE_ONE_LEVEL) {
14901  tinyexr::InitSingleResolutionOffsets(offset_data, exr_headers[i]->chunk_count);
14902  std::vector<tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64>& offset_table = offset_data.offsets[0][0];
14903 
14904  for (size_t c = 0; c < offset_table.size(); c++) {
14905  tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 offset;
14906  memcpy(&offset, marker, 8);
14907  tinyexr::swap8(&offset);
14908 
14909  if (offset >= size) {
14910  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid offset size in EXR header chunks.",
14911  err);
14912  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
14913  }
14914 
14915  offset_table[c] = offset + 4; // +4 to skip 'part number'
14916  marker += 8;
14917  }
14918  }
14919  else {
14920  {
14921  std::vector<int> num_x_tiles, num_y_tiles;
14922  tinyexr::PrecalculateTileInfo(num_x_tiles, num_y_tiles, exr_headers[i]);
14923  int num_blocks = InitTileOffsets(offset_data, exr_headers[i], num_x_tiles, num_y_tiles);
14924  if (num_blocks != exr_headers[i]->chunk_count) {
14925  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid offset table size.", err);
14926  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
14927  }
14928  }
14929  for (unsigned int l = 0; l < offset_data.offsets.size(); ++l) {
14930  for (unsigned int dy = 0; dy < offset_data.offsets[l].size(); ++dy) {
14931  for (unsigned int dx = 0; dx < offset_data.offsets[l][dy].size(); ++dx) {
14932  tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64 offset;
14933  memcpy(&offset, marker, sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64));
14934  tinyexr::swap8(&offset);
14935  if (offset >= size) {
14936  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid offset size in EXR header chunks.",
14937  err);
14938  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
14939  }
14940  offset_data.offsets[l][dy][dx] = offset + 4; // +4 to skip 'part number'
14941  marker += sizeof(tinyexr::tinyexr_uint64); // = 8
14942  }
14943  }
14944  }
14945  }
14946  }
14947 
14948  // Decode image.
14949  for (size_t i = 0; i < static_cast<size_t>(num_parts); i++) {
14950  tinyexr::OffsetData &offset_data = chunk_offset_table_list[i];
14951 
14952  // First check 'part number' is identitical to 'i'
14953  for (unsigned int l = 0; l < offset_data.offsets.size(); ++l)
14954  for (unsigned int dy = 0; dy < offset_data.offsets[l].size(); ++dy)
14955  for (unsigned int dx = 0; dx < offset_data.offsets[l][dy].size(); ++dx) {
14956 
14957  const unsigned char *part_number_addr =
14958  memory + offset_data.offsets[l][dy][dx] - 4; // -4 to move to 'part number' field.
14959  unsigned int part_no;
14960  memcpy(&part_no, part_number_addr, sizeof(unsigned int)); // 4
14961  tinyexr::swap4(&part_no);
14962 
14963  if (part_no != i) {
14964  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Invalid `part number' in EXR header chunks.",
14965  err);
14966  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_DATA;
14967  }
14968  }
14969 
14970  std::string e;
14971  int ret = tinyexr::DecodeChunk(&exr_images[i], exr_headers[i], offset_data,
14972  memory, size, &e);
14973  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
14974  if (!e.empty()) {
14975  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(e, err);
14976  }
14977  return ret;
14978  }
14979  }
14980 
14981  return TINYEXR_SUCCESS;
14982 }
14983 
14984 int LoadEXRMultipartImageFromFile(EXRImage *exr_images,
14985  const EXRHeader **exr_headers,
14986  unsigned int num_parts, const char *filename,
14987  const char **err) {
14988  if (exr_images == NULL || exr_headers == NULL || num_parts == 0) {
14989  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(
14990  "Invalid argument for LoadEXRMultipartImageFromFile", err);
14991  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
14992  }
14993 
14994  FILE *fp = NULL;
14995 #ifdef _WIN32
14996 #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__) // MSVC, MinGW gcc or clang
14997  errno_t errcode =
14998  _wfopen_s(&fp, tinyexr::UTF8ToWchar(filename).c_str(), L"rb");
14999  if (errcode != 0) {
15000  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot read file " + std::string(filename), err);
15001  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_OPEN_FILE;
15002  }
15003 #else
15004  // Unknown compiler
15005  fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
15006 #endif
15007 #else
15008  fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
15009 #endif
15010  if (!fp) {
15011  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage("Cannot read file " + std::string(filename), err);
15012  return TINYEXR_ERROR_CANT_OPEN_FILE;
15013  }
15014 
15015  size_t filesize;
15016  // Compute size
15017  fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_END);
15018  filesize = static_cast<size_t>(ftell(fp));
15019  fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_SET);
15020 
15021  std::vector<unsigned char> buf(filesize); // @todo { use mmap }
15022  {
15023  size_t ret;
15024  ret = fread(&buf[0], 1, filesize, fp);
15025  assert(ret == filesize);
15026  fclose(fp);
15027  (void)ret;
15028  }
15029 
15030  return LoadEXRMultipartImageFromMemory(exr_images, exr_headers, num_parts,
15031  &buf.at(0), filesize, err);
15032 }
15033 
15034 int SaveEXR(const float *data, int width, int height, int components,
15035  const int save_as_fp16, const char *outfilename, const char **err) {
15036  if ((components == 1) || components == 3 || components == 4) {
15037  // OK
15038  }
15039  else {
15040  std::stringstream ss;
15041  ss << "Unsupported component value : " << components << std::endl;
15042 
15043  tinyexr::SetErrorMessage(ss.str(), err);
15044  return TINYEXR_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
15045  }
15046 
15047  EXRHeader header;
15048  InitEXRHeader(&header);
15049 
15050  if ((width < 16) && (height < 16)) {
15051  // No compression for small image.
15052  header.compression_type = TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_NONE;
15053  }
15054  else {
15055  header.compression_type = TINYEXR_COMPRESSIONTYPE_ZIP;
15056  }
15057 
15058  EXRImage image;
15059  InitEXRImage(&image);
15060 
15061  image.num_channels = components;
15062 
15063  std::vector<float> images[4];
15064 
15065  if (components == 1) {
15066  images[0].resize(static_cast<size_t>(width * height));
15067  memcpy(images[0].data(), data, sizeof(float) * size_t(width * height));
15068  }
15069  else {
15070  images[0].resize(static_cast<size_t>(width * height));
15071  images[1].resize(static_cast<size_t>(width * height));
15072  images[2].resize(static_cast<size_t>(width * height));
15073  images[3].resize(static_cast<size_t>(width * height));
15074 
15075  // Split RGB(A)RGB(A)RGB(A)... into R, G and B(and A) layers
15076  for (size_t i = 0; i < static_cast<size_t>(width * height); i++) {
15077  images[0][i] = data[static_cast<size_t>(components) * i + 0];
15078  images[1][i] = data[static_cast<size_t>(components) * i + 1];
15079  images[2][i] = data[static_cast<size_t>(components) * i + 2];
15080  if (components == 4) {
15081  images[3][i] = data[static_cast<size_t>(components) * i + 3];
15082  }
15083  }
15084  }
15085 
15086  float *image_ptr[4] = { 0, 0, 0, 0 };
15087  if (components == 4) {
15088  image_ptr[0] = &(images[3].at(0)); // A
15089  image_ptr[1] = &(images[2].at(0)); // B
15090  image_ptr[2] = &(images[1].at(0)); // G
15091  image_ptr[3] = &(images[0].at(0)); // R
15092  }
15093  else if (components == 3) {
15094  image_ptr[0] = &(images[2].at(0)); // B
15095  image_ptr[1] = &(images[1].at(0)); // G
15096  image_ptr[2] = &(images[0].at(0)); // R
15097  }
15098  else if (components == 1) {
15099  image_ptr[0] = &(images[0].at(0)); // A
15100  }
15101 
15102  image.images = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char **>(image_ptr);
15103  image.width = width;
15104  image.height = height;
15105 
15106  header.num_channels = components;
15107  header.channels = static_cast<EXRChannelInfo *>(malloc(
15108  sizeof(EXRChannelInfo) * static_cast<size_t>(header.num_channels)));
15109  // Must be (A)BGR order, since most of EXR viewers expect this channel order.
15110  if (components == 4) {
15111 #ifdef _MSC_VER
15112  strncpy_s(header.channels[0].name, "A", 255);
15113  strncpy_s(header.channels[1].name, "B", 255);
15114  strncpy_s(header.channels[2].name, "G", 255);
15115  strncpy_s(header.channels[3].name, "R", 255);
15116 #else
15117  strncpy(header.channels[0].name, "A", 255);
15118  strncpy(header.channels[1].name, "B", 255);
15119  strncpy(header.channels[2].name, "G", 255);
15120  strncpy(header.channels[3].name, "R", 255);
15121 #endif
15122  header.channels[0].name[strlen("A")] = '\0';
15123  header.channels[1].name[strlen("B")] = '\0';
15124  header.channels[2].name[strlen("G")] = '\0';
15125  header.channels[3].name[strlen("R")] = '\0';
15126  }
15127  else if (components == 3) {
15128 #ifdef _MSC_VER
15129  strncpy_s(header.channels[0].name, "B", 255);
15130  strncpy_s(header.channels[1].name, "G", 255);
15131  strncpy_s(header.channels[2].name, "R", 255);
15132 #else
15133  strncpy(header.channels[0].name, "B", 255);
15134  strncpy(header.channels[1].name, "G", 255);
15135  strncpy(header.channels[2].name, "R", 255);
15136 #endif
15137  header.channels[0].name[strlen("B")] = '\0';
15138  header.channels[1].name[strlen("G")] = '\0';
15139  header.channels[2].name[strlen("R")] = '\0';
15140  }
15141  else {
15142 #ifdef _MSC_VER
15143  strncpy_s(header.channels[0].name, "A", 255);
15144 #else
15145  strncpy(header.channels[0].name, "A", 255);
15146 #endif
15147  header.channels[0].name[strlen("A")] = '\0';
15148  }
15149 
15150  header.pixel_types = static_cast<int *>(
15151  malloc(sizeof(int) * static_cast<size_t>(header.num_channels)));
15152  header.requested_pixel_types = static_cast<int *>(
15153  malloc(sizeof(int) * static_cast<size_t>(header.num_channels)));
15154  for (int i = 0; i < header.num_channels; i++) {
15155  header.pixel_types[i] =
15156  TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT; // pixel type of input image
15157 
15158  if (save_as_fp16 > 0) {
15159  header.requested_pixel_types[i] =
15160  TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_HALF; // save with half(fp16) pixel format
15161  }
15162  else {
15163  header.requested_pixel_types[i] =
15164  TINYEXR_PIXELTYPE_FLOAT; // save with float(fp32) pixel format(i.e.
15165  // no precision reduction)
15166  }
15167  }
15168 
15169  int ret = SaveEXRImageToFile(&image, &header, outfilename, err);
15170  if (ret != TINYEXR_SUCCESS) {
15171  return ret;
15172  }
15173 
15174  free(header.channels);
15175  free(header.pixel_types);
15176  free(header.requested_pixel_types);
15177 
15178  return ret;
15179 }
15180 
15181 #ifdef __clang__
15182 // zero-as-null-ppinter-constant
15183 #pragma clang diagnostic pop
15184 #endif
15185 
15186 #endif // TINYEXR_IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED
15187 #endif // TINYEXR_IMPLEMENTATION
data
Definition: data.py:1
flip
Definition: flip.py:1
_DeepImage
Definition: tinyexr.h:291
_EXRAttribute
Definition: tinyexr.h:176
_EXRBox2i
Definition: tinyexr.h:205
_EXRChannelInfo
Definition: tinyexr.h:184
_EXRHeader
Definition: tinyexr.h:212
_EXRImage
Definition: tinyexr.h:267
_EXRMultiPartHeader
Definition: tinyexr.h:261
_EXRMultiPartImage
Definition: tinyexr.h:285
_EXRTile
Definition: tinyexr.h:193
_EXRVersion
Definition: tinyexr.h:164
  • external
  • flip
  • cpp
  • common
  • tinyexr.h
  • Generated by 1.9.1
